655506746.name: Quiet Beach On Weekdays
655506746.author: a TripAdvisor user
655506746.reviewBody: The taxi drop off is right at the public entrance to the beach. If taking the bus, it turns off the beach access road leaving you with a walk of 100 meters or so. On weekdays it is quite quiet, on weekends it will be more crowded. The umbrellas and four chairs can be rented for as long as you like at a cost of $180 pesos, which seems to be the standard. No sewage smell when we were there, don\'t know what that review is all about. The drinks and food service to your umbrella is reliable and the goods are very reasonably priced. Knowing at least rudimentary Spanish is very helpful - this is not a 5 star resort where everyone speaks perfect English, German, Japanese, or what have you. .

655313135.name: Very pleasant beach in a beautiful bay
655313135.author: a TripAdvisor user
655313135.reviewBody: The "beach club" concept is common in Mexico. You rent chairs/table/umbrella and can stay as long as you want (that day). 180 pesos seems to be standard on beaches in Manzanillo. It\'s a fair price for a lovely setting. There is table service for food/drinks, no pressure at all. Same with some very low-key beach vendors who strolled by. Clear, clean water, a short beach for strolling but very pleasant. We were the only non-Mexican beach-goers today, so it wasn\'t touristy. Business is conducted in Spanish, the local language. A 60-peso taxi ride from the Las Brisas area of Manzanillo.

652455977.name: Beach visit
652455977.author: a TripAdvisor user
652455977.reviewBody: This beach is basically for the locals. They allow you to bring your own drinks n food. You can order snacks n drinks but  little English is spoken by the friendly waitstaff. Strong smell of sewage on beach. Not really swimmable since there was a strong undertow.  Trinkets and handmade souvenirs are sold at reasonable prices.  There are much nicer beaches in the area. Skip this one.

641338270.name: FANTASTIC
641338270.author: a TripAdvisor user
641338270.reviewBody: Best swimming experience we\'ve ever had on the Pacific side of Mexico.  The beach is large and clean, the water very clean and warm with no rocks or seaweed.

640747473.name: Gorgeous beach
640747473.author: a TripAdvisor user
640747473.reviewBody: My kid had tons of fun snorkeling saw many fish, the water was warm and clean. All around gorgeous. There\u2019s also venders and beach service.

640194899.name: Snorkeling
640194899.author: a TripAdvisor user
640194899.reviewBody: This is hands down the best place to snorkel without having to pay for a tour. Great for beginners. Going up down over and around the rocks on the right side you\'ll see plenty of fish and usually stingrays snakes and morrey eels as well. Up the right side it\'s deeper and darker but likely to see lots of larger fish. Calm narrow bay.

626569062.name: My fav. calm beach of Manzanillo
626569062.author: a TripAdvisor user
626569062.reviewBody: This a really familiar beach where kids and parents can be at the ocean swimming without fear. There are two restaurants where you can get seafood and it tastes good, it\'s also inexpensive. On the other hand, if you want to have a table and two chairs in the beach, it will cost you about $180 pesos + whatever you buy there. \nYou can stay in the corners of the beach -in my opinion, the corners are the best to swim and stay- but they are usually crowded. Water is not cold and the waves are not brutal, they are calm. \nThere is a hotel and a department tower there but it\'s not a private beach.

604428626.name: Nice beach, but dangerous
604428626.author: a TripAdvisor user
604428626.reviewBody: The beach is small and nice. The problem of this beach is that the sea is soon very deep and I heard that many persons died in the past, because they were not expert swimmer and the current brought them far away from the beach. So, if you are not a good swimmer, better to avoid it.

598547724.name: Nice little beach
598547724.author: a TripAdvisor user
598547724.reviewBody:
Probably the nicer beach in Manzanillo for your family, clean, and accessible. 
Taking your own meals and drinks is advised but please take your trash with you. 

Dogs are not allowed tho

587214256.name: Snorkeling
587214256.author: a TripAdvisor user
587214256.reviewBody: So many fish that water actually looks dark.  Great!!! Lots of places to get in the water. Get there by taxi. There is not much for parking if you drive in.

565276486.name: Great Sunset Place
565276486.author: a TripAdvisor user
565276486.reviewBody: This was a wonderful sunset spot. A lot of local families there enjoying the evening. There were a few food venders to grab a snack and also places to set up excursions for the day.

556965102.name: Sweet Little Beach
556965102.author: a TripAdvisor user
556965102.reviewBody: Small but lovely beach, very protected and quite sleepy the day we were there. The snorkeling is apparently good here though did not go. Lots of folks in front of the all-inclusive with loud music and beach volleyball but quieter down the way a little. Nice sand and water. The umbrella table was way over-priced at 180 pesos!! Perhaps just for gringos. The food from the nearby stand was average at best at least for our shrimp empalizado which also was overpriced. Still, a nice morning for day one in Manzanillo.

552922588.name: Nice beach enjoyed it. We have stayed at the Tesoro Resort a few times.
552922588.author: a TripAdvisor user
552922588.reviewBody: This beach is the beach where Bo Derek and Dudley Moore filmed the movie "10". The famous running down the beach scene...

552274342.name: Caution - sea urchins by the rocks!
552274342.author: a TripAdvisor user
552274342.reviewBody: A lovely beach although gets too crowded at high season. \nJust be careful - the North end of the beach has rocks and, as my 14 year old daughter found out - there are sea urchins beside the rocks... 39 spines and a trip to the local clinic later...

551601014.name: Nice beach
551601014.author: a TripAdvisor user
551601014.reviewBody: This beach is one of the ones swimable I  this area \nCan get full on weekends you can take tours right from there

550447133.name: Ok beach, way too many vendors
550447133.author: a TripAdvisor user
550447133.reviewBody: Close to La Punta.  Public beach, packed, no surf.   Pretty surroundings but vendors bugging you all the time.  I wouldn\u2019t go out of my way to go there again.

550055380.name: Great beach
550055380.author: a TripAdvisor user
550055380.reviewBody: This is a nice beach , good for swimming unlike the salagua district in Manzanillo great for kids too

548727140.name: Kind of icky
548727140.author: a TripAdvisor user
548727140.reviewBody: We visited several beaches while staying in Manzanillo, and this was our least favorite, just because of the slew of vendors, tons of people, not very tidy/clean area. The beach is fine, surf is very mild for swimming, but there are better "club" type areas where you can get better food and service. You will need to pay to use the restrooms, so keep some small pesos on you.

543823059.name: delicius Sea Food
543823059.author: a TripAdvisor user
543823059.reviewBody: The place is cute and the food is amaizing the shrimps were awesome and here is a good place to swim.

487450621.name: All the pretty people!
487450621.author: a TripAdvisor user
487450621.reviewBody: Big resort beach with lots of people to watch.  Lots of boats.  Lots of vendors.  Fun to spend a day.  Pretty beach

467102370.name: It can get crowded
467102370.author: a TripAdvisor user
467102370.reviewBody: If you plan to go on the weekend get ready to get there early because it does get crowded especially when kids are on vacation (summer and winter vacation). The waves are super calm and here you can find several boats that give tours around the bay, you can also find several options for snacks and local food to nibble on. If you want a good restaurant, head to the Blueberry Cafe, it\'s up the hill.

462615796.name: Headed out on a cruise
462615796.author: a TripAdvisor user
462615796.reviewBody: Our host Lions Club in Manzanillo Santiago booked a boat tour which picked us up along this beach. There are many large umbrellas available and vendors of homemade and commercial products. The Tesoro Hotel is along this beach. The view is fabulous.

456530795.name: Brief Stop
456530795.author: a TripAdvisor user
456530795.reviewBody: Busy beach by inclusive resorts. \nToo many people and aggressive vendors. \nManzanillo has way better beaches.

456034675.name: 1st place you should go in Manzanillo
456034675.author: a TripAdvisor user
456034675.reviewBody: This is a great place. You can spend the whole day in this area. Cruz is also available in nearby area and you may get to see whale if you are lucky.

454525080.name: Picturesque but crowded on weekends
454525080.author: a TripAdvisor user
454525080.reviewBody: It\'s a popular spot on the Santiago Peninsula, which separates Santiago Bay and Manzanillo Bay. Lots of activity, with tourists and locals.

453430388.name: Great location for family vacations !
453430388.author: a TripAdvisor user
453430388.reviewBody: Been there several times. Had so much fun with my family! Is near Colima and everything is affordable. Fresh sea food. Great !

450311043.name: Corowded and dirty
450311043.author: a TripAdvisor user
450311043.reviewBody: Maybe if I were a native I would think differently but this is one of the dirtiest beaches I have ever visited.  We went here rather than a resort because local tourism officials told us the water wasn\'t as rough as other area beaches, which was true.  However, these same people told us that there was a lot of sea life to be seen form the beach with a snorkel and mask; this was not true.  Once in the water we saw food wrappers, discarded plastic and other pollution clouding the water. There was nothing alive other than the other beach bathers.  The beach itself was relatively clean and might have been nice if it was not covered with people who had rented every available chair and umbrella and were fighting over the space.  Two different families accused of stealing their spots but we had been placed there by the people who we rented the umbrella and chairs from and they assumed I didn\'t speak Spanish, so I could understand what they were saying and knew they were lying.  All this said, I do give the location a second star for the people on the beach who, besides the two already mentioned, were incredibly friendly and nice.  The food served on the beach was also fresh and flavorful.

445604952.name: Like a pool
445604952.author: a TripAdvisor user
445604952.reviewBody: It is a very nice, family and friendly beach on which you can stay with your kids because the waves do not hit strongly. There is a contra, the beach is mall so you could find it crowded.

431358919.name: Nice beach
431358919.author: a TripAdvisor user
431358919.reviewBody: In the hotel zone of Manzanillo, nice beach, You should be careful as the beach is short and the sea is deep.

428868474.name: Great view
428868474.author: a TripAdvisor user
428868474.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, very crowded. A cordoned off area for swimming is rather small, the rest of the beach is too rough for swimming. Parking area very close by, need to be there early to find parking. Locals love this place.

409750364.name: Nice calm waters. Very nice beach. Perfect day
409750364.author: a TripAdvisor user
409750364.reviewBody: There is parking available.  Stroller access or wheelchair access is difficult as vendors down below have partially blocked it with chairs and tables. \nbut there are beach chairs with small table and umbrellas for rent. food and drink as well. Beer is 2 for $50 pesos. coconut drinks are over priced at $180 pesos. Ordered a drink in a pineapple and they add Chile spice to the drinks, which made it very spicy! \nBeach itself is beautiful and water is easy to swim in.

399645397.name: Beautiful beach with great view but too crowded
399645397.author: a TripAdvisor user
399645397.reviewBody: While staying at the Barcelo Karmina Palace, we wanted to check out some local beaches and were recommended a visit to this beach. It is gorgeous with amazing views, but the beach was very crowded with a huge hotel sharing the same beach with tons of families. And due to jetskis and boats, the middle of the area was cut off for swimming and there was the oil/gas smell. I am sure when it\'s less crowded, the beach is an excellent spot.

392367913.name: Relaxing beach
392367913.author: a TripAdvisor user
392367913.reviewBody: I loved this beach. I went with my family. We had little children, my nieces and nephews, even toddlers and it was really safe and enjoyable. I am looking forward to going back

385682877.name: Family vacation-the best choice !
385682877.author: a TripAdvisor user
385682877.reviewBody: The best sea food I had that week, there\'s lots of families having fun, the weather is very hot-but is just perfect, the water felt so refreshing. \nThere\'s local sellers offering handmade crafts, ice cream, life savers, and the restaurants have just delicious food !

382947320.name: Very small beach.
382947320.author: a TripAdvisor user
382947320.reviewBody: This is the smallest beach/cove in Manzanillo.  It is worth seeing but it is really just a jumping off point for the booze cruise boats.  It can get very crowed on weekends and parking can be a problem.  It is also not a place where I would swim as it has been listed as somewhat polluted.

359558263.name: Nice Beach but water polluted
359558263.author: a TripAdvisor user
359558263.reviewBody: It\'s expensive to rent an umbrella here and the ocean is very dirty here due to the fact that raw sewage is dumped into the bay from the bathrooms in the vicinity

357345416.name: The Beach
357345416.author: a TripAdvisor user
357345416.reviewBody: Nice beach with calm waters. Weekends are the locals beach days and it get crowded on the one end.  We loved it with all the families and kids around.

353107903.name: Bo Derek\'s beach
353107903.author: a TripAdvisor user
353107903.reviewBody: Nice beach, sand is a bit rough, we saw a beautiful sunset here. This is a small cove with towering hillsides, homes and hotels around it.

350960428.name: Great afternoon
350960428.author: a TripAdvisor user
350960428.reviewBody: The grand kids had a great time swimming in the ocean, one of the few beachs left in Manzanillo where kids can safely play in the ocean. \nNot crowded at all , lots of room on the beach , umbrellas were $190 pesos with 6 chairs.\nWould highly recommend  for children to swim this year, the other beachs are way too dangerous!!!

345899030.name: Small Beach in a Bay
345899030.author: a TripAdvisor user
345899030.reviewBody:
We actually stayed in a hotel on Audiencia on our recent trip to Manzanillo. Having stayed in various other Pacific cities in Mexico, I was pleasantly surprised to find clear, calm, warm blue-green waters ideal for snorkeling or swimming. Both activities we took part in several times throughout our trip. 

The snorkeling consisted of some angel fish, puffer fish, sea urchin, etc. It was nice to be able to check out the aquatic life by only having to walk 100 yards down the beach. 

Swimming was lovely as well, as the water was calm and temperate.  In that vein, it is important to note that this is not an ideal beach for surfing or boogie boarding.

339525094.name: A tranquil beach to swim
339525094.author: a TripAdvisor user
339525094.reviewBody: From all the beaches in Manzanillo bay, this is the best one for swimming and for doing aquatic activities. If looking for tranquility, just consider this is a family place. At the entrance of the beach they rent umbrellas and sell food which were crowded because of the holidays, but leaving those \'crowds behind\' you can find a calm and free of disturbance environment . To get here, you can take route #8 in Boulevard Miguel de la Madrid, asking for "La Audiencia" and walk some meters or take a cab at a very modest price.\nI recommend to go in the morning or in the evening to see a majestical sunset full of different shades of green and blue on the sea.

335761857.name: Small Beach, Water is warm but not clean.
335761857.author: a TripAdvisor user
335761857.reviewBody: We were a party of 14 from the cruise ship.  We took a taxi from the port to here ($8USD). We paid for two umbrellas with chairs ($20USD).  We didn\'t have USD and the guy wanted pesos.  His exchange rate was 10peso = $1.  But the current rate is 15=$1.  Anyway, make sure you pesos.  However we got peso\'s from the restroom lady she had the correct conversion.  We ordered beef taco\'s they were excellant.  We left earlier to catch a taxi but there are none to be found.  A guy offered a ride back to port all 14 of us in his pickup truck for $35USD. Done deal.

332097111.name: Good for snorkeling
332097111.author: a TripAdvisor user
332097111.reviewBody: Nice snorkeling spot that can be easily accessed from the beach.  We were surprised at the variety of fish.  I spotted a water snake which might scare some away but to me it indicated a healthy environment.

330883621.name: wonderful beach... lots to see and do
330883621.author: a TripAdvisor user
330883621.reviewBody: this is the beach our hotel, the Tesoro is on. It is very beautiful.\nWhen Bo Derek runs on the beach in "10", it is on this beach...

312761913.name: Overcowded!
312761913.author: a TripAdvisor user
312761913.reviewBody: If you are staying in one of the large hotels that surround this beach, then it might be a good idea to visit. I found it to be overcrowded, and the sand very corse. The parking is extremely poor with parking only available on the street, even the taxis had a hard time getting in and out of this place. \n\nWhatever you do, don\'t fall for the snorkeling boat! They have guys in the parking area that will approach you, before you even get out of the taxi, (first sign of a scam). We were told that they would take us snorkeling for 30 minutes, but we only spent 5 minutes in the water. This is a party boat with some sight seeing and very little snorkeling. Your best bet, if you want to snorkel is to find a aquatic shop and they can take you out someplace nice.

297745416.name: Nice place for surfing
297745416.author: a TripAdvisor user
297745416.reviewBody: People only stayed near the beach since the waves and ocean current was pretty rough here. Nice to see but dangerous for swimming.

292453650.name: Love this beach
292453650.author: a TripAdvisor user
292453650.reviewBody: It\'s a smaller bay but you are able to walk in and go snorkeling. The sand is light colored and soft but it can get hot when the temperatures rise and if there\'s a good tide, beware of a sharp drop in the sand as you go in the water. Either side of the beach is good for snorkeling, along the rocks.  It\'s wonderful to be able to go whenever you want to snorkel, there are local families that take a picnic lunch/supper or eat a one of the small food stands. It\'s relaxed and a great way to spend a day.

291855262.name: Warm Water ...
291855262.author: a TripAdvisor user
291855262.reviewBody: Ocean water was warmed than pool at Tesoro.  Watch the drop off\'s after entering.  Beautiful area, but most of beach closed off by Tesoro and their red flags, which are always there.

286916602.name: Protected bay
286916602.author: a TripAdvisor user
286916602.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel.  Lots of colorful sea life.  You can rent a table with chairs and umbrella. No fee unless you rent a table.  Float on top of deeper waters for a good variety of sea life.  Bring a lunch and have a picnic and spend the day..

286133075.name: Best beach in ZLO
286133075.author: a TripAdvisor user
286133075.reviewBody: This part of the Santiago Bay area is at the north-west area of the 5 km beach and the water is quite calm.  It is the perfect beach to walk on as the sand is hard packed and firm.  Great for joggers also.  You can rent beach chairs, enjoy snacks and beverages and furthermore, there are no beach vendors.  The sand is magic with sparkling golden flecks.

284463280.name: beatifull beach, lots of people
284463280.author: a TripAdvisor user
284463280.reviewBody: Its a public beach near Manzanillo downtown, very central, the ocean is pretty calm , however, there is a big but, there are tons of people trying to sell something. If that doesnt bother you, then you should definitely go.

275181982.name: Intimate Cove
275181982.author: a TripAdvisor user
275181982.reviewBody: Nice family beach.  Sunday vendors offer wares and during the week it\'s a nice quiet place to go without the big waves. Very safe.

273068414.name: the truth be known, the  by far best beach in Manzanillo
273068414.author: a TripAdvisor user
273068414.reviewBody: great beach, nicest sand and good snorkeling, great messages on the beach and the hotel has very good food for the price!

264288343.name: Wonderful for swimming
264288343.author: a TripAdvisor user
264288343.reviewBody: Playa Audencia is a small beach in a small bay with steep rocky cliffs on either side. As such, it is protected from the big waves that crash in at Playa Miramar. It only has two small restaurants, both basic Mexican places under palm roofs that serve fried fish, etc. so it\'s no place to go for great food or luxury. It\'s more of a place to swim rather than to laze about on the beach. If you want to hang out on the beach, you should go to Playa Miramar.

259584474.name: Sand coarse burn feet ,Too many jellyfish
259584474.author: a TripAdvisor user
259584474.reviewBody: The sand is coarse and gets burning hot. The water was mostly clear with a slight greenish tinge. Smelled very fishy in air, can walk to either side of beach and see fish and snorkelBUT you will get stung by jellyfish.

259040898.name: Great beach w/a terrible hotel on it!!
259040898.author: a TripAdvisor user
259040898.reviewBody: This is a fatastic beach in Manzanillo, it is unfortunate that the Tesoro Hotel is the main focal point bc the beach is in its own sheltered cove, safe, calm swimming with beautiful water, but, lots of jelly fish call it home so beware. The Tesoro is a cheap all-inclusive property & the clientele confirm that. They are super LOUD, dirty, & obnoxious & LOUD all day & all night long, its too bad bc the Tesoro, years back, used to be the Radisson & coming to this beach was a treat, great views with great snorkeling trips. They built new condos in this bay & the owners are appaled bc of the Tesoro & keeping them up all night. Had they of known beforehand that it was going to turnout to be a drunkards, obnoxious children mecca, they would not have bought a unit there. The beach itself is beautiful.

245836639.name: My kind of beach
245836639.author: a TripAdvisor user
245836639.reviewBody:
Everyone raves about the Mayan Riviera beaches but this beach is wonderful. We stayed at the Tesoro which stands on this beach and that is truly one of the hallmarks of the resort. 

The beach sand is not fine sand (bring those beach shoes as the sand gets very hot) and at either end of the bay, the sand becomes black. It is a great beach for swimming, snorkelling and walking along. We snorkelled along the north side and were amazed by the quantity of fish we could see. The water is very clear in this bay and even standing in the shallows you can see the fish swimming around your feet. The Mexicans use either end for fishing.

Apart from a sailboard competition that filled the beach and was held the last day we were there, the beach was not very crowded.

Just a gem of place to spend your vacation.

244586996.name: Great Little Beach
244586996.author: a TripAdvisor user
244586996.reviewBody: This beach is located in a small bay with a "postcard" setting. It\'s a very safe beach with only small waves, perfect for long boarding. It is only 300m long, is private and great for families. Calm with warm waters, it is perfect for swimming or snorkelling. Good fishing from the rocks at either end of the beach. Stayed at the Tesoro Manzanillo on the beach. Very nice and relaxing.

244556925.name: Nice beach!
244556925.author: a TripAdvisor user
244556925.reviewBody: We recently returned from the Tesoro on Audiencia Beach and it is a fine beach! The surf is calm and swimming in it isn\'t a problem. There is a main public area, an area claimed mostly by Tesoro and a further area by the rocks covered by trees that the locals seem to like. In some areas, fish are quite abundant and will swim around you and pick at and rub themselves on your legs. I found that it tickled. A small yellow fish with black stripes followed me around for about 30 minutes seemingly using me as protection. The usual water activities are available and a party boat tour leaves out of there in the afternoon. Have fun!

237914103.name: Read up on the history of the beach.
237914103.author: a TripAdvisor user
237914103.reviewBody: The history goes back to the days of the Spanish landing at this beach and getting an audience with the natives, hence Audiecia.  It is in a sheltered bay and a good beach for kids.  It can be a bith crowded on Sunday\'s and is located right next to an all inclusive hotel.  Hint.  The little beach restauant just up the beach serves pretty good and fresh seafood.  Still, Google it and read up on the history.

212471227.name: Small, often busy beach
212471227.author: a TripAdvisor user
212471227.reviewBody: This small, protected, public beach is at the end of the main street on the peninsula with Las Hadas resort and other high-end hotels and housing. Weekends can be very busy with bus-loads of visitors. Beach and water is nice. There is decent snorkeling off the north end of the beach along the rocky coastline. Take some small coins for the public restrooms. Umbrellas and water sports are available from vendors on the beach. BTW, the photo at the top of the page is not Audiencia beach.

211544524.name: Traveling guru
211544524.author: a TripAdvisor user
211544524.reviewBody: This beach is very nice however dont expect paradise, this is a typical pacific coast beach so sand is brownish tan and the water not that clear, depending on season the surf can get as high as 6ft and make for dedent body or regular surfing, the undertow is dangerous pick your spot the steeper parts of the beach and the more dangerous the water. No lifeguards so be careful water temp is perfect in any a season the best part of the beach is its length if you want to stroll walking you can go for an hour easy and work on your tan, local shak restaurant abound, good fresh fruit and ice cold bear stay away from red meat and stick to fresh fish grilled. Safety is fine local people are very nice and often frequent the beach with family, porly equipped for water sports you will have to go to the small hotel at the north to find an avg jet ski to rent or banana boat. Parking is anywhere in frontnof the beach.

207674505.name: PLAYA AUDIENCIA
207674505.author: a TripAdvisor user
207674505.reviewBody: Playa Audiencia is one of the oldest tourist attractions we have at the "Emerald of The Pacific", Manzanillo-Santiago, Colima. This Playa = Beach is located at the end of Calle = Street La Audiencia. This is the historic place where Hernan Cortez sailed to and requested an "Audience" = Audiencia with the natives of this area where a great  tropical variety of  trees grew in abundance at that time. He requested their assistance to cut down enough of those trees that would enable him to  build ships to travel to the Philipines. To my knowledge it did not happen. Nevertheless, this beautiful cove of a beach remained with it\'s current name, "Playa Audiencia", where the sands are fine and the water clear, where it has the best snorkling in our area, often finding seahorses and other colorful tropical fish a few feet away from shore. It is perfect for the sun worshiper because there is very little surf.

191854761.name: A Swimmers Beach
191854761.author: a TripAdvisor user
191854761.reviewBody: Love the fact that everyone can enjoy this beach.  There is little surf so you can enjoy the water without fear.  Go during the week when it isn\'t too crowded.  An umbrella and 4 lounge chairs cost $150 pesos and they bring food and drinks to you.  It is a family beach.  Bring your snorkel.

159379044.name: Popular among st the locals
159379044.author: a TripAdvisor user
159379044.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach, but, very crowded... not as large as some others...
Lots of trailers pulling up filled with people, making it a very busy beach...
Off to the next one for me...

151685937.name: Great little cove and beach!
151685937.author: a TripAdvisor user
151685937.reviewBody: We stayed at the Tesoro and  the beach was the best part. Just great. Snorkeling VERY good along the right side of the cove facing the ocean. Make sure you snorkel not only along the rocks but out toward the boats and look for the large rocks, lots of fish!! We saw lobsters, octopus, moray eel, spotted sea snakes, tons of rays and dozens of species of fish. Clear, warm water.

150630975.name: Fogon Restaurant
150630975.author: a TripAdvisor user
150630975.reviewBody: Good service. Good food. Many Mexican dishes worth trying. On the main road and available. Loved the variety of dishes as well as the Mexican typical fare.

146967233.name: Historic and nice
146967233.author: a TripAdvisor user
146967233.reviewBody: It\'s the site where spanish conquistadors first reached land and now, full of tourists is still a site to enjoy, you can board a day cruise or catamaran or just relax.

131646012.name: Nice sheltered bay
131646012.author: a TripAdvisor user
131646012.reviewBody: Playa Audiencia is a nice sheltered bay with small waves. It is dominated by the Tesoro hotel and its beach. However, since all beaches in Mexico are accessible by the public, you can take your own umbrella and towels and park yourself anywhere on the beach. You\'ll find many Mexican families who come with their umbrellas, beach chairs, towels, beverages and snacks to spend the day. The cove has many fishing and tourist boats in it and I often find the smell of the gasoline and exhaust from the boats overwhelming. Try to find a spot away from where the boats are. The vendors have displays set up at the entrance to the beach and rarely bother you when you are sitting on the beach. There are a couple of beach side restaurants and public toilets. Snorkelling is good in this bay. Enter by the Club de Yachts. Typically the beach is very busy on weekends.

131444994.name: Black eye of Manzanillo
131444994.author: a TripAdvisor user
131444994.reviewBody: I used to love this playa but the big hotel next door (Tesoro) has ruined this playa. It was too dirty during our visit, too much noise pollution from el Tesoro hotel and boats blasting loud music. Vendors tend to be a pushy and it takes several "no gracias" for them to leave you alone. Overall, I won\'t visit Playa Audiencia until someone orders Tesoro Hotel to help clean up the playa and control their noise pollution

130273189.name: Great spot to swim, snorkel, relax
130273189.author: a TripAdvisor user
130273189.reviewBody: One of my favourite spots to snorkel. Well protected bay from ocean waves, lots of fish, seahorses.

127022591.name: Lujo Tours...beyond expectations!
127022591.author: a TripAdvisor user
127022591.reviewBody:
This review is for Lujo tours in Manzanillo, Colima, MX
We were there from Jan 17-Feb 1st 2012 for our vacation/wedding & honeymoon and stayed at Hotel Tesoro on Playa La Audiencia which was great!
We first did some tours with Lujo in 2011 and knew right away we would book again with them.
This year we had Luis and Bonita organize our wedding ceremony and I can say that it was beyond our expectations! From the amazing flower arrangement to the “surprise” guitar players playing an Elvis Presley song I had talked to Luis about but then changed my mind. He still had them show up and play for us and said, “it was his gift to us”!!!
Luis is an amazing man and will ensure your trip and tours are a great time!
He even came on our fishing trip and played guitar and sang for us!
Bonita has also been such a great help with organizing and correspondence with regards to our tours/excursions. Again, she went above and beyond not only with the tours, but helping us with our vacation in general….putting us in touch with people we had met the year before, great places to eat, and information and tips on the area.
Other tours we did this year were Colima/Comala, Barra de Navidad, Snorkeling, & deep sea fishing.
Again, I have only great things to say about these also. First of all, no crowded tour buses to be on….only Kim and I in a car with a tour guide! This way it is very personal, private, fun, and educational.
Our tour guide for all of our tours was Chito! This guy is so nice and so much fun! He really goes out of his way to educate you on Manzanillo/Colima. He also made sure we saw and did everything we wanted/needed on each tour, incuding all the pictures I wanted to take. We ended up becoming good friends with Chito and he even came to our wedding ceremony! Thank You again for the gift Chito!!
We are already planning our Manzanillo trip for 2013 and will definitely be booking more excursions with Luis and Bonita!
Also, we are very much looking forward to seeing Luis and Chito again. We are also hoping to finally meet Bonita as we have not been able to yet!
Thank You again to the three of you….you have made our vacations full of memories we will never forget….so much so that hopefully one day we will spend much more time in Manzanillo as you have shown us all the great things it has to offer.
See you next year!!!
Book with Lujo and you will not be disappointed!

Greg & Kimberley Bates
Winnipeg, MB
CANADA

125471187.name: NIce small beach area
125471187.author: a TripAdvisor user
125471187.reviewBody: It is small but nice, and the Tesoro resort is on it and they are building a new condo building on one end of it. The other end is where the local people and tourists who ae not on the beach come. You can rent loungers, sea doos, umbrellas, etc they have banos there and you can buy food and beverages there. It is fairly calm there as it is a small protected bay. It is a good place to go and stay.

124305833.name: In love
124305833.author: a TripAdvisor user
124305833.reviewBody: This is a real Mexican beach--not just American tourists on this beach. There\'s a restaurant on the north side that delivers to your chair really good food and drinks. The water is clear and is great for snorkeling. The vendors are not pushy but are friendly and fun to get to know. Best beach in Manzanillo.

123802568.name: A excellent beach for families.
123802568.author: a TripAdvisor user
123802568.reviewBody: There is very little surf. It is great for swiming or snorkling. The beach is located in a sheltered bay.

120505487.name: Beach vendors and snorkeling
120505487.author: a TripAdvisor user
120505487.reviewBody: If you like beach vendors (and I do!) then here\'s a good place to find some souvenirs and to book and snorkeling or boat tour.

96527661.name: La Playa de la Audiencia: Lovely and Historic
96527661.author: a TripAdvisor user
96527661.reviewBody:
The historic  Playa de la Audiencia is located in a sheltered bay just east of the toney Peninsula de Santiago. Like all Mexican beaches it is a public beach even though it is dominated by the gigantic, shadow-casting, all-inclusive Hotel Tesoro and the 
in-construction 17-storey Palapagos Condos. A small bus, BRISAS LAS HADAS, which passes every 20 minutes at Commercial on Miguel de la Madrid, will take you there for 6 pesos. Get off at the stop just before the Tesoro. The entrance to this still lovely beach is not scenic, and means passing the public "Sanatorios", then through a beach market, but the swimming , snorkeling and diving at both ends of the beach are very good. Efforts have been made to keep the beach cleaner than it was with less plastic and garden waste from La Punta washing up. The black sand on the left corner is not oil, but just that, black sand. However, the noisy little tour boats were observed through binoculars to be emptying their heads in the bay after a day of accommodating tourists' toilet needs. Senor "Floatie" is not pleasant and potentially dangerous to swimmers, so report this to the Manzanillo Tourist Office if you happen to see it, or the Tesoro management.
The roped off left corner of the shore is safe (when not polluted!) for children and weak swimmers.  At both ends of the beach, a beach umbrella, a small table and 4 deckchairs can be rented for the day for 100 pesos. The seafood in the beach cafes on the right of the beach have a good reputation locally and fresh coconut juice and beer  can be purchased.
Early morning is a peaceful and shady time on the beach to ponder the history of the place. In the early 16th century, the location of the beach market was the scene of a Conquistador shipyard, which built Spanish brigantines using the hard wood of the manzanillo tree, and no doubt native people as slave labor.  The two visits of Hernan Cortes are commemorated in a grubby plaque above the public toilets. 

[--]

The last visit of Cortes was in February 1535, and some 450 years later, Bo Derek in the iconic movie Ten" ran down la Playa de la Audiencia, with her blonde cornrows swinging, toward the spot where Cortes and Sandoval once stood.
In that Cortes may be guilty of inciting Moctezuma's Revenge, Bo Derek's athletic  beauty could be the reason so many female tourists imitate the eponymous hairstyle by having "trencitas" woven into hair that often, unfortunately, does not crown such lithe and gorgeous bodies.
If you walk up the hill on Calle Riscos to Las Hadas you will see why the beach scenes of "Ten" were filmed on Audiencia rather than on the meager Las Hadas beach.
Sunsets (approximately 6:30 pm) seen from the Calle Riscos or on Audiencia are spectacular.  Afterwards you can easily hail the LAS HADAS BRISAS bus on the Avenida Audiencia or on Calle Riscos.

95669104.name: Feista (Snorkel) Cruise
95669104.author: a TripAdvisor user
95669104.reviewBody: Just a warning that this is more of a booze trip than one focused on snorkeling.  Leaves from  Playa La Audencia.  The music is LOUD and the narration by the guide is NOT in English at all.  Was a fun ride and we saw whales too, but not what we thought it was going to be!

16499130.name: Beautiful little beach in Manzanillo
16499130.author: a TripAdvisor user
16499130.reviewBody: Beautiful small beach in a cove on Santiago Peninsula.  Hotel Tesoro hogs a lot of the beach, but there\'s plenty of room on the "public" part.  Hardly any waves, several fishing boats floating in the bay.  Perfect place to lay back and zone out.

665775777.name: Visited the flea market
665775777.author: a TripAdvisor user
665775777.reviewBody: The stop here was part of a shore excursion. Once we got beyond the flea market we were pleased to see a nice beach and great views..\nThere are many stalls in the flea market and many sell the same items, but it is fun to look around and if you are in the mood, to do some shopping.\nThe beach itself is very nice with many restaurants to choose from if you want a bite to eat.

654386253.name: Love this beach
654386253.author: a TripAdvisor user
654386253.reviewBody: Great beach too spend all day with buckets of beer and playing in the waves. Lots of peddlers but they r friendly. Can go for long walks and enjoy the sand. When we were there it was pretty dead . Can have more bugs at night and sunset time.

651888313.name: Lovely beach but watch out
651888313.author: a TripAdvisor user
651888313.reviewBody: Lovely sandy beach that you can walk for miles. Dangerous rip tides when tide is changing. Watch out for stingrays and jelly fish. Usually not a bother, but I stepped on a stingray and was in agony for hours.

642181785.name: A beautiful beach
642181785.author: a TripAdvisor user
642181785.reviewBody: This is our go-to beach for a nice long walk in the evening just before sunset.  We came here 4-5 days to do that.  A very long beach.  Beautiful setting. Places to swim, sit, eat and more.

595603662.name: Paradise
595603662.author: a TripAdvisor user
595603662.reviewBody: A great place to rejuvenate and enjoy the Mexican hospitality. People are friendly and accommodating.

589744295.name: Ask if restaurant will charge for table and umbrella first
589744295.author: a TripAdvisor user
589744295.reviewBody: We\'ve been several times to this beach, and had never been charged to use the table and umbrella as we were eating and drinking from the restaurant where we used their table.  However, during the Christmas season, perhaps they try to take advantage of tourists, as we neglected to ask this time (our mistake) and we were charged 180 pesos.  Felt ripped off considering we had 4 adults and 2 kids, and spent a fair amount of money.  We went again to a different place the following week, and asked first, and eventually the guy didn\'t charge us for the use of table and umbrellas, which was smart, as we spent about $100 Cdn dollars, and there was no one else there the whole time, so he would have lost out.  I know this is common as it is typical for Mexican families to bring their coolers with food and drink and spend time, so I can see why they\'d charge for use of facilities, but not for paying customers.  Just ask in advance!

574437763.name: Beautiful
574437763.author: a TripAdvisor user
574437763.reviewBody: A stunning long beach with plenty of opportunity for swimming and shopping the nearby markets.\n\nI specifically encourage people to spend some time at the Emiliano Zapata Craft Market while here.

569689361.name: Nice long beach
569689361.author: a TripAdvisor user
569689361.reviewBody: Nice long beach to walk on hard sand so good with runners on. Took the bus from the Barcelo to the end of the beach and walked back to the hotel maybe 5km.

568582238.name: Review
568582238.author: a TripAdvisor user
568582238.reviewBody: It is very pretty. People were nice. Not super big, but nice little area. Good place to have a beer and lunch and buy souvenirs.

565276230.name: Local Fun
565276230.author: a TripAdvisor user
565276230.reviewBody: This is a lovely beach with a lot of spirit. I really enjoyed our time here. We went ona Sunday and the beach was filled with local families just enjoying the sun and surf!

559264454.name: Lovely Beach
559264454.author: a TripAdvisor user
559264454.reviewBody: Great place to relax, grab a pina colada, sit under a beach umbrella. The sand is great for walking. Variety of beach activities available, none of which I did. EG: horseback riding, banana boat fun, checking out the many vendors.

558726855.name: Let\u2019s Shop!
558726855.author: a TripAdvisor user
558726855.reviewBody: Authentic jewelry, dresses, and yes hats and t-shirts also! Excellent variety and lots of choice available. Worth the cab ride.

555248938.name: Excellent Markets for Shopping
555248938.author: a TripAdvisor user
555248938.reviewBody: Quick cab ride from Las Hadas to shop at some of the small shop markets... vendors were friendly and helpful... and too all you CFL fans.. a vendor sells Mexican blankets, nap sacks and pull overs in CFL team colours and logos... \n\nI got mine...  \ud83d\ude42

554675908.name: Enjoyable time
554675908.author: a TripAdvisor user
554675908.reviewBody: Great day at the beach.  We were able to see some whales and when we put our ears under the water we could here them as well. It was pretty amazing. If you do visit make sure to get an umbrella for the day as it can get very hot.

553291127.name: one more long mexican beach
553291127.author: a TripAdvisor user
553291127.reviewBody: a beach to walk for one hour each direction. Some bars and restaurants close to the end of the beach. Not so special after all

548376077.name: Beautiful
548376077.author: a TripAdvisor user
548376077.reviewBody: This is our favorite beach to walk and enjoy the view.  Every time we come to Manzanillo we walk this beach 1-2 times each day.  We enjoy the shops and the view and the fact that it is not very crowded.

543822806.name: Big waves
543822806.author: a TripAdvisor user
543822806.reviewBody: This place is good for a nice walk , the sand has a Golden color and a wonderful view of the mountains

538412664.name: Time to relax!
538412664.author: a TripAdvisor user
538412664.reviewBody: Really nice beach. My kids spent the whole day playing on the waves body surfing. Dont forget the Tacos and Cervesas! Good place for children, however  I still had my children wear their life jackets because the waves could come crashing in and they were only 3yrs at the time.

478038988.name: Great Beach!
478038988.author: a TripAdvisor user
478038988.reviewBody: Hit up the small market and buy yourself a T-shirt. Get ready to bargain for a deal! They have a couple restaurants there which is great for a bite. Bring some towels and enjoy the waves!

468657683.name: Our favorite by far!
468657683.author: a TripAdvisor user
468657683.reviewBody: Lovely, swimmable beach that stretches for miles. Many places to sit under an umbrella, relax, eat, enjoy frias cervesa, & spend the day

465330896.name: Crowded local beach
465330896.author: a TripAdvisor user
465330896.reviewBody: Long crowded local beach used by the all-inclusive resorts just across the road.  All beaches in Mexico are public. so weekends is it really crowded with the Mexican families enjoying the hot sand and sunshine.

463781704.name: Family vacation
463781704.author: a TripAdvisor user
463781704.reviewBody: An amazing beach to play at.\nGreat food and drinks\n We spent several days there and never tired of the sun.

460115373.name: Great sandy, level, safe beach!
460115373.author: a TripAdvisor user
460115373.reviewBody: We like this beach because it offers nice hard packed sand for walking, safe for swimming- easy to get in and out of the nice warm water. The vendors offer most everything you can imagine  from jewellery, beach wear, baskets, fruit, candy, to horseback rides. We usually park outside a newish looking white hotel, near the overpass,go through their lobby and sit under an umbrella at a table and order beers, margaritas and some food. The guacamole is excellent, so is the ceviche for 4 personnes. Even the french fries are good- the best part though is the proximity to the beach front massage tent.For 300 + tip pesos - or 250 if there are two people, you can get an excellent massage. Elsa has been the lady I have used twice and she is incredible- very strong and seems to find the problem area quickly and works on them, she starts with your feet and I am not sure if she uses reflexology but whatever, she seems to massage every part of you in 45 minutes.The first time I had a very sore back and I think she used a cream of sorts to lesson the pain-Voltarin? and I was able to walk away normally and stroll down the beach. She alone is worth a visit!

459494313.name: Walked a couple of miles along the beach
459494313.author: a TripAdvisor user
459494313.reviewBody: We walked from our hotel on the east bay to the peninsula then went north to the Blvd Miguel de la Madrid.  Great walk!  My wife took a lot of photos of the waves, kids playing, and the sunset.  Mostly clean beach.  Not that many people out.

459283480.name: Great Walking and Swimming
459283480.author: a TripAdvisor user
459283480.reviewBody: This is a great place to bring the family for an easy walk and swimming in the ocean. Lots of places to rent chairs or grab a bite to eat.

457924330.name: Fabulous Beach
457924330.author: a TripAdvisor user
457924330.reviewBody: We were staying with family in a VRBO property within walking distance of this beach.  We  spent 1 morning and 1 afternoon here.  The surf in the morning is great, but starts getting larger and rougher just after lunch.  Beach is very clean and table and 4 chairs was only 120 peso.  There are some vendors on this beach, but they were very friendly and not pushy at all.  We had a blast here!

457491739.name: Decent beach
457491739.author: a TripAdvisor user
457491739.reviewBody: It was a decent beach. Over crowded and bit dirty ... May be because it was a long holiday weekend..

456743645.name: Nice long beach to walk
456743645.author: a TripAdvisor user
456743645.reviewBody: If staying in Manzanillo, suggest find a nice VRBO rental walking onto this beach, more family friendly, nicer sand, beautiful bay views, tourist shopping, can rent beach chairs and an umbrella if coming for the day from the municipality, no hassles with sellers on the beach

455386656.name: Beach life
455386656.author: a TripAdvisor user
455386656.reviewBody: Love this beach! For 150 (about 7.50 US) get an umbrella with 4 chairs to enjoy the beach and listen to the waves.

454529934.name: Nice, quiet expansive stretch
454529934.author: a TripAdvisor user
454529934.reviewBody: We spent mornings walking, jogging and reading (almost alone, again!) \u2013 and absorbing the interesting sights and sounds, such as tugs guiding massive container ships into port, and camouflage-clad, well-armed Marines conducting water training exercises.

453672207.name: Walk along the beach
453672207.author: a TripAdvisor user
453672207.reviewBody: My husband and I walked along the beach all the way from HOA to the end of the sandy beach. Good couple hour walk. We saw puffer fish and lots of crabs scurrying on the sand. Pretty fascinating. Nice sand and warm water.

453431237.name: The best for the family !
453431237.author: a TripAdvisor user
453431237.reviewBody: Great location in Colima! \nThe food is great. The beach is very-nice. \nTheres a lot to enjoy in this small state.

452656671.name: Nice long beach
452656671.author: a TripAdvisor user
452656671.reviewBody: The beach is long and very nice however in some areas the waves are high and strong there is a lot of chairs and parasols that can be rented for a good value there are areas that you can buy food and drinks.  Vendors are not too harrasing

447352166.name: Nice holidays
447352166.author: a TripAdvisor user
447352166.reviewBody: Beach was really very nice and sea was calm and we rented umbrella with chairs to relax...and enjoy.. only problem not much option of good food there and few option we had , we ordered food which was very expensive and of poor quality.. its better to take ur own food from some where else.. will definately go back with own food.. to this beach..

422933957.name: Miles of Beach...
422933957.author: a TripAdvisor user
422933957.reviewBody: Just like in the movies, miles of beautiful Sandy beach and very few people on it! The Santiago Bay area offers wonderful beaches, warm ocean for swimming and tons of fun restaurant/bars along it\'s length.

384137128.name: Beach is okay not good or great
384137128.author: a TripAdvisor user
384137128.reviewBody: During our visit there was lots of big waves so we did not really get in the beach.  I could see lots of small rocks in some areas.  Maybe we just came at the wrong time I\'ll leave up to each visitor to decide.  The best part of it was that I was able to munch on all the local foods that vendors bring up to your umbrella.  I was definitely happy about the variety.

382948782.name: Nicest beach in Manzanillo
382948782.author: a TripAdvisor user
382948782.reviewBody: This is a great beach.  Depending on the day, the waves can be fairly tame or quite large.  Nice sand and good swimming but be cautious when the waves are up.  There are many restaurants along this beach but nothing too upscale.  It is a great place to enjoy the sand, sun and cervezas.

375858618.name: Watch for rip currents
375858618.author: a TripAdvisor user
375858618.reviewBody: Nice beach with gentle waves most of the time but be careful of the rip currents that are found all along here.

373913464.name: Caution is best.
373913464.author: a TripAdvisor user
373913464.reviewBody: This is a popular beach with the Mexican tourists. It is a large beach with. Fairly large surf. The undertow can be hazardous. The beach vendors, which are many, rarely clean the sand so you need to be careful when walking also. A couple of the small fishing boats will tow water toys for a fee. Have fun but be careful.\n

359570504.name: Spring break 2016
359570504.author: a TripAdvisor user
359570504.reviewBody: Wonderful beach.  Felt safe with all the security and marine patrol and first aid roaming the beach.  Easily marked safe to dangerous zones for swimming.  Beach vendors and artisans for all your needs.  7 peso bus ride each way.  Strong surf so be smart.  Four chairs, table and beach umbrella rented for 150 pesos for the day.

357026237.name: Beach Day Excursion
357026237.author: a TripAdvisor user
357026237.reviewBody: We made a day trip to Miramar Beach from Las Hadas and very much enjoyed it. The waves were amazing and we found a lot of sea glass, too. Had a wonderful lunch and visited the open air market.

354571786.name: Loved walking along this beach!
354571786.author: a TripAdvisor user
354571786.reviewBody: We went to this beach on a Wednesday afternoon. The waves crash up on shore! It is fun to go in the water and let the waves push you toward the beach! I felt very safe as a tourist walking along this beach.

353718027.name: Miramar Beach..Santiago Bay
353718027.author: a TripAdvisor user
353718027.reviewBody: Amazing beach..you can walk for miles. Go through the market and pick up up a few goodies...remember to eat at Tanilos....

350955755.name: Beautiful, and inexpensive beverages.
350955755.author: a TripAdvisor user
350955755.reviewBody: Oasis area was excellent. A few of the bars, not so good. Surf and waves and sand were exceptional. Definitely worth the time.

350792552.name: Best waves beach in Manzanillo
350792552.author: a TripAdvisor user
350792552.reviewBody: If you like bodyboard surfing, you\'ll probably enjoy this beach and ocean water\nThe water is so clear and warm, but you must be careful...some waves might trick you and throw you and bounce you all over, for a great day of fun at the beach, sombrillos and beach chairs are available $$ and beverages Mexican food is also available.

350707270.name: Beautiful...
350707270.author: a TripAdvisor user
350707270.reviewBody: Caught the bus at our hotel (7 pesos) and went to Miramar Beach. Absolutely beautiful...we walked the beach, visited with local vendors, sat in comfy chairs under grass umbrellas sipping freshly sqeezed pinapple juice..sigh...the smell of the ocean and its breeze...so relaxing...then to the market that is also on the beach to buy some trinkets.

349477088.name: Beautiful beach
349477088.author: a TripAdvisor user
349477088.reviewBody: This beach was across the street from the resort where we were staying. Every morning we walked for an hour on this beach followed by a swim in the warm water. At times the waves could be quite rough. We brought snorkels and masks, but so much sand was churned up we could not really see anything. The vendors on the beach aren\'t too aggressive but it does get tiresome being relentlessly approached.

345209808.name: Nicest Beach in Manzanillo area
345209808.author: a TripAdvisor user
345209808.reviewBody: Surf can be rough in some parts of the Mazanillo area but this beach has easy/safe access to the water. Also some nice restaurants (Oasis Beach Club) to eat at. We loved our day here. Not too many people hustling to sell things either and that is nice.

344841489.name: Best beach in Manzanillo!
344841489.author: a TripAdvisor user
344841489.reviewBody: Beautiful, natural beach.... stunning mountains to look at.  Small local vendors and chairs for small rental fee.\n

343896702.name: A long beautiful walking beach in Manzanillo
343896702.author: a TripAdvisor user
343896702.reviewBody: Walk forever on warm sand, in warm water, or to your favorite beach restaurant. Plenty of places to stop at for a cold beverage, great snack or to wile away some time under a beach umbrella. The views are stunning and the variety unending.

343379823.name: Great for walking
343379823.author: a TripAdvisor user
343379823.reviewBody: Very nice walking beach. Little shops and restaurants to visit. Can barter for goods there. I got a beautiful necklace and my friend bought a hat and little things. Was fun! No one was pushy at all at the shops which we loved. If you\'re on the beach to eat or have a beer, local will come to you there to try and sell you stuff but we just say no thank you and they leave so it wasn\'t too bad. Big waves when we were there! Would go back to spend the day again.

342455196.name: Great beach!
342455196.author: a TripAdvisor user
342455196.reviewBody: We enjoyed the day body surfing in the warm ocean while eating delicious food delivered to us right to our beach chairs. Our daughters had their hair braided for a very reasonable price and to top it off my wife and I had massages right there on the beach.

337561156.name: Day adventure
337561156.author: a TripAdvisor user
337561156.reviewBody:
Manzanillo was the final destination on my recent cruise to Mexico. My family wanted to spend a day at the beach. I did not have anything booked so I took the advice of the tourism employees at the terminal to visit Playa Miramar. There are several options to get there.
1) Book a cruise excursion
2) Take a Dani tours private van that was just outside the terminal for $20 per person
3) Take a taxi for the 30 minute ride for $12/cab
4) Take the city bus (Route 1) for 7 pesos per person ( about 50 cents)

I ended up taking the bus with my family as there was a long line for the cab and the children were impatient. The ride took about 45 minutes. It was crowded with locals and gave a good perspective of the town and surrounding area. I never felt unsafe. 
The beach was beautiful and not too crowded. The water was warm very conducive to swimming. There are small restaurants with umbrellas that you can have a simple meal. Our party ordered 6 Coronas, nachos, chips, guacamole, fries and 2 sodas for $21. There a public restrooms along the beach as well as flea markets. Some food vendors were selling mangos, oysters, clams, and shrimp. Due to time constraints my family and I took a taxi back to the terminal for $15/cab. It was a fun outing.

337283092.name: Pretty average
337283092.author: a TripAdvisor user
337283092.reviewBody: The beach is nice, but a bit dirty (trash).  Concessions are of a low quality and run deceptively.  Try Las Hadas instead, more expensive but much, much better.

335750659.name: Nice beach
335750659.author: a TripAdvisor user
335750659.reviewBody: We had a chance to visit at the end of our city tour in December. The tour only gave us half an hour to browse which wasn\'t enough. The market was good. Usual gifts but good prices and I recommend trying the fried coconut candy. It is awesome. They had a bar/ restaurant on the beach so that you could get a cool drink. They did not open till noon the day we went. The beach at Miramar is vast and a must see. There were lots of people there and they have shade umbrellas. Most of Manzanillo is clean but there were some areas here with lots of trash. Only 10 minutes from Las Hadas.

333753499.name: great walking beach most of the year, long, flat, hard packed sand
333753499.author: a TripAdvisor user
333753499.reviewBody: A place to walk your dog every morning, except for some of the sumber months when tide stays high and  the beach becomes more rocky. I swim there most of time with little fear but there are days when the waves get bigger and swimming is for the more experienced . There can be an undertow at these  times and children should be watched closely. It is a beautiful bay and there are places to eat and cocktails to be had. Enjoy!!!!!

333723354.name: Travel guru
333723354.author: a TripAdvisor user
333723354.reviewBody: One of the longest beach around. Just basic no real amenities unless close to some beach restaurants. Surf is good and undertow could be dangerous so check flags an stay where people are swimming. Quiet place unless staying during vacation times. Safe and secure clean water and beach. All beaches in this area are fairly similar depending on time of year just be careful of the currents and undertow stay close to shore.

323464200.name: Beautiful beach
323464200.author: a TripAdvisor user
323464200.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach to take a stroll on or find one of the many restaurants and bars in which you can have food or just drinks.  This beach is very clean considering its length and usage.

321964296.name: Beautiful
321964296.author: a TripAdvisor user
321964296.reviewBody: Gorgeous views, warm water - everything you could want for an afternoon at the beach.  You could sit at a local restaurant and have a cold cerveza while people watching, or grab a piece of sand and sun worship the afternoon away.   Can\'t wait to go back again! :)

314891241.name: Careful which part
314891241.author: a TripAdvisor user
314891241.reviewBody: Headed for playa miramar after reviews and persuaded by taxi driver to go to a better part without red flags and more restaurants, through the Club Santiago Country Club.  Not impressed as ripped off paying twice the price for the taxi and taken to a dirty beach and shabby restaurants.  Walked back to the main beach which was much cleaner and for a safe part to swim as areas with red flags.  Good seafront restaurant itch many to chose from despite taxi driver saying otherwise.  Enjoyed a relaxing day after initial annoyance.

312214063.name: Nice area
312214063.author: a TripAdvisor user
312214063.reviewBody: nice beach some markets good deals friendly people easy to get to lots of locals and tourists would recommend

286235575.name: Beach was nice
286235575.author: a TripAdvisor user
286235575.reviewBody: Beach was nice, however had to purchase beverages in order to get an umbrella.  Waves were quite high at the time which may be why the beach was fairly empty.  Took city bus there so was very inexpensive.

279623144.name: Colima Surfing Academy
279623144.author: a TripAdvisor user
279623144.reviewBody: I met up with Pako at 8am on a Saturday at Playa Miramar. The academy consists of a few portable canopies along the beach where Pako\'s surf boards are kept for the day. The waves were suitable for beginner to intermediate, with a sandy bottom. I was the only one there at that time and I ended up surfing with Pako and his son for a few hours. Pako was friendly, knowledgeable and patient. He taught me to read the waves and what to watch out for to stay safe. After I had finished surfing, Pako was kind enough to give me a ride back to the resort. Pako must know half the city because people were constantly honking and waving at him as he drove. I had a great time and would definitely go back if I had the chance.  I found his contact info through his web page http://www.colimasurfingacademy.com/home.html

266230990.name: Incredible walking or running beach!
266230990.author: a TripAdvisor user
266230990.reviewBody: We often go for the day, starting with a walk and stopping along the way for a bite to eat or some cervesas. Lots of great little places that are untouched by american tourism.  Authentic food, incredible prices. It is very close to our Villa, Villa Paraiso on LaPunta Peninsula, so if you stay in Lapunta you will need a short ride.

263873593.name: beautiful beach
263873593.author: a TripAdvisor user
263873593.reviewBody: great for taking long walks but not ideal for swimming while we were there as the waves were very strong and high.  touristy with lots of shops and restaurants.

261476380.name: Great food! Beautiful beach.  Super massages.  200 peso an hour
261476380.author: a TripAdvisor user
261476380.reviewBody: Love this beach. Great restaurant.   B try the coconut shrimp.  Clean washrooms.  Purified ice  and water.  Clean beaches.   Super massages

260230515.name: Nice beach
260230515.author: a TripAdvisor user
260230515.reviewBody: Nice flat lengthy beach, water was relatively calm. Black sand in places - super hot on bare feet! Lots of beach chairs available.

259041320.name: Long, sandy, fun in the sun kind of beach.
259041320.author: a TripAdvisor user
259041320.reviewBody: This is a public beach. Lots of locals & vacationers from hotels in town etc. A few hotels are across the street from this beach. It is a great place to hang out for a day. Lots of little shops to buy souvenirs, restauants & bars dot the beach. Fun waves that are great to play in. Long enough beach that during the week you don\'t have to be right next to someone. Cleaner than some public beaches but not perfect (if you are picky about that). Beach chairs, umbrella rentals, & boogie board rentals. Tons of floater toys, rafts to buy dirt cheap. Direct sunlight all day. Bring your sunscreen. Fun day in the hot, Mexican sun.

257568510.name: Nice stretch of beach with beautiful views
257568510.author: a TripAdvisor user
257568510.reviewBody: We took a cab here from our resort since we heard it was the best beach in Manzanillo. It was definitely beautiful with views of the mountains but the day we went it was rougher with huge waves so we enjoyed the boogie boarding but was too rough for my 4 year old to swim in. On a calm day I\'m sure this would be an amazing beach for swimming. Rent the chairs/umbrealla for 100 pesos and rent boogie boards for 600 pesos for 2 hrs. Also has markets all along the beach and also some restaurants and cafes. We would return again

255046930.name: Great Beaches
255046930.author: a TripAdvisor user
255046930.reviewBody: Not alot of vendors to bother you while relaxing on the beaches. Locals are wonderful people and very patient with tourists

254391687.name: Fantastic Beach!
254391687.author: a TripAdvisor user
254391687.reviewBody:
The nicest tropical beach I have ever visited, and I have seen a few. The bay keeps the waves just right, rarely too violent with sections that are perfect for swimming and others that are more adventurous. 

The vendors are persistent and annoying with little to recomend them though I would reccomend seeing Elsa for a massage near Gran Festivall resort. She is a pro with hands of steel.

Lots of great shopping and a beautiful walk. Bring pesos with you the locals will always try to convert USD at 10:1 which is a total rip off. Some will take Canadian dollars still at 10:1 which is actually not a bad rate. Same rules apply as any other beach Caveat Emptor, know the value of what you want, comparison shop and be prepared to walk away.

253244982.name: Take the Bus
253244982.author: a TripAdvisor user
253244982.reviewBody: Playa Miramar is a nice long stretch of beach f you enjoy walking the beach. There is lots of little shops and bars to enjoy as well. Bring PESOS.

253166989.name: Beautiful beach
253166989.author: a TripAdvisor user
253166989.reviewBody: Love love love this beach. Most favourite place in Manzanillo. Be sure to visit Oasis Beach Club for supper in the restaurant and lunch on the beach. Tuesday and Friday are live music happy hour on the beach from 4:30-6:30. So much fun. Watch out for sand flies- be sure to bring your Deet bug spray. I came home looking like I have the chicken pox and very itchy!

252655125.name: very beautiful beach, specially in the morning
252655125.author: a TripAdvisor user
252655125.reviewBody:
the beach surrounded by mountain, and very wide and flat. sand color is little dark compare with Cancun, brown or black.

Water is little dirty with lots bubble. lots people walk along with beach. 

food stand, souvenir store. take a nice day and walk on the beach is very romantic.

249350336.name: Don\'t go early
249350336.author: a TripAdvisor user
249350336.reviewBody: My husband and I headed out at 930am arriving there close to ten am, the area doesn\'t open until 11am we walked up and down the beach for a while. Being just the 2 of us I wasn\'t keen on leaving my bag and joining him for a swim. He played in the waves for half hour whe I sat on the beach and read my book. \nIt costs $15 for four chairs and a table an additional $2.50 for each chair. Beach was really nice and clean, washroom costs 50 cents to use and there is no seat, there\'s a lady that takes your money and hands you toilet paper. As we were there before it opened we couldn\'t get a cab so we had to walk back and try to flag one down.\nI\'m sure it would be a great place as there are kiosks set up and there\'s a bar to get booze. We were there too early.

249007147.name: watch the power of the waves
249007147.author: a TripAdvisor user
249007147.reviewBody: we went to  miramar a couple of times . some tables you need to pay for and some will wave the fee if you order drinks and food . , ,played in the waves and was having a good time , but one wave  hit us and my hubby got two broken ribs,   good thing it wasn\'t his neck .  , just be careful , they can knock you  and roll you pretty easy

245864680.name: Great beach for all types of activities
245864680.author: a TripAdvisor user
245864680.reviewBody: Playa Miramar is a very long, wide sandy beach. There are areas where it is busy (near the restaurants) and also where there is no one. Lots of good restaurants, beach activities, and mercados to buy souvenirs. Lately, there have been massage tents set up. There\'s nothing better than a good massage at the beach for a reasonable price (300 pesos for an hour). Relax, spend some time, and enjoy the sand, surf and ambiance.

242728885.name: Nice Beach
242728885.author: a TripAdvisor user
242728885.reviewBody: Either empty (most of the time) or ridiculously crowded (any holiday and especially Semana Santa), this is a nice beach with moderate undertow (you can get into trouble in the surf here). Some reasonable seafood joints on the west end and not too agressive trinket sellers. Worth a visit.

226021016.name: PERFECT LONG AND WIDE WALKING BEACH
226021016.author: a TripAdvisor user
226021016.reviewBody: A great beach with a wide assortment of activities and restaurants.One of those special Mexican beaches where they sell everything you can imagine on the beach. Don\'t get upset with the vendors. A simple courteous " No Gracies" and they will walk away if you don\'t want to buy what they are selling.An important note! If your eyes show interest or you ask a question they will stay there as long as it takes to sell you something. Stop for a drink at the Oasis restaurant, there is a lot of activities  there including group volleyball . This is where the young hip group of Manzanillo locals hang out, but great for  all ages. Put it on your Manzanillo vacation list!. #1 for those long romantic beach walks.

213938837.name: Playa Miramar..Beautiful Sand beach and seafood !!!
213938837.author: a TripAdvisor user
213938837.reviewBody: Address for Playa Miramar is incorrect. .You should look for ...\nnear Boulevard Costero Miguel de la Madrid 60\n28860 Manzanillo, COL...Else near Bar Boramos !!!

202477862.name: Beautiful!
202477862.author: a TripAdvisor user
202477862.reviewBody: It is a beautiful and very long beach! Several nice places to eat or to have a drink,they let you use the umbrellas for free.It is calmer beach and allots of people use this.Nice hand big hotels near.

201287241.name: great fro wave jumping
201287241.author: a TripAdvisor user
201287241.reviewBody: Wonderful place to relax in a deck chair and sip a cold beer and eat nachos, huachinago or shrimp tacos..

199335698.name: Great beach!
199335698.author: a TripAdvisor user
199335698.reviewBody: Miramar Beach is great to take a really long walk on.  There are several nice little eating establishments with umbrellas on the beach.  All you have to do is order a beer or something to eat and you can stay all day.  Surf is calmer than the beach in Manzanillo and the water is warm!

198345407.name: Nice typical Mexican beach.
198345407.author: a TripAdvisor user
198345407.reviewBody: Any week day the beach is lightly populated, but on the weekends it bustles with activity. the most populated is Sunday, that\'s when all the families go to the beach. It\'s fun to people watch all those families, from the little children to the grandparents... they include all the family.

195968345.name: Beautiful Beach
195968345.author: a TripAdvisor user
195968345.reviewBody: We had a great time at Miramar.  The water was perfect, the weather was beautiful and it was very clean.  Such a long stretch of beautiful beach.  I can\'t wait to go back!!!

195800371.name: Great Waves
195800371.author: a TripAdvisor user
195800371.reviewBody: This beach has excellent waves for body surfing or boogie boarding. The water is so warm and the sand is soft. Get a palpa and enjoy!

194681063.name: Typical and nice Mexican beach
194681063.author: a TripAdvisor user
194681063.reviewBody: We were only in Manzanillo for two days and went to the beach once. Also rented a boat a viewed the beach from the water. There is  a crowded section with typical Mexican restaurants and a long strech of nice beach for walking or just being quasi alone.\nHad some very nice live brown clams and fairly good oysters in one of the small seafood restaurant right on the beach.\nPleasent visit and experience.

194678660.name: The Golden Beach
194678660.author: a TripAdvisor user
194678660.reviewBody: This beach extends for miles with lots of little reataurants, a great little market, and lots of big waves to play in. Not alot of venders that come and bug you. The mango on a stick is delicious. The sand has flakes of gold in it that sparkle in the sunlight. \nA definite visit for all new and old visitors.

193924244.name: Best beach!
193924244.author: a TripAdvisor user
193924244.reviewBody: Huge beach that extends for miles. Great Marketplace for souvenirs. The beach area is usually empty, with soft sand that goes out a distance into the ocean

192882382.name: Oasis beach club makes this a lovely beach
192882382.author: a TripAdvisor user
192882382.reviewBody: The best offsite natural beach in Carmina Manzanillo.  The Oasis Club extends its bev and food service to the sand.  They offer very comfortable chairs and umbrellas and all you have to do is buy a few drinks from them. BUT dont go in the surf thinking you are just going to wade in the water waist deep and not get wet. Large ship waves roll in that surprise you/us.... and now thier is a cool fish with a new Raybans. Lol.

192864929.name: Boring
192864929.author: a TripAdvisor user
192864929.reviewBody: A long beach full of boredom!!! No people at the beach, no vendors, it was boring!!! Stopped at one restaurant and had a light lunch, don\'t remember the name but it was ok.

190209158.name: One of the Best Beaches Ever
190209158.author: a TripAdvisor user
190209158.reviewBody:
Playa Miramar a beach of gold flecks and crashing waves. A great place to spend and afternoon at the flea market, drinking cervezas and eating delicious fresh seafood all with the wonderful view of the ocean.

Great for swimming, surfing, body boarding, walking, people watching, drinking, bargain hunting, getting a massage or just lounging for lunch.

If you eat at any of the restaurants along the beach, they waive the rental fee for the umbrellas and chairs.

190158282.name: beautiful stretch of beach
190158282.author: a TripAdvisor user
190158282.reviewBody: we took a long walk along this beach and the waves that day were pretty good, so we didn\'t go swimming but later in our stay the water was calmer and it was more inviting. Some great little bars/restaurants along here also. Definitely worth the bus ride to get there!

187305140.name: Best Beach in Manzanillo
187305140.author: a TripAdvisor user
187305140.reviewBody: My friend and I travelled to Manzanillo from December 1-8.  On the 7th, we decided to hit the market in Santiago and then spend some time at Miramar Beach.  The west coast of Mexico is beautiful but the beaches aren\'t very swimmable because of the undertow and waves.  Miramar is different - the sand is wonderful and we didn\'t see a rock in the water at all.  You have to walk out about 100 yards before you encounter waves that will reach your waist.  The beach stretches a long way and is a great place to interact with locals.  There are some shops and b bars nearby and some vendors across the street.  If you are heading to this beach from Manzanillo, just hop on the bus, pay your 7 pesos and you are there is next to no time.

185780987.name: Playa Miramar in Santoiago
185780987.author: a TripAdvisor user
185780987.reviewBody: Miramar, by far, the best beach in Manzanillo. Great for families and kids. The crystal clear water of Playa Miramar is something to enjoy. We live here full time and use the beach most every day of the week.

181017223.name: Fun beach for active people!
181017223.author: a TripAdvisor user
181017223.reviewBody: We went body surfing. Rented palapas and bought some beers and seafood on a stick. There is a guy who has a surf shack across the street. He was awesome. The whales were in the distance, which was so cool. You do need to be in shape as body boarding is quite a workout. All in all it was really awesome and I can\'t wait to go back.

163354712.name: Great beach
163354712.author: a TripAdvisor user
163354712.reviewBody: Great beach for kids and adults. We came in June and the beach is very quiet without a lot of crowds. The water temp is perfect and there has been a nice breeze while we were here. The west end of the beach has quite a few ramada restaurants and more at the east end. Try El Indio in the middle for some great coconut shrimp. Great beach for long walks.

161444143.name: ONe of the most beautiful and clean beaches I have seen
161444143.author: a TripAdvisor user
161444143.reviewBody: We have enjoyed the beach there so much. It is wonderful to watch the pelicans driving for fish. The children and sometime adults flying their kites. The beach is a very long , nearly a large U shape. If you are a person that like to rest, read and watch people welcome to Playa Miramar. You will never get tired on it. Heading back next year. See ya

159378841.name: Great Beach for everyone
159378841.author: a TripAdvisor user
159378841.reviewBody: Lots of little restaurants to park your butt at for the day... Fresh grilled fish will be served, along with fresh coconut drinks and a healthy dose of sunshine...\nShopping while tanning for all types of sarapes, scarves, shorts and jewelry... Horse back riding on the beach, and riding the waves... \nWhat more could you want, and all for about 5.00 pesos from town...

156683677.name: One of our favourite beaches for a walk
156683677.author: a TripAdvisor user
156683677.reviewBody: We have travelled nearly 20,000 miles on sailboats along the east and west coasts of north and central america and through the caribbean.   Miramar and Santiago beaches are favorites of ours for WALKING.   A lovely variety of sights and feels...ramada shops and eateries at the west end, luxurious homes in the middle, beach resorts and open beach at the east end.   Lovely firm sand with sandpipers and plovers running along the seafoam looking for lunch...

154292003.name: Miramar in February
154292003.author: a TripAdvisor user
154292003.reviewBody: The sand is mixed with black and gold, and there were huge flocks of cormorants, groups of pelicans and diving terns which didn\'t seem to mind our presence in the water.
