Nicely shaped waves, warm water and very safe feeling.  You can get a massage on the beach at the south end, and there are many great, inexpensive restaurants with views of the bay.   the water is not especially clear, but with a snorkel I was able to find many beds of blood sea stars in the sand, and we found a live sand dollar too.  Lots of little silver fish (which attracts the birds, no doubt).  Because we were there during the week and not when there is a major holiday, the beach was not crowded at all.    I learned after my second visit that there is a fairly clean bath house across the street where one can get a shower for 10 pesos.

152975552.name: Many people but nice place to swim and eat
152975552.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975552.reviewBody: To have fun and swimming.  we can rent umbrellas but very popular.  too much people for a long period if you want to relax.

152374554.name: A perfect beach for the family
152374554.author: a TripAdvisor user
152374554.reviewBody: Tranquil waves at the north end of the bay, a quiet place unless you go during the holiday season.  I snorkel to the shipwreck, eat at La Boquita and bob in the ocean for hours.

152074216.name: Great for shopping
152074216.author: a TripAdvisor user
152074216.reviewBody: Alot of little stores for shopping for that perfect souvineer. Plus tables and umbrellas on the beach for the men so they have something to do while you shop.

151191597.name: perfect place to waste a day.
151191597.author: a TripAdvisor user
151191597.reviewBody: so awesome! something for everyone. Shopping, sun bathing, surfing, drinking a ton of beer! We ordered a backet of beer and got 10 beers!! Make sure not to miss this place on your trip!

149301546.name: Great beach to spend an afternoon
149301546.author: a TripAdvisor user
149301546.reviewBody: Long, scenic beach with great waves to play in.  Can rent beach chairs (100 peso), surfboards, boogie boards (50 peso/ hr).  Vendors go up and down the beach with food (bbq shrimp, doughnuts, ice cream) and souvenirs and other trinkets.  Many restaurants and markets to shop in.  It was a great place to see, we went twice during our week long trip.

146967126.name: Long beach to romance
146967126.author: a TripAdvisor user
146967126.reviewBody: It\'s a mile long beach to surf, stroll or enjoy the view, there are little souvenir shops and taco shacks along the long road, you can rent a surf board and take lessons... nice place

131450100.name: Nice but...
131450100.author: a TripAdvisor user
131450100.reviewBody: Great to see the public beach, but it is not well taken care of.

131444837.name: Clean beach
131444837.author: a TripAdvisor user
131444837.reviewBody: Playa Miramar is awesome. We rented a chair/umbrella for $100 pesos and the vendors come to you. We order several beers and agua de coco. You can bargain on the prices with the vendors. Beach is clean and fun. I wouldn\'t recommend this beach for families as waves are high and rip currents are strong.

129822389.name: If you like bigger waves and/or surfing....
129822389.author: a TripAdvisor user
129822389.reviewBody: Miramar is the best beach for catching larger waves and/or surfing and there are plenty of beachside seafood restaurants to enjoy.

127481284.name: Colima Surfing Academy on Miramar Beach
127481284.author: a TripAdvisor user
127481284.reviewBody: (This should probably be it\'s own attraction category, but there wasn\'t one listed) We took a group of teenagers to get surfing lessons on Miramar beach.  Colima Surfing Academy was recommended to us by the Air Transat rep at our resort, Barcelo Karmina Palace.  It looked a little shaky at first, no one really around, small canopy set up on the beach (located at the end of Miramar closer toward Manzanillo Bay - I think this is opposite to the vendor and restaurant area).  Anyway, once "Pako" showed up, he arranged for surf boards for our kids and began the lessons - first on land, then in the water.  Our kids, aged 14-16, had never surfed before but wanted to give it a try.  The moms were a little apprehensive, but it turned out great!  All the kids were able to get up on the boards with the help of Pako and 2 helpers.  There were plenty of instructors in the water with them, instructing and keeping them safe.  They provided complementary juice for the kids during a break, and complimentary shade for the adults on the beach.  The cost of the lessons was $30 for one hour, but were offered a fantastic discount if we were to return for a second visit.  A great afternoon for all!

127137931.name: Wonderful walk of the beach & the best burritos!
127137931.author: a TripAdvisor user
127137931.reviewBody: Shops to get your souvenirs from, lots of places to eat (we were told about the "Il Tablao" but there plenty of restaurants), waves crashing right at your feet while you enjoy your lunch... And the sand is not that black!

126881184.name: nice sand
126881184.author: a TripAdvisor user
126881184.reviewBody: great long beach for walking with vendor shops in Kiosks

125958871.name: a great beach
125958871.author: a TripAdvisor user
125958871.reviewBody: This beach is a public beach. The waves are great for boogy boarding or body serfing. We always sit at the restaurant called El Tableo -- the good and service are great. It has been the same fellows who serve us every year

125471008.name: A long long beach
125471008.author: a TripAdvisor user
125471008.reviewBody: It is a huge beach, and has tables, umbrellas, and loungers you can rent. It always seems busy, and people do surfing there as there are often a lot of waves. This year they had a traffic man to make sure everyone could cross the street safely. There is a flea market there where you can barter and get good deals. There are several restaurants and bars in the general area.\nI think it is more of under 30 beach. But there is sure a lot of beach to walk, swim, etc The local buses all run up to here and past it.

125301566.name: Beautiful!
125301566.author: a TripAdvisor user
125301566.reviewBody: Amazing long beach, very shallow waters so it is very safe and fun for all ages.  Loved walking through some of the markets along this beach. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from with vendors selling fresh fruit and cold drinks!  Also had a great, cheap massage on the beach!

125201389.name: Loved the beach
125201389.author: a TripAdvisor user
125201389.reviewBody: The waves were fun, the food was great, the sand was soft, the markets were convenient!

125027538.name: great beach
125027538.author: a TripAdvisor user
125027538.reviewBody: loved walking this beach, and the flea market was great market

124437987.name: Saturday Flea Market
124437987.author: a TripAdvisor user
124437987.reviewBody: We went to the Saturday flea market - it was a fun experience and it was HOT. Remember to bring your water!

124305703.name: Cool beach
124305703.author: a TripAdvisor user
124305703.reviewBody: Long, lots of restaurants and places to rent/buy surfboards and boogie boards.

123605433.name: nice place
123605433.author: a TripAdvisor user
123605433.reviewBody: miramar is nice beach with fairly gentle surf.  it\'s pretty shallow so ok for kids.  Lots of vendors, lots of places to eat, generally a good time.

121222849.name: Great Beach with good restaurants
121222849.author: a TripAdvisor user
121222849.reviewBody: Playa Miramar is a long stretch of beach - great for walking at any time of the day. There are many good beach restaurants - El Tablao is our favorite - and small markets with Mexican crafts. There are many beach vendors. They will continously approach you. Just say "no, gracias" with a smile. If you show interest, even out of politeness, they will think that you are sincerely interested, and will bend over backwards to get you what you want...better to say "no thanks" if you are not interested.

120505446.name: Good food, Safe beach
120505446.author: a TripAdvisor user
120505446.reviewBody: Great place to play in the ocean and have really good seafood on the beach!

6725504.name: Great beach!
6725504.author: a TripAdvisor user
6725504.reviewBody: We just returned from a week at Manzanillo (jan24th - 31st, 2007)  We spent alot of time at this beach as it was right across from the resort we were staying at (Vista Playa do Oro).  We really enjoyed the beauty of the waves crashing onto the shore and watching so many people riding the big waves on bogey boards.  There were alot of pelicans along the ocean side as well- not annoyingly- but they served to be very entertaining as they would fly directly above the crest of the waves as if playing in the ocean!  This is a very long beach easily 5 kms long and was a great place to meet local people as well as tourists and was a good place to go for a walk to walk off all the calories we consumed by eating the delicious food at our resort. :)\n

1750041.name: A fun family style beach.
1750041.author: a TripAdvisor user
1750041.reviewBody: This is a super fun beach and is always busy. The waves are huge! And they are so fun to play in. You can get boogy boards and try riding the waves....I highly recommend this. It brings out the child in you. There are a lot of beach vendors that will come up to you all day. They will not bother you once you say "No, Gracias". They are just trying to make a little change. Plenty of food, drink and music. There are mariachi bands around which just stimulatesthe cultural appetites. This is a great beach with a lot of fun.

659506879.name: Small fishing village and tourist attraction
659506879.author: a TripAdvisor user
659506879.reviewBody: The town is unique and worth the visit. One of the high lights is taking a water taxi to Seafood restaurants. Each restaurant has it own taxi. The restaurant calls the taxi so return service is very simple. Any of the restaurants are good and basically the same so you can\u2019t go wrong. It will be a great experience. I\u2019ve visited many times and never been disappointed.

651912213.name: Pleasant little village with everything you need
651912213.author: a TripAdvisor user
651912213.reviewBody: Barra is a fun place to visit.  Lots of restaurants and tourists craft shops to visit.  Good street food as well as more upscale sit down places.  You can take a boat ride over to Isla Navidad or the Grand Bay hotel.  The ride is inexpensive and adds a little bit to the Barra experience.  There is a wave beach, surfing or boogey boarding,  on the outside of Malacon and a safer swimming beach on the inside.  Lots of hotels, guest houses etc.  Known as  a place to take fishing charters, although I think they are overpriced.  Clean friendly town, tourist oriented.  Take a local bus to Melaque, the ride is too fun.

646125128.name: Family birthday outing
646125128.author: a TripAdvisor user
646125128.reviewBody: Five adults, and two children; a thirty month and 12 month old, had a great time in Barra. \nApart from browsing and buying in the local clothes and artisan shops we went for a water trip to a restaurant on the Isla. Afterwards we did the return trip with an added extra voyage out to the sunken ship. \nEveryone enjoyed the day out. It was a great success. We love the ambiance and history of Barra.  We enjoying taking friends and relatives there for a fun day out. Highly recommended

613818185.name: barra de navidad
613818185.author: a TripAdvisor user
613818185.reviewBody: barra de navidad is one of not many town left in the world,this tow offer you the best Mexican food and the best fresh seafood in any restaurants, also you can enjoy watching how the sunset despair in the ocean.\nas a recreative sports, the best to do is surfing with northswell surf shop, the waves are really gentle for beginner and went the surf is hight is a quality weave for experts, you can do paddles boarding in the laguna really nice a calm area, you can do kayak as well,\nhorse ride, biking hiking a lot of thing more,

578170079.name: Wyndham Hotels
578170079.author: a TripAdvisor user
578170079.reviewBody: After a long trip and walk of the village we had the pleasure of dining for lunch at the pool terrace. Wonderful setting and excellent service, with good food.\nNice surprise!

566698743.name: Nice town, quiet beach
566698743.author: a TripAdvisor user
566698743.reviewBody:
Small town with good beach bars/restaurants.  Great for a day trip from Manzanillo.  

About 1 hour north on an upscale bus you can catch at the Primera Plus station at the Santiago station on the main boulevard in Manzanillo.  It was 49 pesos each way on the Coordinados bus line which left at 8:50am (also leaves at 10:30am or Primera Plus at 9:00 am for a few pesos more), we returned on the 4:50pm bus and I believe it goes about every hour till early evening.

We took the canal tour in Barra after walking around for about an hour.  It was 400 pesos for 5 of us for 30 minutes (about $6 CDN each).  Then ate lunch at Marys which is also a free boat ride into the inner lagoon and it was a beautiful setting with great food.  After that we spent some time at the beach, then caught the same style bus home.  Great time had by all.

566636294.name: good value seaside resort full of Canadians
566636294.author: a TripAdvisor user
566636294.reviewBody: lots of choice for where to stay. I chose the Bogavante which is right on the sea with infinity pool and probably the best in town. It cost me gbp 44 for a non seaview room which was usa sized with two double beds and a balcony overlooking the town centre (but wasn\'t noisy) it had efficient modern ac. lots of sunbeds overlooking, but above, the beach and ocean. Prior to this I stayed a week in the Posada Pacifico which didn\'t have ac but I had a room with double and single bed with shower, loo and basin plus tv and ceiling fan for gbp 80 a week room only. lots of places to eat, mostly frequented by North Americans, so prices a bit above normal but not extortianate NB the further away from the ocean you are the bugs start to appear (up to two blocks back is generally ok) and, when you reach the lagoon they are a menace (we went to walk to the "island" but abandoned this on a humid day as we were bitten badly). good transport links to pretty well everywhere in Mexico as two long distance operators have regular services) good local transport in rickety buses. BEWARE - airport miles from town and only taxis are available to travel from there which codsts a fortune. The trip back is more reasonable as you can negociate with local taxis. NB take your passport with you on trips out as there are lots of military checkpoints. Finally you can safely walk around at night in the downtown areas

565178566.name: Absolutely Beautiful
565178566.author: a TripAdvisor user
565178566.reviewBody: I took a taxi from Las Hadas hotel instead of a tour because I didn\u2019t want to take up most of the tap. Miguel Cerne (#129 taxi) was a great host. His English is very good. He allowed me to stop for pictures and stayed with me the whole time. He showed me around Barre Navidad and wad helpful in the shops. Coming back he stopped at a flea market at my request and was helpful again as I paid with US dollars this time. He only charged me $70 US for 4 hours. I highly recommend going here with Miguel if you can catch up with him.

563242653.name: Nice little town
563242653.author: a TripAdvisor user
563242653.reviewBody: Did a tour and stopped here and walked up and down the Main Street.  Walked the pier\nQuaint little place

560141641.name: Beautiful sunsets/Expat Overload
560141641.author: a TripAdvisor user
560141641.reviewBody: Don\u2019t expect a quaint Mexican beach town. The expats and north of the border tourists abound here, significantly diluting the recollection that this is Mexico. But the sunsets can be spectacular.

560100977.name: Visit once stay forever
560100977.author: a TripAdvisor user
560100977.reviewBody: We had a day at Barra Navidad. and it was great.  The beach was awesome, nice swimming. and really beautiful.  The little town was clean and safe and had anything you could want.  Many small inexpensive hotel that do monthly rents.   Very nice people there.

559420274.name: taxi trip from Barcelo Karmina 1300 peso and drive waited or us.  Spoke good english and explained sites along the way
559420274.author: a TripAdvisor user
559420274.reviewBody: must visit place, souvenirs cheaper than in Manzanillo, lots of bars and great beach. Cobblestone streets and happy people.

559066315.name: Pretty little town
559066315.author: a TripAdvisor user
559066315.reviewBody: This is a beautiful little seaside town. Lots of great places to walk and take pictures. The beach is beautiful, but just to look at, not to great for swimming.

558667043.name: Beautiful Location
558667043.author: a TripAdvisor user
558667043.reviewBody: \u201cBarra\u201d is a fishing village that has grown in to a popular expat and tourist town. However, it retains its charm and had added nice restaurants, a night-life and a variety of activities. The beach is not great for walking (too slanted and soft) and the water can be rough but, apparently the surfing is great. Worth a stop for sure.

558474375.name: Nice
558474375.author: a TripAdvisor user
558474375.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our time in Barra de Navidad. It is a great beach town with a pedestrian only street. Nice and clean with lots to do.

558344298.name: Sweet intimate spot on the water
558344298.author: a TripAdvisor user
558344298.reviewBody: This little town had been through hurricanes and continues to bounce back. Friendly people, great fresh sea food, bars and restaurants on the beach and lagoon. Small vendors and artisans. Feel very comfortable there!

558094741.name: A Beautiful small town by the sea
558094741.author: a TripAdvisor user
558094741.reviewBody: Heard about this place by word of mouth, stopped by on our drive back from Manzanillo to Puerto  Vallarta. The town is beautiful, safe and everyone is very friendly. I feel totally safe walking around. This made up for our visit to Manzanillo, and we would go back again. The only problem, it\'s a 3 hour drive from Puerto Vallarta. Manzanillo is closer, but not worth the trip.

556104373.name: Very attractive place.
556104373.author: a TripAdvisor user
556104373.reviewBody: Lovely views across the bay to Malaque. Possible to walk along the beach to get there  Nice boat ride to restaurant for a nice lunch.

555882199.name: Off the beaten path beach.
555882199.author: a TripAdvisor user
555882199.reviewBody: This beach was a 45min drive outside of Manzanillo. It was very similar to Las Olas in that it had large waves, and the sand was grainy but not fine. The main difference here is that is seemed very abandoned, very little activity and few people at this place, was a nice change from Olas Altas

554976471.name: Fishing and holiday
554976471.author: a TripAdvisor user
554976471.reviewBody: Just spent a week in Barra de Navidad. This was our second trip. We find this town to be super chill. Very safe and clean. My main purpose was to catch up with some fishing. My captain and now friend is Hernan Ramos.  He speaks excellent English and really knows his stuff when it comes to fishing out of Barra. I take my specialist gear for fly fishing, light spinning and surf casting. He has the equipment for trolling and is good quality. Hernan works really hard at not only getting you on the fish but also working with you so you achieve your plans and goals. Last week I spent 4 days in the boat and 1 surf and river fishing with him. I caught my first marlin and also landed several Dorado on fly. Light tackle jacks on the last day. I really recommend Hernan. He can be found among all the boats plying for business at the south end of town. Just ask for him. The guys (other fishermen)are really good and they can contact him if he\u2019s out Fishing. You can call him of course direct  +52 1 315 108 4441. If he is out Fishing there is no reception so just keep trying! He will leave dock at around 7am and be back 3-4pm. If you go just remember to tip him well! He works hard and the costs are the best I\u2019ve had in Mexico.

554258028.name: Nice Day Trip
554258028.author: a TripAdvisor user
554258028.reviewBody: Nice short drive from Manzanillo to a fairly quiet little beach town.  A nice pier area to stroll and a multitude of water taxi options - we elected to cross over to the hotel across the bay, thinking it would offer some interesting walking.  that was the case to a certain extent, but mostly fenced in areas.  The small boat harbor is interesting.  Everything from massive yachts to small skiffs.  Nice street shopping opportunities and hard to chose from the many small restaurants.

553864819.name: Lovely and unique
553864819.author: a TripAdvisor user
553864819.reviewBody:
Stayed at Casa Blanco hotel. Great inexpensive hotel.

The town is authentic and filled with friendly locals.

The golf course is fabulous offering three nines. The cost of golf is similar to other top Mexican resorts and the lack of players makes for a great round at a good pace.

Be sure to take the boat over to Colima to have dinner.

Wonderful restaurants pop up along the street at night serving local fare at most reasonable prices.

Don’t expect a lively night life but there is enough to keep busy.

Not the best beach but just 20 minutes by bus away is a pretty good beach with lots of mom and pop places to sit and have a drink.

The city basically runs on cash so have pesos. One ATM in town and is often out of money.

Great little place

553584148.name: Day trip
553584148.author: a TripAdvisor user
553584148.reviewBody: Free water taxi to Mary\'s Restaurant... Delicious sea food and drinks at a reasonable cost..,, Fantastic experience

553291017.name: calm little beach town
553291017.author: a TripAdvisor user
553291017.reviewBody: If you\'re a calm and relaxed person, not willing to party hard - this might be your place. Or if you\'re above 60. Some restaurants, some bar. Incredible views.

551282360.name: Locals and Visitors - SAFE
551282360.author: a TripAdvisor user
551282360.reviewBody: A great mix of locals and international visitors to this beach.   Great place to get some sun, swim in the ocean and meet some local people.  Everyone is very friendly.  We ended up playing an impromptu game of soccer on the beach.\n

548230661.name: Nice little town
548230661.author: a TripAdvisor user
548230661.reviewBody: We stopped here for a couple of hours. Had lunch in what seemed a very typical Mexican place which was great however I didn\u2019t catch the name of the place. We walked around and stopped by the beach for a little. After taking pictures of the Barra De Navidad sign there we decided to try out one of the boat rides. Was 45 minutes and was nice to get out on the water and see the area from a different view. All in all was a nice chilled and relaxing day.

544317040.name: Love this place
544317040.author: a TripAdvisor user
544317040.reviewBody: We stayed at Cabo Blanco, loved the towns of Barra and Melaque, very mexican feel, we especially loved eating on the town all the fresh tacos.\n\nThis has become our favourite place to come in the winter.

543674343.name: I LOVE IT
543674343.author: a TripAdvisor user
543674343.reviewBody: This place is amaizing!! i will love to live here , is like a Little town with an amaizing view , all the people is really friendly

537858875.name: Day Trip From Manzanillo
537858875.author: a TripAdvisor user
537858875.reviewBody: Staying in Manzanillo Centro we decided to take a bus north to Barra de Navidad for lunch.  Taxi to the bus station ($50 P), ETN 09:50 bus to Barra ($85 P) took about 70 minutes.  Walked the main street to the end of the pier then caught a panga ($30 P return) to Isla Navidad and had lunch at La Plazuela on the outdoor patio in the Bay Grand Hotel.  Back to the pier, wandered some more and caught the 14:50 ETN back to Manzanillo bus station.  \n\nOur last visit to Barra was in 1997.  The pier has been upgraded to a nice walkway, the road to the pier now has permanent buildings with many restaurants and tourist shops.  The town still has a 70\u2019s hippy vibe IMO, laid back and calming.  We enjoyed the visit and upscale (expensive) lunch at the Bay Grand.

510560080.name: Beautiful little town
510560080.author: a TripAdvisor user
510560080.reviewBody: Great views from restaurants, amazing food, all restaurantas are very affordable and you get really fresh food, the place is great because is very warm but very breezy

506344159.name: Close to nice beaches
506344159.author: a TripAdvisor user
506344159.reviewBody: Grateful for Marlena\'s restaurant and other beaches that are within a short drive.  The personal attention at Marlena\'s, service and food make it worth a stop in Barra.  Other beaches worth seeing are La Manzanilla, Punta Perula and Isla Cocina.

501495543.name: Enchanting
501495543.author: a TripAdvisor user
501495543.reviewBody: We sailed down from Puerto Vallarta just before Xmas and discovered this enchanting little town perched on a sandbar with a beautiful long curved sandy beach with tourquoise  water and a quiet lagoon full of fish. The bird life is amazing. There are  lots of charming restaurants overlooing both the lagoon and pacific serving authentic Mexican food, not tex-mex.... You have to take a water taxi to  some of them which is free and great fun. The snorkling is great,  glorious  sunsets watched from the malecon and the beautiful Grand Isle hotel, a hige resort opens their arms to cruisers. It was the best holiday we have had by far. Just the ticket!

487448451.name: End of season quiet
487448451.author: a TripAdvisor user
487448451.reviewBody: Great place!  Beach very nice.  Park at harbor entrance.  Lots of shops and restaurants!  Friendly place.  Easy parking.  Empty of people this time of year!

474559574.name: Barra and environ
474559574.author: a TripAdvisor user
474559574.reviewBody: Spent a day touring Barra, Malachi and La Manzanilla with special lunch at Mary\'s Restaurant. Over the years it has always been a destination place for our first time visitors to the area. Great for walking and easily accessible.

472409062.name: Beautiful town
472409062.author: a TripAdvisor user
472409062.reviewBody: Took the bus from Manzanillo for a day long visit, beautiful town , great shops with unique items and restaurants, friendly locals. amazing views of the sunset, would recommend to anyone.

471919588.name: Nice beach town. Lots of expats!
471919588.author: a TripAdvisor user
471919588.reviewBody: Neat town. beautiful beach, good shopping, lots of beach front bars and restaurants.  Worth the bus trip up from Manzanillo.

471273697.name: Some nice shops
471273697.author: a TripAdvisor user
471273697.reviewBody: This was kind of a long drive from our resort and only slightly worth it.  There were a few shops that were a little more authentic art.  One store in particular had some nice beaded work.  The view along the beach was nice.

470186629.name: Relaxing day on the beach
470186629.author: a TripAdvisor user
470186629.reviewBody: Went on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed!   Very busy with myriad restaurants, lots of kids, beautiful weather.

469853695.name: Fantastic little town
469853695.author: a TripAdvisor user
469853695.reviewBody: This is a wonderful town to unwind and relax in. Lots of little shops and restaurants. Plenty of live music. There\'s not a Starbucks or McDonalds anywhere in sight. You walk everywhere. The locals are friendly. There are several inexpensive day trips available to nearby beaches and towns. Thoroughly enjoyed my time in Barra.

468430182.name: Gorgeous area
468430182.author: a TripAdvisor user
468430182.reviewBody: We wandered the streets checking out all the lovely little shops.  Stopped for lunch & later on, dinner. Stayed later for great entertainment.  Took a little boat ride over to the Grand Hotel.

468187514.name: Lot\'s to do for a 7 day visit...
468187514.author: a TripAdvisor user
468187514.reviewBody:
We've been to many other destinations in Mexico including P.Vallarta, P.del Carmen, Cancun, Cabo, Mazatlan, La Paz, etc. and this was the best week long winter break we've ever had. 

Weather in March was absolutely perfect. Mid 80's everyday, sunny every day, slightly overcast one day (needed that). 

The town of Barra, charming and easy to explore on foot. Nearby town of Melaque a 15 minute bus ride away or a long walk on the beach. NOTE: local buses are bumpy, suspension is not a thing here. La Manzanilla 40 min by bus to see crocodiles, do a beach day, eat at a beach front seafood restaurant. Cuastecomete, a handicap accessible beach village accessible by taxi 100 peso's. Totally worth the visit if you like to swim and snorkel. Some seaside eateries, but not as many as La Manzanilla. Manzanillo is a big port city and worth a visit especially if you need supplies. We didn't go there but if we return we probably would take a trip in and check it out. 

A week is the perfect amount of time to spend here. Foodwise, compared to other Mexican tourist locations, in our opinion Barra is less expensive, and more interesting. We did not do all inclusive and really enjoyed trying all the restaurants everywhere as well as the street food (oil drum chicken, oh my how delish). 

The people here are very genuine. Obviously, how people treat you is often reflective of how you treat them. This region appears to be poorer than other areas we've been to perhaps due to the devastation of the last hurricane from which the tourism has yet to recover fully.

467099553.name: Good food, calm beach
467099553.author: a TripAdvisor user
467099553.reviewBody: If you go on a weekend (or specially on a holiday) expect service to be quite slow, the calm surroundings make it a great scenario for a place to enjoy your meal and the company.

466389740.name: Awesome view of the ocean
466389740.author: a TripAdvisor user
466389740.reviewBody: it\'s almost unreal , but ... it\'s there - come an see it yourself - will be back this april 2017 for more !!

465332569.name: Merry Christmas Town
465332569.author: a TripAdvisor user
465332569.reviewBody: This town is built on a sand-spit which was affected by Hurricane Patricia in October 2015.  Most of the damage has been repaired, but a few hotels just haven\'t completely recovered.  The ocean beach used to be accessible from all of the small restaurants along the west side of town.  Now, however, there is a rock bulkhead protecting those same restaurants, so you can sit at the bulkhead, but not directly on the sandy beach.  If you are a boater anchored on the Lagoon side of town, the town\'s French bakery will deliver via water taxi ($30 pesos).  Lots of good restaurants, reasonably priced.  Lots of ex-pats who came to visit and never left, so a large international community in the small town.  We have been visiting for over 13 years, and love this Mexican tourist town.  Tienda (Market) days are on Thursday.

463782360.name: Famaily vacation
463782360.author: a TripAdvisor user
463782360.reviewBody: Spent the whole day shopping eating and playing on the beach. A lot of canadians so we felt right at home.

462840088.name: Fun at the sunset lounge
462840088.author: a TripAdvisor user
462840088.reviewBody: This was a fun experience, the drinks were great but beware of the margarita\'s they are powerful!!  The sunset views are fantastic.

462037046.name: Charming seaside village!
462037046.author: a TripAdvisor user
462037046.reviewBody: Barra is a wonderful collection of restaurants, small hotels, and shops with welcoming people everywhere. Very hospitable village and well worth a visit!

462033696.name: quaint town great restaurants decent beach
462033696.author: a TripAdvisor user
462033696.reviewBody: friendly people good food very inexpensive ! decent fishing ! many beaches take a water taxi to Colima for lunch or dinner !

461725191.name: Small town flavor, beautiful bay.
461725191.author: a TripAdvisor user
461725191.reviewBody: Range of accommodations and fishing opportunities can make this a budget destination of interest.  The lagoon provides the safest swimming opportunity, as steep grades on the sand beach limit safe swimming, though the lagoon offers options.  Shops and restaurants are definitely fun to check-out.  Easily strolls.\nThere are a variety of small hotels to accommodate long and shorter visitoes.\nThere is a circulator bus that connects the town with Malaque on the West end of the bay.

461006675.name: Beach is super clean, long enough to walk to next town over
461006675.author: a TripAdvisor user
461006675.reviewBody: Good warm water. Beach has different surf of waves as is curved, less steep towards Melaque. Not very busy. Sunsets are outstanding and we\'ll worth it every night

460804874.name: Visited the Thursday market
460804874.author: a TripAdvisor user
460804874.reviewBody: Rode around the countryside seeing plantations, a crocodile sanctuary, and the Thursday market.  Interesting, small village.

456551900.name: Lazy Days
456551900.author: a TripAdvisor user
456551900.reviewBody: We had 4 fun filled days in the charming small town of Barra.  We found it tourist friendly and very walkable.  Colorful shops, bars and restaurants galore all very reasonably priced.  Beautiful sunrises and sunsets.                                                              TIP:  bug spray a must

456443724.name: What a surprise!!!!!
456443724.author: a TripAdvisor user
456443724.reviewBody: Stayed in the marina that was connected to a beautiful hotel.  The Grand Bay.  This "Grand" hotel was something out of a dream.  Set in a very quaint fishing village, it looked out of place.  An oasis in a desert .  Stunning!!!!!!  The song Hotel California kept running through my head.  The village was small with cobblestone streets, dirt floors, wonderful people, and amazing food.  I want to go again and do more exploring.  What a pleasant surprise.

454524676.name: Worth a drive
454524676.author: a TripAdvisor user
454524676.reviewBody: A 45-minute drive north took us past miles of beautiful banana plantations and coconut groves to the touristy fishing town of Barra de Navidad.

448142484.name: Great small town on the Mexico coast.
448142484.author: a TripAdvisor user
448142484.reviewBody: If you want a small town experience with a welcoming feel this is it.  It is a mix of expats and locals.  Good restaurants.  Take the boat trip over to the small island for lunch.  Fun.

441441259.name: Pretty little town
441441259.author: a TripAdvisor user
441441259.reviewBody: We stayed in Manzanillo but drove in to see Barra Navidad.  It has grown quite a bit since our last visit but still had its little town feel.  Next time I think we would like to stay here as smaller and cozier feel.

438071898.name: Beautiful little town
438071898.author: a TripAdvisor user
438071898.reviewBody: My parents retired in Melaque, which is a quick bus ride from Barra de navidad and we frequent it often.  Thursdays is market day there, so we go for that, or to perhaps take the pongo over the water for breakfast, or just to walk the Melacon.  It\'s a little more "touristy" of a town than Melaque, or San Patricio, but it\'s still got that authentic Mexican feel and the people are lovely and friendly.  Great restaurants, and lots of shopping.  Remember this is a more touristy town, so the pricing will be a little higher but even if it\'s just to spend a day playing in the surf, along the Melacon on the beach it\'s worth a trip to Barra.

434653302.name: A warm breath of heaven
434653302.author: a TripAdvisor user
434653302.reviewBody: We visit Barra every year if possible. We always stay at Playa Grande which is a short drive away at Isla de Navidad. Barra is a small tourist town overflowing with friendly atmosphere. Make sure you visit the street market on Thursdays in the centre of town. Breakfast at Bananas overlooking the harbour. Fishing for Dorado on the Marie Chui, holds my best memories. Golf at the Grande Bay resort across the lagoon. Watching the sunset over the miles of beach with a Pinacolada. Heaven.

420845334.name: Paradise
420845334.author: a TripAdvisor user
420845334.reviewBody: This is a small fishing village just an hour from Manzanillo. They have a flea market on Thursdays, very clean with great prices. Variety of restaurants, bars and shopping. Small boutique hotels. Easy to get around in.

399617196.name: One of the most gorgeous beaches accessible from Manzanillo!
399617196.author: a TripAdvisor user
399617196.reviewBody: Gorgeous! A highlight of our Manzanillo trip. Wishing we could have been in Barra Navidad for an additional day.

393513034.name: WOW WHAT a SUNSET
393513034.author: a TripAdvisor user
393513034.reviewBody: Little seaside village where EVERYTHING is within walking distance. Restaurants line the beach . . . facing west. BEST sunset views on the costalegre.

392368321.name: Beautiful beach
392368321.author: a TripAdvisor user
392368321.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful, the colors of the ocean were mazing. \nThe bad thing was that the ocean was pretty rough. The locals told us that it was a few days like that, but usually it has pretty peaceful water.

384136711.name: Great town to visit
384136711.author: a TripAdvisor user
384136711.reviewBody: We came to Manzanillo on a three day visit, today Sunday it was raining here in Manzanillo so I decided to drive our family to Barra De Navidad.  I great full that I did.  The beach was nice and calm great even for small children.  We stay for the day.  We paid for a small boat trip that included taking us across to small beach across from the bay.  We really enjoyed the beach and the food.  Next time I am coming to stay in the town.

379791379.name: Manzanillo beach is OK
379791379.author: a TripAdvisor user
379791379.reviewBody: The beach is clean and nice, the city is no good, so sorry. Miguel Alem\u00e1n Av. Not is clean, the malec\u00f3n is short

374820673.name: beach town
374820673.author: a TripAdvisor user
374820673.reviewBody: Barra, a cute little town on the beach, Living in Melaque for 6 months I had many opportunities to visit Barra de Navidad.  The town is clean with a good selection of restaurants, bars and hotels.  During the tourist season, October to April there are more gringo\'s than locals.

373900598.name: Beautiful Village
373900598.author: a TripAdvisor user
373900598.reviewBody: I have been going to Manzanillo for years but until this year I had not visited Barra. Wow, what a mistake. I love the place. Lots of good restaurants and the best beach in this part of Mexico. I can only say it -- GO!.

367898240.name: Nice relaxaed town
367898240.author: a TripAdvisor user
367898240.reviewBody: I live here and have don for the last 13 years. I actually live just outside town but enjoy the relaxed atmosphere here. Good fishing, good food. The climate certainly beats the UK too!

367533499.name: Nice little town
367533499.author: a TripAdvisor user
367533499.reviewBody: Nice little town with excellent sea food a lot of little shops and a nice beach. Very safe it has a little rustic bay that offers water taxi services .

366011801.name: Beautiful Blue Beaches from The Pacific @ Barra de Navidad, Jalisco
366011801.author: a TripAdvisor user
366011801.reviewBody: From my personal experience, all the beaches in Mexico are the best we have been. Really beautiful beaches, excellent food and overall quality service. Barra de Navidad is not the exception, one of the most popular touristic spot besides Puerto Vallarta. Recommended for sea lovers and honyemooners (of all ages, of course!).

361847761.name: NIce to visit
361847761.author: a TripAdvisor user
361847761.reviewBody: It is a small village with restaurants and shops. You can take a boat to visit the surrondings or go visit Grand Isla Navidad resort.

360083416.name: Remember when ?
360083416.author: a TripAdvisor user
360083416.reviewBody: We first visited Barra de Navidad in the early 80\'s. Neat place those days, one old hotel ( I looked around for Humphrey Bogart). Boy has it changed! Thanks Gringos. Very touristico, lots of junk to buy (probably hecho en Taiwan).

358516554.name: RLM
358516554.author: a TripAdvisor user
358516554.reviewBody: Beautiful marina and nice resort facilities. Quaint town with a lovely beach. We did not see the rooms at the Grand hotel but the pool was nice and large.\nThe Sunset Bar on the beach in town is a great spot for a cocktail.

357469470.name: Barra de navidad
357469470.author: a TripAdvisor user
357469470.reviewBody: Barra de navida is a beutiful place,love the food and night clubs.the laguna is just something els.Would like to go again!!

355158456.name: Great town with some very good restaurants
355158456.author: a TripAdvisor user
355158456.reviewBody:
I was recently down visiting a friend who has a house about 20 minutes outside of Barra.

We spent a lot of time in town during my visit. The first day I was there, someone was hosting a fundraiser in in the main square. It included cooking classes for 50 pesos followed by a food tasting in the afternoon. They must of had 20 booths where you could buy tokens and sample the food. All of it was excellent!

There is a very good market in town every Thursday. The lady selling the silver jewelry has an excellent selection of some very nice pieces.

There are many restaurants, bars and shops to visit in this lovely town!

354857976.name: Great day trip!
354857976.author: a TripAdvisor user
354857976.reviewBody: We stay in Manzanillo regularly but always make a day trip to Barra de Navidad.  One side of the small town faces the open ocean where surfers are always out catching waves.  On the other side is the bay where you will find pongas (small wooden boats) and their captains ready to take you on a variety of tours....all very inexpensive.  You can take one over to the other side of the bay and eat at one of several restaurants that serve the FRESHEST of seafoods!  The bar owners are friendly and inviting.  The shopping is great!!!

353129305.name: Fun town on the ocean
353129305.author: a TripAdvisor user
353129305.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend the day with lots of little boutique shops, restaurants with mariachi bands. You can also take a boat over to an island for several other restaurants and a beautiful hotel to stay at. \n

352974999.name: A beautiful beach town
352974999.author: a TripAdvisor user
352974999.reviewBody: Surf is feisty, we did not swim, but it was very beautiful, the outdoor market on Thursdays is really good, we hired a boat and took a little tour around the area which was also really nice. Great spot for a holiday.

351679266.name: Want to feel like a tourist?
351679266.author: a TripAdvisor user
351679266.reviewBody:
Barra de Navidad is located 30 minutes from the Manzanillo airport and 1 hour north of Manzanillo. There is a vendor market on the streets on Thursdays. The Malecon offers many photo opportunities across the channel from the Grand Isla Navidad Resort. 
There are a number of restaurants and bars, but if you go 30 metres past the Malecon, your can take a free water taxi to Mary's Restaurant. The boat ride is about 5 minutes and you get good views of the inlet. The food is also good and reasonably priced. 

As you walk the streets, vendors will come and offer you trinkets and such. Sometimes they are a bit aggressive and you have to firmly tell them that you are not interested.

There are plenty of shops that sell resort/beach clothing, and unique household items. The Thursday market vendors sell pottery, clothing and novelty wares.

If you are in the Manzanillo area, Barra de Navidad is  worth spending a day.

351666620.name: Time Out Bar
351666620.author: a TripAdvisor user
351666620.reviewBody: This bar is the best bar in Barra de Navidad. The owners and staff treat you like royalty. Service us excellent, prices are cheap the best drinks and live music in Barra. Don\'t miss this place. Second floor bar with the most amazing view of the sunsets on the bay.

350814977.name: Best staff ever, friendly and warm!!
350814977.author: a TripAdvisor user
350814977.reviewBody: Barra Navidad Grand Bay Marina and Resort was the highlight of our Mexico Travels in this region.  The staff  was so hospitable in the marina as well as at the resort.  Loved the two weeks we spent here.  We plan on returning here for another week as we move our boat north.

350688056.name: We didn\'t want to leave!
350688056.author: a TripAdvisor user
350688056.reviewBody: We took a taxi from Manzanillo to Barra Navidad to make sure we arrived in time to attend mass. The culture of this town was amazing. Everyone we encountered made us feel very at home. Store owners are not pushy as happens in other areas of Mexico and are all willing to barter. If the market is on be sure to try the pecan \'cookies\'.....I got 1 and then went back for 2 more!\n\nWe expected to spend a few hours here and spent the entire day!  We took a bus back to Manzanillo at less than 60 pesos per person. Very easy to get around and well worth the trip!

350107702.name: A not too touristy beach town the budget minded can enjoy
350107702.author: a TripAdvisor user
350107702.reviewBody: We first visited Barra de Navidad was in 2005 while exploring the coast by sailboat.  The people and the town won us over and it became one of our favorite places to hang out.  It was an easy place to resupply the boat.  There were lots of small, cheap places to eat and shop and a variety of mid-priced shopping and dining as well.\n\nOn our more recent visit we arrived by bus.  It seemed to us the town, the people and the economy had been beaten down a little.  Granted they were hit by a major hurricane only a few months before our arrival, but many of the businesses we remembered that made the town seem special were obviously gone before that.  It\u2019s still a nice, not too touristy beach town that well appeal to the budget minded traveler not looking for anything fancy, but the variety - and a lot of the beach - is gone for now.

348634163.name: Cute little town
348634163.author: a TripAdvisor user
348634163.reviewBody: Rode a primo bus to this quaint little town.   Lovely beaches and restaurant.  Very unique.  Hopefully will stay their longer next time.   Had some damage with Hurricane Patricia, but hopefully they will regain some of the beach property.

347491980.name: Great Tour
347491980.author: a TripAdvisor user
347491980.reviewBody: We took the tour to Barra de Navidad which included a trip to Miramar (town), banana plantation, crocodile sanctuary and a  coconut  farm. At Miramar we stopped for an hour for shopping or anything else such as eating, walking, etc. At the coconut farm, the owner used his machete to splice the coconuts for us to drink the "milk" then taste the coconut meat. Off we went to Barra de Navidad where we took a ride in a small boat across the water for lunch.  We toured around the water and saw the yachts and then stopped in at the Grand Hotel. It is a very classy place!  Back in the town of Barra we had time to shop and wander around.  Our tour guide was Daniel of Danitours ~ he drove us to his hometown and we went and saw his brother\'s place and even saw and waved to Daniel\'s Dad!  During the 8 hour tour, Daniel would stop when ever we asked for us to take pictures. On the way back to Manzanillo, we stopped at Miramar Beach to the outdoor markets. Here you can buy the original "Mexican" blankets, Vanilla, clothes, etc.  We recommend the Barra de Navidad tour to anyone who wants to experience a great day!

344843315.name: Nice town and beaches
344843315.author: a TripAdvisor user
344843315.reviewBody: I loved the town. Very relax, nice and long beaches, high waves and cheap food. This is an option to rest for a weekend....

341088871.name: Always a pleasure!
341088871.author: a TripAdvisor user
341088871.reviewBody: A nice stroll down the breakwater then catch a free water taxi from the Mary\'s Restaurant pier across to a laid back eat and relax xperience. Shop your way up and down the streets or stop at the weekly Thursday mercado. Take the day, take the family, take your time. Have fun, smile and slow down.

338785188.name: Great little beach resort town
338785188.author: a TripAdvisor user
338785188.reviewBody: Just love Barra, its a great town with amazing restaurants and bars.  The town centre just hums in the evening...its great just walking around and having an ice cream

337639174.name: Awesome town for a visit or extended stay
337639174.author: a TripAdvisor user
337639174.reviewBody: Barra has the ocean on one side, and a lagoon on the other so the best of all worlds.  There is always so much to do - visit the Grand Bay for a delicious lunch or cocktails, hit the internet caf\u00e9 for breakfast, shop the craft shops for all kinds of beautiful items, literally dozens of water front restaurants (I like Ysadoras & SeaMaster, Bananas for breakfast), swim, surf, fish, bike, day trips to the neighboring villages.  Worth a visit!

337411083.name: Sunday Lunch at Pancho\'s
337411083.author: a TripAdvisor user
337411083.reviewBody: We love this place.....the BEST Shrimp Diablo in Jalisco.  Cerviche was better than usual.  Attentive service &terrific prices.  Guacamole was excellent too.

333739815.name: Good place to watch sunset with a beer.
333739815.author: a TripAdvisor user
333739815.reviewBody: Restaurants were all full at that time. San Patricio is nicer in my opinion for beach cafes as there is only a thin beach in Barra.\nThe town is nice, calm and quiet, between lagoon, channel and sea so water on three sides.

333602204.name: Beautiful beachside town
333602204.author: a TripAdvisor user
333602204.reviewBody: Barbra de Navidad is a picturesque town on the Pacific.  There are many great restaurants and shopping.  This is a great hop off spot for someone to visit by boat the village of Colimilla.

332098016.name: Laid back Mexican beach town
332098016.author: a TripAdvisor user
332098016.reviewBody: I have visited Barra de Navidad since the early 1980s and have a great fondness for the place.  There is still some charm to be found but it seemed deserted when I visited in November/December 2015.  Numerous hurricanes have taken away the beach and some development has impacted its quaint atmosphere.  Some restaurants and bars have moved to Melaque which seems to be a more vibrant scene.

331330281.name: Extraordinary
331330281.author: a TripAdvisor user
331330281.reviewBody: This is a real paradise, the beauty of this place is amazing, together with the friendly local people makes a perfect place to stay. Local food its great almost everywhere. Mainly very fresh sea food. Perfect place to relax and enjoy the environment.

327050497.name: AWESOME
327050497.author: a TripAdvisor user
327050497.reviewBody: Great town to lay back eat great food and DRINK, everyone speaks perfect English and go out of there way to make you happy

326005729.name: Terrible tourist town
326005729.author: a TripAdvisor user
326005729.reviewBody: Most restaurants were closed.  Pretty much waste of our time.  Took water taxi to tour nearby waters and had lunch at Mary\'s and to view Grand Isla Navidad Resort.  Low costs water taxi.  Water was very murky due to Hurricane Patricia.

314463601.name: part of a plantation tour
314463601.author: a TripAdvisor user
314463601.reviewBody: the town has a great outdoor market with reasonable prices (If you bargain) also took a boat trip for an Island lunch

308590887.name: I would move here eventually
308590887.author: a TripAdvisor user
308590887.reviewBody: What can I say, I have been visiting Barra for the last 10 years and it still keeps it\'s small town charm. If I did not already live in paradise, then i would move here, well maybe in time I will.

308356221.name: Rest. Freedom is the best in town\u00a1\u00a1
308356221.author: a TripAdvisor user
308356221.reviewBody: just an amaizing and quiet town, but the restaurant named Freedom is the best around the area, with pedro and nena the hoste, food delicious and the azteca soup the best ever

296678428.name: Visited when in Manzanillo
296678428.author: a TripAdvisor user
296678428.reviewBody: Excellent place, beach, pool, people, restaurants, etc will go there next time!! \nnice bathroom next to pool, very clean, good quality, a m must go.....

290179493.name: A fun place to Jet ski
290179493.author: a TripAdvisor user
290179493.reviewBody: This is a quiet laid back town where you can find shops good food,  Keep in mind the roads are narrow here  if you have a large car or truck I would recommend parking it outside the city center.  The water Taxi  is one of the best ways to see and get to everything.  I like to Jet ski here because I feel very safe hardly any traffic and you can easily see all the way across the bay (7 miles )  The water is warm and not too choppy if you go in the morning.   If you like the surf like I do . Do take caution  close to the sea wall  the waves are great to watch but break very shallow.

286739944.name: Charming Village
286739944.author: a TripAdvisor user
286739944.reviewBody: We went to Barra Navidad for a day visit from Manzanillo and loved it!  Friendly shopkeepers, beautiful beach....an easy, fun day.

286458778.name: Lovely location for a winter vacation.
286458778.author: a TripAdvisor user
286458778.reviewBody: Lovely place for a winter getaway. Local charm and friendly villagers. Great shopping opportunity too!

283729354.name: Have visited twice from Manzanillo.  Would like to stay for an extended time in Barra.
283729354.author: a TripAdvisor user
283729354.reviewBody: Go back to the 60\'s & 70\'s - they are here.  Great off-the-beaten-path location.  Neat boutiques & great seafood.  There is a craft market with super buys.  Ocean front or inlet views, inexpensive accommodation.  Don\'t spread the word!

283161386.name: history
283161386.author: a TripAdvisor user
283161386.reviewBody: Knowing that the Spanish, conquistadors, built their first ships to sail to Philippines from there. Also the beautiful coast and relaxing atmosphere.

275148805.name: Good surfing and great Marina
275148805.author: a TripAdvisor user
275148805.reviewBody: love the marina, little french guys comes and sells you fresh bread every morning! how hard is this? love the town very quaint, fishermans delight, open water 10 minutes away and top rate hotels, gold course is top notch!

274016529.name: Love this quaint Fishing Village!
274016529.author: a TripAdvisor user
274016529.reviewBody: We live the friendly little place,set on a gorgeous Bay,just North of Manzanillo,about a hour. There are many bars and eateries,a Surfing School,a Beautiful Marina,a variety of places to stay too! Lots of Canadian and Americans Winter here,so English is widely spoken.

268753245.name: Fantastic Town
268753245.author: a TripAdvisor user
268753245.reviewBody: Very walk-able and friendly. Small streets and super hospitable people. We ordered a beer at a small street side restaurant and they said, yes, okay, no problem and then they promptly walked down the street to a small store and bought us cold beer and brought it back to us. Wonderful people in Barra.

267407123.name: Visit this little town for sure!
267407123.author: a TripAdvisor user
267407123.reviewBody: It was a great day trip and we loved the shopping, the bay, the beach and the food. I recommend it if you need a break from your hotel resort days. Not too far 1 hour or so. Worth it!

266460147.name: Charming town
266460147.author: a TripAdvisor user
266460147.reviewBody: Quaint little town with a market on Thursday. Lots of little shops and bars. We took a free water taxi to Mary\'s Restaurant. |It\'s a great seafood restaurant on an island. Well worth the trip.  Our excursion with Sunwing to Barre Navidad also included a plantation tour, which was very interesting with stops at a banana plantation growing not only bananas, but also papayas, mangoes and coconuts.

265835235.name: Only a short boat ride away
265835235.author: a TripAdvisor user
265835235.reviewBody: We love going to this quaint village to shop and have lunch. A must if you are in Manzanillo. It is a short distance from our Villa Parasio in Manzanillo.

265591930.name: Very picturesque village with lots of restaurants and boutiques
265591930.author: a TripAdvisor user
265591930.reviewBody: One of my favourites places to take my guests for a leisurely walking tour and good food at Restaurant Veleros by the water. Melaque is 10 away and also worth visiting. You can take a boat/taxi ride to the Grand Bay Hotel across the inlet/lagune but as we were a large group of 8, it was cheaper to drive around although it is a long ride to get to this hotel by car.\nBarra de Navidad is a good place to visit if you are an avid photographer.

264540154.name: Quiet little town
264540154.author: a TripAdvisor user
264540154.reviewBody: We spent a week in Barra arriving home last Saturday. It was our first visit there, and we\'ll be going back. Clean beach, friendly people and reasonable costs are all factors. If you\'re looking for an all inclusive resort, this isn\'t your place. If you want a unique Mexican experience, check it our. The town is clean compared to many, and everything is within walking distance. A short cab ride to Melaque will take you to more bars and restaurants, if that\'s what you\'re looking for.

264287103.name: Not what it used to be
264287103.author: a TripAdvisor user
264287103.reviewBody: The beach which used to be so beautiful is almost gone due to big storms and perhaps sea level rise. They are dredging and trying to fix this without apparent success. The town has no other major industry except tourism which means it\'s getting shoddy.I miss the old Barra which was a little piece of paradise.

260230650.name: Nice side trip
260230650.author: a TripAdvisor user
260230650.reviewBody: Hopped the bus to Barra Navidad - easy ride, neat scenery. Sleepy area, beach undergoing rehab - not great right now, but holds promise.

259679869.name: peace and locals
259679869.author: a TripAdvisor user
259679869.reviewBody: liked just about all, local restaurant, Maria\'s and Mary\'s but you need the Aquatico Taxi to take you there!

259611041.name: Funky little beach town with good shopping and seafood
259611041.author: a TripAdvisor user
259611041.reviewBody: This lively little town full of norteamericano sunbirds has plenty of oceanfront restaurants, souvenir stores and boats for rent. Unfortunately a lot of tacky concrete hotels are replacing the older two story buildings and rather changing the feel of the narrow streets.  Also the beach was sloping very steeply when we were there with giant pipes pumping sand from the inner bay into the ocean which made it difficult to enjoy the water. But excellent shopping for cheap clothes, linens, sombreros etc.

257564442.name: Manzanillo
257564442.author: a TripAdvisor user
257564442.reviewBody: cool little "Old Mexican Town" lots of great restaurants.\nTook a water taxi to Mary\'s. FGood was good and I learned what "Enchalaro" means

256998415.name: A new destination!
256998415.author: a TripAdvisor user
256998415.reviewBody: This was our first trip to Barra.  The feel was inviting.  There is a large Canadian population with so many musicians and artists.  The food was inexpensive and very good.  Streets are clean and safe.  We have planned a trip for next year.

256752265.name: Restaurant Mary\'s by water taxi is a must!
256752265.author: a TripAdvisor user
256752265.reviewBody: Barra Navidad is on a beautiful Bay near Manzanillo. Our group rented a van and travelled from Manzanillo Bay to take in the Thursday Market in this little surf town. There are lots of cool little shops and restaurants that feel like old Mexico, but the highlight for us was catching a water taxi to Restaurant Mary\'s for supper. It is a short, calm boat ride that takes you past the Marina to Mary\'s that is set over the water with gorgeous scenery all around. Our group ordered drinks and several different seafood dishes, that were very good, and reasonably priced. Shrimp empanadas , stuffed shrimp, shrimp Rockefeller, fish fajitas, were all fantastic, but the oysters with onions should really be removed from the menu. Overall, I would highly recommend this visit if you are anywhere near the Manzanillo area !

256445939.name: Cute nice town!
256445939.author: a TripAdvisor user
256445939.reviewBody: Nice little town to walk and shop in!! Cute shops!!! Take the free boat ride to Restaurant Marys and have a margarita!!

255072106.name: Charming vacation spot with 2 miles of beach
255072106.author: a TripAdvisor user
255072106.reviewBody:
We sailed into the Barra Lagoon. The town is two streets wide, with small hotels and condos lining the beach. It has a quiet pace.  While there is no ATM In town Melaque at the other end of the beach/bay has a bank plus medical clinic.  The tiendas have quality vegetables and there is a good carniceria. 

Barra is closer to the airport than Manzanillo.  

For a treat stay at the Grand Hotel.

254988816.name: Nice little town
254988816.author: a TripAdvisor user
254988816.reviewBody: Stopped by this town for lunch and shopping , was nice , shops all had the same stuff you go d everywhere else,  took a boat ride to Mary\'s ( I think ) for lunch , , was ok , I found some meals were great while others looked pathetic, would go v\nBack to try someplac ele.

254929305.name: beautiful town
254929305.author: a TripAdvisor user
254929305.reviewBody: Friendly and beautiful town and beach.  Shopping is great or just to sit and have a ice cream  wonderful people as well

253950788.name: Artesian Puebla
253950788.author: a TripAdvisor user
253950788.reviewBody: If in the area, it\'s a must to visit this charming old village, many shops and restaurants, a surfing beach, always a fun day.

252331669.name: Barbra de Navidad is fun
252331669.author: a TripAdvisor user
252331669.reviewBody: Sorry but Barra is a town in Jalisco and not a hotel or restaurant. Some of your criteria does not apply. Come for the day, you won\'t be sorry you did. Good smaller restaurants serving authentic Mexican cuisine. Lots of shopping, no big stores, just little "hole in the wall" places. They will bargain, mor so on slow days. We go often, nice outing for us. There is a small "French style " Cafe in town, you can\'t miss it since it is the only one serving French baking. We love the atmosphere, people are friendly and not pushy. English is understood and some can speak a little. But even a little Spanish on your part will get you better deals.

249780574.name: lovely town and beautiful vistas
249780574.author: a TripAdvisor user
249780574.reviewBody: We took and walking tour of this Mexican seaside town and got a full tour because we met up with a personal friend who winters there. We traveled cheaply on a very comfortable bus.  The terminal was a short cab ride from our hotel.

245833850.name: Charming
245833850.author: a TripAdvisor user
245833850.reviewBody: Ever heard of a clean Mexican town? This is one of those rare places (hey I love most Mexican towns) and we enjoyed strolling through the streets. Lots of decent art to buy and many restaurants to choose from. Warning - don\'t go for lunch as most open later. \nWe did have a great mini lunch at  Bar Caffetteria. They are Italian and make a excellent cappuccino, bagels, cold beer plus very fresh ice cream. Try them out!

242732276.name: Barra is, well, Barra
242732276.author: a TripAdvisor user
242732276.reviewBody: Barra de Navidad has some excellent resturants, a lot of junky shops selling Chinese knock-offs, and a few good clothing stores. It also has a drop-dead beautiful beach stretching all the way to Malaque, and surfing. It is also one of the fastest growing beach communities, despite the fact that most housing is off the inner bay, not the beach. It is unique, and has recovered nicely from the recent hurricane. The new breakwater at the beach shows the intent to not be caught again by summer storms. Definately worth a visit, and the bar scene is available.

242587016.name: Lots of little shops
242587016.author: a TripAdvisor user
242587016.reviewBody: Great shopping in lots of little shops.  Some have large quantities of Mexican hand crafts and art work.  We usually take the free boat out to Restaurant Mary\'s near the Grand Bay Marina on the inner bay/harbor area.  Food is great and very reasonable.  We manage to get up there from Manzanillo every couple of years.

238628092.name: Love Barra!!  So beautiful!!
238628092.author: a TripAdvisor user
238628092.reviewBody: Barra is amazing.  Especially the Island.  It has such a beautiful contrast of Pacific Ocean and Laguna.  Highly recommend taking the water taxi out to Marys for lunch.  Wonderful seafood right on the water.  If you are staying over night, there is nothing like Grand Bay.  DO NOT do the all inclusive package.  The food is disgusting!  instead, book online just the room.  Then take the water taxi to Barra and Colimilla.  The restaurants are very inexpensive and the food is really amazing.  Perfect long weekend for couples.  Breathtaking views.  This place is just lovely to lounge or take long walks around the island.  Enjoy!

237976505.name: If you come to Manzanillo you should go to Barra
237976505.author: a TripAdvisor user
237976505.reviewBody: After living in Manzanillo for many years and having many guests stay with me, I know they all enjoy a trip to Barra.  It is not so much a place to go for the beach.  Other than the lagoon, the surf is large.  Good for surfers!  It is more a place to poke around and but local handicrafts.  Little gifts to take home.  Although it feels, at first, to be a bit of a tourist trap, if you dig a little deeper it is a funky little community.  Quite a big expat population, so the finery that comes with expats, like great croissants can be found if you look.  Our guest usually enjoy taking the pongas, small boats, to either the Grand Bay or one of the many seafood places on isla de navidad.  Food is reasonable.  If you do your homework and are interested in nature, there are boats that take you deep into the lagoon where you can see lots of birds and even scary wildlife.  Bring your binoculars.  With lunch allow 3-4 hours.

235083314.name: Little Mexican beach town
235083314.author: a TripAdvisor user
235083314.reviewBody: Barra is charming.  It\'s filled with little hotels, laidback cantinas, and excellent seafood restaurants.  Most restaurants are on the water.  It\'s also a shoppers delight with everything from tacky souvenirs, swimwear, fishing gear, bottle shops, ice

234733162.name: THERE ARE BETTER PLACES IN ME\'XICO
234733162.author: a TripAdvisor user
234733162.reviewBody: Over the years, I have spent about 3 years, in total in Barra De Navidad. Been there every month of the year. It was fun at first; But I got too close to a lot of the more "un savory" characters in town. The men; all theives, and rampant Homosexual activity everywhere. They will rip you off every chance they get. I wull never go there again!  Too many bad memories. It\'s sad....for the town, it IS NICE, but the people...wicked! kinda iodd for a country that touts itself in being  "christian"  Very two-faced!\nMy advice: Go elsewhere, double check facts, never trust a mexican man\nand they DOUBLE chararge if you are "white" Beware! They are very ":racist"

226132536.name: city tour
226132536.author: a TripAdvisor user
226132536.reviewBody: Very small fishing and poor town. I wouldn\'t eat in any restaurants over there. The whole town is few streets and couple of minutes in the car.

226015981.name: SMALL QUAINT TOURIST TOWN
226015981.author: a TripAdvisor user
226015981.reviewBody: About 40 minutes from Manzanillo, its great for a day trip with lost of small shops with varies products for souvenirs for gifts. Quite a few restaurants! My favorite is Pepes where the seats and table are in the sand. Could be a bit primitive at first glance, but take a look at the immaculate kitchen and you\'ll see why the ceviche and the shrimp with diablo (devil)sauce has always been my favorite. During oyster season they are fresh and opened right in front of you. Enjoy!!

209012974.name: Awesome, quiet little town
209012974.author: a TripAdvisor user
209012974.reviewBody: Stay in Barra, you can walk to everything. Food was good, especially if you stick to the local places and local cuisine. Not a night life place, but very nice to relax, drink a beer by the beach, and chill.

208226593.name: Crazy Cactus Car Rental Barra de Navidad
208226593.author: a TripAdvisor user
208226593.reviewBody: We arrived in Melaque a town  3  miles from Barra de Navidad. We decided that it would be fun to rent a car and drive to Colima City , maybe do some shopping in Manzanillo . We have rented previously at Crazy Cactus ( in Summer) and although we did email ( no reply) we decided to take the collectivo bus and drop in to organize our rental.  We get there and we were told they DONT rent cars in the summer. Now it would have been nice if they had responded to the email in the first place but better yet it would make total sense that they POST that on their web page or make it known on any of the multiple road signs they advertise on in the area.They are not new at this business since they have been doing it at least 15 yrs that I know of. Its the first time I ever ran into a car rental place that doesnt rent cars , even if it is off season. ridiculous! Lets say that we wont be counting on them for any rentals in the future!

201286468.name: Barra de Navidad a great place for a day out
201286468.author: a TripAdvisor user
201286468.reviewBody: Barra de Navidad lays as the end of the Bay from the town of Melaque. Although it is sandy, it is very difficult to walk because of often high surf. The best way is via road. Parking is almost always difficult especially in the center of the shopping district.. Excellent place to buy souvenirs and special gifts. The Oaxaca stores offer good value for Talavera china and embroidered clothing. Nice honest people. The trip across the lagoon  to the  Colimilla restaurants is worth while. Fare by water taxi is about 50 pesos per person.\nGood sun bathing and surfing but do beware of the waves on the ocean sid of the beach. It is not safe for children but the lagoon side is calm and preferable to families.\nGreat cafes abound in Barra de Navidad with good prices. Great beer and people watching.

199335828.name: Quaint little fishing village!
199335828.author: a TripAdvisor user
199335828.reviewBody: Barra is a small town with basically one main street which has restaurants and tourist shops.  It\'s fun for a day.  There are a few nice, little hotels right on the ocean.

198172797.name: Great shopping and food
198172797.author: a TripAdvisor user
198172797.reviewBody: Easy to walk and enjoy, wonderful food choices \nlook for the big tree!! Try the resort across the bay on Sunday, great place to visit for lunch.

194749491.name: Great town to discover. Sea Master is a must for lunch or dinner
194749491.author: a TripAdvisor user
194749491.reviewBody: Enjoyed the ease of walking the town.  Lots of shops and restaurants.  Boat tours from the Marina. My favorite restaurant here called Sea Master. Take the table over the water. Delightful.

193121862.name: Excellent Sample of Little Mexican Town
193121862.author: a TripAdvisor user
193121862.reviewBody: everyone loves Barra because of its little town feel and atmosphere.\nI highly recommend it to then go to the Isla Navidad and eat, then come back to Barra to the Malecon to watch the sunset.

192410283.name: Barra
192410283.author: a TripAdvisor user
192410283.reviewBody: Barra is a beautiful little town, this would be a location where ones would spend a few month through winter.

191754945.name: Funky, hippie, fishing, hanging out
191754945.author: a TripAdvisor user
191754945.reviewBody: This small village brings surfers, old hippies and tourists with lots of character.  Fun for easy going travelers who like the sun, as it is always warm/hot.

191451037.name: Golf trip
191451037.author: a TripAdvisor user
191451037.reviewBody: My husband and I have just returned from the Wyndham at Isla Navidad. The hotel was wonderful and we were treated well by all the staff. We had the all inclusive golf package which was wonderful, there is a mandatory cart and caddie rule, and unknown to us we had to pay the caddies directly ($40). Having never had a caddie before (apart from my husband) I was very impressed, within a day or two he knew which club I required and was very accurate in yardage (within one or two yards of my GPS!). Be prepared to lose a few balls on the Lagoon course, many lagoons with resident alligators.

190158600.name: Beautiful little village
190158600.author: a TripAdvisor user
190158600.reviewBody: We were only able to spend a couple of hours here but fell in love with the quaint village and friendly people.  We had hoped to return and spend more time there but it didn\'t work out but we would definitely stay here in future. We met some other Canadians who stayed there for a month and really liked it and said that the restaurants were really good and it was worth the stay!

188508856.name: Nice little town
188508856.author: a TripAdvisor user
188508856.reviewBody: Take the bus for 38 pesos each way and give yourself a few hours. Stopped at a few bars on the ocean and view was great.

187841520.name: Barra Rocks
187841520.author: a TripAdvisor user
187841520.reviewBody: Food is fabulous, views are stunning, People are friendly, town is easy to walk, Swimming is exciting and lovely.

179598588.name: Barra Navidad
179598588.author: a TripAdvisor user
179598588.reviewBody: Beautiful little town, excellent place to learn to surf. Enjoyed shopping in all the stores and sampling the local food. Very visitor friendly, you feel safe walking the streets. We took a boat ride through the area and saw huge boats and hotels; as well as, wildlife and ship wrecks

179211478.name: barra de bavidad
179211478.author: a TripAdvisor user
179211478.reviewBody: great little town  with gorgeous scenery \nmust visit hotel sands  pirates cove bar and pool.\n  great fun and volleyball in  pool and   excellent staff.

175770854.name: Great place to shop!
175770854.author: a TripAdvisor user
175770854.reviewBody: We did most of our "tourist" shopping here.  It was perfect and a nice variety of shops and restaurants. Taking the water taxi to and from the nearby Wyndham was a wonderful experience.

168912294.name: We\'ll Be Back For Winter 2014
168912294.author: a TripAdvisor user
168912294.reviewBody: Barra has become our winter go to place. A almost perfect combination of small Mexican resort town, charming cobbled streets, some quality restaurants, reasonably priced accommodations and relative safety. It also the unique charm of the French Baker delivering fresh croissants by by boat our dock in the morning, romantic candle lit dinners with a view of the beautiful Grand Bay Complex and the Lagoon, boat taxi rides to Mary\'s  Seafood, and much more. Barra is a $5 cab ride from her bigger brother Melaque that also offers many attractions. We spent the month of Feb there in 2012. The months of Feb and March there in 2013. We will be there again this Jan 3 through April 4...as you can see...a growing attraction. I love this place. Cheers

159379406.name: Beautiful Rustic Mexico
159379406.author: a TripAdvisor user
159379406.reviewBody: Much less traveled than Manzanillo, therefore, more rustic... Plenty of great food right on the beach...\nLots of Erosion has destroyed some buildings, and the look of the town... Still some wonderful local artisans that have beautiful wares to be shared... The locals have crafted beautiful seed work...work much more than the price!!! Loved renting bikes and touring all around the town and back into the barrio...

156684501.name: Barra De Navidad
156684501.author: a TripAdvisor user
156684501.reviewBody: Wonderful little town with lots of different attractions and local Mexican history. The people are friendly, the restaurants are good, the shopping is great and the bars are awesome. I have added some pics.\n\nIf you go to Manzanillo area be sure to visit this wonderful little town to experience Mexican culture at its finest.

156683343.name: A 5 star resort and a surfer hangout all in one
156683343.author: a TripAdvisor user
156683343.reviewBody: The town of Barra de Navidad is located on a long barrier bar separating a large lagoon from the Pacific Ocean.   Surfers and travelers seeking economical lodging frequent Barra while those with deeper pockets stay at the luxurious Grand Bay Hotel across the channel.   The two are connected by water taxis.  We always visit on our sailboat, staying in the marina or the lagoon...

156198934.name: We live here
156198934.author: a TripAdvisor user
156198934.reviewBody: We are so GLAD that those who wrote poor reviews will not be back to Barra de Navidad. None of what they seemed to observe is true. This is a quiet little fishing village with wonderful people, good restaurants, great services and a laid back attitude. It is not a Poor village in any way. Many people don\'t have a lot, but they do have family and happiness and love. We have fish fresh from the bay, vegetables full of flavor and not hot house kept, eggs that still smell of the nest. We have it all and then some. It is not a dirty town at all. People sweep their sidewalks and the street in front of their house every day. Hippies, drunks, druggies? Sorry, not here, no matter your judgement. Please stay in your uppity hotels with your better-than-you opinions. We\'ll still be here enjoying this beautiful bay and its awesome sunsets.

155761318.name: My new favorite west coast Mexican town
155761318.author: a TripAdvisor user
155761318.reviewBody: Barra is a small coastal Mexican town with lots of retired Canadian/Americans and lots of services for them - excellent shopping and restaurants in a village like atmosphere.  Very laid back.  Unfortunately, a hurricane wiped out most of the beach a year or so ago, but there\'s lots of beach close by in Melaque.

155428476.name: Lucy\'s Paradise Bar
155428476.author: a TripAdvisor user
155428476.reviewBody: While roaming the streets of Barra Navidad we heard some great music coming from one of the bars and decided to stop in. There weren\'t many in the place when we first went in but by the end of the night it was packed. I am sure that they all came to listen to the live band and not to watch the crazy Canadians dancing up a storm under the prominently displayed Maple Leaf! Great time at Lucy\'s Paradise in Barra Navidad!

154974043.name: Still recovering
154974043.author: a TripAdvisor user
154974043.reviewBody: We have been to Barra several times, but this was the first time since the devasting storm of a couple years ago. The beach side hotels and restaurants have not fully recovered. The general activity level has not yet returned. You should feel completely safe in traveling through the town and do not worry about any food establishments. If you want the best chicken mole, go to Los Arcos.

154537679.name: Cute town, good shopping
154537679.author: a TripAdvisor user
