154537679.reviewBody: lots of little shops and retaurants, great place to go to mix it up for the day to day resort life.  You can even take a bost to a restautant across the bay that serves great seafood.

154463587.name: Must see
154463587.author: a TripAdvisor user
154463587.reviewBody: Less than one hour from Manzanillo.  Barra de Navidad and Melaque are great to see.  It has a little something to describe - very quaint and pleasant.  Something more inspiring than Manzanillo. You can shop there, sightseeing, relax, contemplate the site, swim, take a beer,  and certainly wish to return.

152975005.name: Visit and brunch to the Hotel on Isla Barra de Navidad
152975005.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975005.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit, go around all commercial streets. very good camarones..crevettes-shrimps...  Beautiful Hotel as a castle... with very good Sunday brunch (maybe other days too...?)

152374303.name: Hop a bus and go to Barra!
152374303.author: a TripAdvisor user
152374303.reviewBody: Only a 45 minute ride and there you are looking at the peninsula, the ocean and a quaint little town and of course the famous hotel The Grand Bay

151979693.name: Great shopping, eating and sightseeing
151979693.author: a TripAdvisor user
151979693.reviewBody: There are lovely stores with good quality items.  Very pretty place!  Lots of nice restaurants including a few Canadian owned.  Make sure you take a boat trip around their inner harbour.

151611442.name: A Hidden Gem
151611442.author: a TripAdvisor user
151611442.reviewBody: We have been coming to Barra de Navidad for several years for up to a month and a half. As a well-travelled couple, we have visited a great many beach towns and quaint villages all over the world. This is one of the most delightful ones. The main reason for us is that the setting is beautiful and the value for money in terms of accommodation and food cannot be beaten. When one compares it to say Hawaii or Palm Springs it is by far the best value. Yes, there are your typical Mexican problems - not the best infrastructure, some noise, lack of some services - but the advantages far outweigh the disadvantages. The people are friendly and the beach is wonderful. The sand will undoubtedly return as it has after two previous hurricanes, and even now the beach is still wide enough to enjoy. \n\nAs for the old hippies, well take a look at Florida or Hawaii or Palm Springs, basically anywhere that is warm and sunny in the northern hemisphere winter.

151191473.name: Cool little Hippie town.
151191473.author: a TripAdvisor user
151191473.reviewBody: Great shops, great food. cheap beer. what more could you want. Lots of interesting people to talk to.\n

150454943.name: nice place
150454943.author: a TripAdvisor user
150454943.reviewBody: Way too many gringos.. way too many people hawking wares.. no biggie; but many were too pushy.. more like a tourist trap than a vacation or a quaint Mexican town

150137144.name: day trip away from Manzanilla
150137144.author: a TripAdvisor user
150137144.reviewBody: beautiful little fishing village, not many tourists, hot and the beer is cold.  Great place for retirement as you will notice many retirees live there.

150069140.name: Great place to visit!
150069140.author: a TripAdvisor user
150069140.reviewBody: Barra is delightful!  If you\'re going on a sunny day you\'ll need a hat!   I have visited Barra many times, the first time I didn\'t have a hat and could hardly open my eyes to see.  This place is sun and sea personified! Take a boat out to Mary\'s, a restaurant unreachable without the boat.  It\'s great fun.  Shop til you drop in Barra,they have everything you could ever want for Mexican souvenirs.\nIt\'s a bit touristy but its great fun.  Close your eyes and imagine what it was like when the Spanish sailed here (I think) on Christmas Day in 1546 or so.  It must have been incredible.  There are signs around town to help you realize the history here.  When I\'m in Barra I often think what it must have been like for the indigenous people to see those Spanish ships and those conquistadores come ashore.  Yikes!  Enjoy the place, it\'s great!

149470461.name: Very interesting town
149470461.author: a TripAdvisor user
149470461.reviewBody: We visited as part of a tour, and had a great time. There was some good shopping, much cheaper than in Manzanillo, but at least some Spanish-speaking ability is very helpful here. We were only able to find one bank machine which had a line-up that we didn\'t have time to wait in, so be sure to bring some cash if you want to shop. We took a very scenic boat ride to Mary\'s Restaurant, ate right beside the water and had a very attentive waiter who got my wife some very good (and freshly made) guacamole. I\'d be happy to visit here again.

149214419.name: Dirty, Not Nice.
149214419.author: a TripAdvisor user
149214419.reviewBody: This place is dingy, dirty, and full of dope heads.\nIf this is your sort of place get on there now.\nThere are many aging hippys who should be in rest homes, but the place seems to attract them. I am sure it has some appeal, but not to me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

147965499.name: Good fishing
147965499.author: a TripAdvisor user
147965499.reviewBody: My husband cought 5 fish in 4.5 hours. He had 3 tuna\'s on at once and a needle fish.  We managed to barter a good price and enjoyed the trip alot.

146966938.name: Must visit!
146966938.author: a TripAdvisor user
146966938.reviewBody: great place, great people, amazing fun!\nIf you happen to be in the area, it\'s a must!! even better if you stay there and have the time to soak in this wonderful place.

143938637.name: Excellent as it is
143938637.author: a TripAdvisor user
143938637.reviewBody:
U won't regret it for sure
I recommend you for that place
I went there with my wife
She loved that place too

143913492.name: It\'s a drinking town with a fishing problem
143913492.author: a TripAdvisor user
143913492.reviewBody: The beach has had many times of disapearing during storms although it will return but when. Careful about planing your vacation time without checking out the beach condition. Crocadilles seen in the bay on ocation, the beach waves crash on the beach so being a good swimmer is a good idea.\nI have been to Barra many times for a month plus over the years but I am looking for other places to spend my time.

143743264.name: A tourist trap
143743264.author: a TripAdvisor user
143743264.reviewBody: Endless hawkers, tacky. Such a shame, we hid in a lttle restaurant and they followed us in. The town has so much history and a stunning area, just obviously very poor.

141147495.name: Charming and worth the drive
141147495.author: a TripAdvisor user
141147495.reviewBody: The drive from Manzanilla to Barra Navidad took us past many banana and coconut plantations.  The village is quaint and charming and from the malecon we watched fishermen standing in hip-deep water tossing their butterfly nets to catch fish.  Across the bay we saw multimillion dollar mansions, but we couldn\'t get closer.  We sipped pina coladas at a restaurant on the beach and watched the natives enjoying their Saturday excursion.  Then our reward was the restaurant Tinto del Mar on the highway just as you pass the turn-off for Barra Navidad. The tables are linen covered and they have enough fans to keep everyone cooled.  The food is absolutely fantasic and the prices are quite reasonable.  Try the red snapper.  Delicious!

140370251.name: a place to visit
140370251.author: a TripAdvisor user
140370251.reviewBody: a very natural place with two side sea areas and lots of typical seafood restaurants mexican style very family oriented

138134361.name: Had to go back
138134361.author: a TripAdvisor user
138134361.reviewBody: my boyfriend and I took the bus to this destination one day, I couldn\'t get all the amazing figurines out of my head! there were no arguments from him! I had to go back and buy some. Loved this spot.

136867566.name: Worth the trip
136867566.author: a TripAdvisor user
136867566.reviewBody: Its just cool. Go there. You take a boat taxi to a restaurant to enjoy the day as days were meant to be enjoyed> Goof food, good people, good times. Trust me, take this trip, it is so worth it.

134457740.name: A quaint tourist town
134457740.author: a TripAdvisor user
134457740.reviewBody: Barra is a nice place to shop and hang on the beach.  Its not an upscale place like Playa Del Carmen, Mexico but it was still fun.  I was there during off season and all the shops were not open so it is possible there might have been more going on during high season.  The cobble stone street that runs along the beach has your typical shops and places to eat.  It was a relaxing day trip with a friend.

133529578.name: AUTHENTIC MEXICO
133529578.author: a TripAdvisor user
133529578.reviewBody: A tiny pueblo with only "really" two main streets. The PEOPLE are wonderful and friendly, The shops are quaint, the restaurants GREAT.  AND JARRO BEACH DISCO AND SPORTS BAR, ther best in the world. Great owner and staff, great music, its A GREAT place to let loose and send your inhibitions out to sea. 2 levels right on the beach, open till 4am SAT night is the \'big night"  But EVERY night is big at Jarro Beach Disco!.  The beach is awsome, water like a bathtub. I\'ve been going there for 12 years, now I live there. over by the canals. SO QUIET AT NIGHT. safe too. Everyone is so nice and warm. It doesn\'t get any more "mexico" than this. Beware English is scarce. 97% do not speak english. So some spanish is almost necessary. But it IS THE BEST PLACE in ALL of mexico. NOT A TOURIST TRAP!

129004568.name: Delightful destination
129004568.author: a TripAdvisor user
129004568.reviewBody: We took a spontaneous side trip to Barra after starting out in Manzanillo. The people were friendly, the town was clean, and a good time was had by all. Be sure to fish with Reel1In SportFishing and eat in Colamilla.

127796128.name: Sunsets rival Maui!,
127796128.author: a TripAdvisor user
127796128.reviewBody: We have been going th Barra for 30 years and loved it so much we built a house here. Our kids choose to come here over Hawaii for their winter holiday and now my daughter runs a restaurant in the high season. This is where we choose to winter. We have 4 kids an 2 grandkids and they all find things they love to do here. Its very affordable with great restaurants and shopping. You will not need a vehicle to get around as everything is walking distance. Lots of Doctors great swimming ( for the medium to expert level) This town is very safe. Great fishing

125702432.name: Great small little town
125702432.author: a TripAdvisor user
125702432.reviewBody: What an amazing little town. Never felt safer in all my life. Lots of great shops, bars and restaraunts. Thursday\'s are market day in the square. This is an absolute must visit town if you are in the area. We stayed at Grand Bay and it was only $20 pesos to take the little water taxi across round trip

125470822.name: Interesting small town
125470822.author: a TripAdvisor user
125470822.reviewBody: It was the town we had to go too to visit Grand Bay Resort. It is on the ocean, and had a lot of restaurants, stores, small hotels and fishing boats were there in several places. A lot of the local people spoke quite a bit of english. I think it would be a nice town  to visit while staying at the resort.

124370246.name: great ppl, lots to do, great shopping
124370246.author: a TripAdvisor user
124370246.reviewBody: loved the town, the people and the shops...the culture is amazing.

123605740.name: Barra is ok but I wouldn\'t call it an out of the way place.
123605740.author: a TripAdvisor user
123605740.reviewBody: Melaque is better.  I prefer less tourists but that is just me. Lots of canadians winter at both. Take a bus over to melaque, stay at one of the small hotels along the ocean and chill.  \nStop at the top of the hill if coming from Manz and enjoy the view of the coconut plantations.

123499575.name: Great Little Town
123499575.author: a TripAdvisor user
123499575.reviewBody: It\'s nice little town to take a day trip with family, you could eat at one of the many reastaurants located on the bay or the ocean we have been lucky and liked the food at all that we have visited, it\'s also nice for the singles they have a lot of beach bars, and the little town seems safe a lot of foreigners seem to live there soem even have their own shops.

122837681.name: Great town!  Worth the visit
122837681.author: a TripAdvisor user
122837681.reviewBody: This is a quaint little tourist village located about 40km north of Manzanillo.  Worth checking out!  Lots of neat little shops and restaurants.  They are very tourist friendly.   It is situated on a peninsula, so it is very fun to rent a jet ski from the harbour & check out the sites.

122321990.name: great town to visit
122321990.author: a TripAdvisor user
122321990.reviewBody: one storm and one hurricane have ruined a lot of beach front property, but still worth visiting

121744826.name: Shrimp
121744826.author: a TripAdvisor user
121744826.reviewBody: Here is where you can get fresh seafood at a reasonable price, should be around 120-130 pesos so around $11 for a dozen shrimp. THe place is really beautiful , not great shopping it\'s all blankets and trinkets

121222629.name: Bohemian Getaway
121222629.author: a TripAdvisor user
121222629.reviewBody: Barra is a bohemian getaway. When we stay in Manzanillo, we always spend one day in Barra. The pace of life is slower...some cute little shops...not much pressure. We love to eat at Mary\'s restaurant and order the whole fish Zarandedo (sp?).

53723279.name: Beautiful Barra!
53723279.author: a TripAdvisor user
53723279.reviewBody: I have been going to Barra off and on for many years now and something draws me back all the time.  It\'s changing, more tourists, more long-term gringos making homes in upscale houses and no more cobblestone streets and knowing most everyone.  Still it\'s a good place to be.  You can walk everywhere you need to go, there is a good choice of resturants from basic to fine dining and there is some nightlife.  Piper\'s bar generally has some pretty good live music.  The beach is good with enough surf to attract surfers at one end.  The nice part is the beach has vendors but not tons of them so you can have some quiet time.  Find Freddy wherever he is bartending these days for the best mango margaritas!  He was last spotted at the Alhondra Hotel.  Many places offer wireless connection these days so you can keep in touch with your friends.  I never make a reservation, seems an abundance of good places to stay from the very affordable ($25 night) to the Grand Bay (last time I was there Dennis Washington had lent his yacht to the president of France and his wife) which is top-end.  I see lots of families with babies these days in Barra but it lacks lots of things for the younger set to do. There is no banana boating, no para-sailing, no scooter rental...its laid back.  If you want more excitement do us a favor and go somewhere else and leave Barra lazy.  If you like fishing you can find some good captains to take you out as well.  Barra isn\'t for everyone but it is for those who want to lay peacefully, enjoying a good book and having a nice meal.......it\'s for lover\'s of Barra!

665777242.name: Nicer than I expected
665777242.author: a TripAdvisor user
665777242.reviewBody: Came into the bay by sea and it was much nicer than I expected. I expected to dock closer to the industrial area but we were at a dock by the center of town......within a easy walk shops and some sights.

659556200.name: Barcelo Karmina
659556200.author: a TripAdvisor user
659556200.reviewBody: All inclusive  resort. Fantastic buffet restaurant. Agave  restaurant on scenic point overlooking bay has to die for lobster crepes. Dusk dish was fantastic as well. Kyoto Japanese restaurant had fresh  wonderful sushi, negri and sashimi.

646864661.name: The beaches are to die for!!!!!!!
646864661.author: a TripAdvisor user
646864661.reviewBody: Pictures to follow.  I love this beach   Sail boats , pelicans, shells, fishermen  etc. Etc etc.   Wowzer.  Please visit

641338504.name: Lovely Bay
641338504.author: a TripAdvisor user
641338504.reviewBody: The bay itself is lovely, with many large ships to watch.  The only down side is because the cliffs are so high right up to the edge of the ocean, you don\'t get the wonderful sunsets that PV is blessed with.

632357323.name: Options
632357323.author: a TripAdvisor user
632357323.reviewBody: We arrived by cruise ship and took a tour with Admire Mexico to Comala for most of the day and then spent the rest of the afternoon in Manzanillo.  There are many convenience ships, souvenir shops, bars to spend money.  It is very pleasant to walk around with photo opps of the large bay and white buildings.  There is a large industrial area to one side that is a bit of an eye sore and a huge smoke plume from the deisel/coal generators that supply power to the town.  Hopefully pressure to go green will take away this.

580493095.name: We loved Manzanillo! It\'s a 10!
580493095.author: a TripAdvisor user
580493095.reviewBody: We "saw" Manzanillo for the first time in 1979 in the humorous film "10," starring Bo Derek and Dudley Moore.  It looked beautiful, so we were happy our Panama Canal cruise included it for a day.  The Bay is indeed quite lovely and we enjoyed walking around the waterfront and the town.  Of course, we just had to take a taxi to the iconic Las Hadas for a drink. Fun day!

567705264.name: Pretty bay and interesting harbor with lots of activity
567705264.author: a TripAdvisor user
567705264.reviewBody: This is a very large bay that has a huge harbor and there are always cargo ships coming and going. The centro is at one side and the peninsula with Las Hadas at the other end. The only negative is the constant brown smoke coming out of the power plant smoke stacks to soil the air.

565179128.name: Beautiful overlook
565179128.author: a TripAdvisor user
565179128.reviewBody: Stayed at Las Hadas Hotel which had a great view of the bay and marina. It is very breathtaking. I also went out on s ledge outside the hotel with the help of my taxi driver Miguel and got some better pictures

561920553.name: Beautiful beach in Club Santiago area
561920553.author: a TripAdvisor user
561920553.reviewBody: The northwest bay stretch of beach in Manzanillo is the best for walking, especially as you near the most northwest end at Club Santiago.  There it is easy to enter the water which is very clear.  Lots and lots of beach club options along the the entire 5km stretch.  An especially nice one is the Oasis Ocean Club nearer the Club Santiago area.  A great way to spend your day at the beach.

558726076.name: Pretty
558726076.author: a TripAdvisor user
558726076.reviewBody: Manzanillo Bay is a very pretty place.  A lovely beach with all of the services made or stay perfect.

558684950.name: What a View!
558684950.author: a TripAdvisor user
558684950.reviewBody: I had no idea that Manzanillo had this spectacular a view, really comparable to the Bay of Banderas in PV. Our condo was very high up, near the top of a cliff and the view of the bay spread out before us all sparkly and blue. The surrounding mountains, sailboats and occasional freighter added to the thrill. You cannot miss this bay for the view but also for the gorgeous beaches below. Don\u2019t tell anyone. It\u2019s a secret as no one seems to be on the beach.

557937449.name: What\u2019s not to like
557937449.author: a TripAdvisor user
557937449.reviewBody: Absolutely fantastic views, not a crazy tourist place and very affordable. Lots of little vendors that have terrific foods and beverages. This is a must see area.

548758542.name: Beautiful beach
548758542.author: a TripAdvisor user
548758542.reviewBody: We enjoy walking this beach.  It is more peaceful, less people than the other beaches.  We will come back.

548663539.name: Cruise
548663539.author: a TripAdvisor user
548663539.reviewBody: Very nice place on the ocean. Great weather. Long walk to visit shops. Would go again. It has great restaurants and lots of boats in the harbor.

532746314.name: Really nice area with great beaches
532746314.author: a TripAdvisor user
532746314.reviewBody:
This area is rather unknown to us Europeans but a great surprise. The beaches are great, the people really friendly and lots of great restaurants and beach bars.
There is not much more to see though and very little on the culture side.
We stayed in the Santiago area which has the best beach area.

481024518.name: Beautiful bay when viewed from Las Hadas
481024518.author: a TripAdvisor user
481024518.reviewBody: Danitours took us around Manzanillo then we drove through Las Hadas - a very spiffy resort - so we could see the Eurodam and the bay itself. Nice view!

477470023.name: Beautiful
477470023.author: a TripAdvisor user
477470023.reviewBody: Beautiful bay and very nice scenery! This is a nice local spot that was very busy during the Mexican holiday! The people here seemed very nice and relaxed. Good local food and a busy bay

472765517.name: Pepe\'s Tours - Awesome !
472765517.author: a TripAdvisor user
472765517.reviewBody: We had an awesome private tour from Pepe Tour\'s in Manzanillo.  Hugo was our driver and he made it a great outting for us.  He showed us around, gave us info, went to the market.  He was a kind man with character and charm, he even helped me barter for a new bathing suit and wrap in spanish!  The little departure tour from the all inclusive hotel was a memorable experience.  He showed us the ships, the bays and had some great stories.  Wonderful trip.

469956449.name: Thumbs Up!
469956449.author: a TripAdvisor user
469956449.reviewBody:
Take a city tour and they'll take you to get a bird's eye view of both Manzanillo Bay as well as Santiago Bay. Simply beautiful.

Manzanillo Bay has some rocky sections between Las Hadas resort and Barcelo Resort. and some spots after Barcelo resort towards Manzanillo town. Las Hadas has the privilege of enjoying a little cove-like area where the water is calm and sandy...no rocks!

The bay is beautiful with great stretches of sandy beaches. It's also a port for cruise ships as they saddle right in Manzanillo town. From that observation I imagine they have a natural harbour.

Recommended!

467478121.name: 1 week vacation on the bay
467478121.author: a TripAdvisor user
467478121.reviewBody: Our hotel was on the beach. We saw the ocean each morning we opened our door and could hear the waves during the quiet times.

466606808.name: Not worth more than a few hours
466606808.author: a TripAdvisor user
466606808.reviewBody: Strong surf.  Limited beach access unless you have a hotel on the beach, but we experienced locals living in shelters on the beach.  Strong current or rip tides.  Not safe for children or adults beyond the shallows.  Red tide or algae bloom was in full display.  Red waters and then green algae in the surf.

464630134.name: Not many fish/small reef
464630134.author: a TripAdvisor user
464630134.reviewBody: Small snorkeling area not worth it, water not clear\nTry to negotiate with vendor next door to visitors center on pier.  Unbelievable prices, 12.50/person private boat, bring own drinks they provide cooler & ice.  You can also rent snorkeling gear from them.   Other companies charge $73.00

458889542.name: Great place.
458889542.author: a TripAdvisor user
458889542.reviewBody: Manzanillo Bay is a great beach and community. Warm ocean, and small surf, but watch the undertow in some places. It is a port community with little poverty as all the jobs here. Very friendly locals and sunsets, and great food.\nAlso check out Centro and Santiago...

456531689.name: A month in paradise
456531689.author: a TripAdvisor user
456531689.reviewBody: Rented a condo on the beach in Las Brisas. \nWonderful sunsets, non- stop action from the port, ocean breezes and whales. \nWhat more does one want from a tropical vacation?

456037046.name: Nice place
456037046.author: a TripAdvisor user
456037046.reviewBody: Manzanillo is a very great place. You can stay here at Manzanillo for a week. You can go to Manzanillo Bay for 2 days

454530574.name: Simply beautiful and very interesting
454530574.author: a TripAdvisor user
454530574.reviewBody: Manzanillo is very much a working port and we enjoyed watching as tugs guided massive container ships into the harbor.

451939050.name: Beautiful
451939050.author: a TripAdvisor user
451939050.reviewBody: Very beautiful area!! So worthwhile to travel to go see this amazing part of the world!  The area has snorkelling and so many other water activities available.  The best part it has the ocean and some mountains!

448286714.name: Awesome
448286714.author: a TripAdvisor user
448286714.reviewBody: Loved this place, water isn\'t as nice but the resorts and people are very nice. It is much quieter then most Mexican hotspots.

442444689.name: Great beach
442444689.author: a TripAdvisor user
442444689.reviewBody: Kids will love it.  Salt water bay on one side, fresh water bay on the other at the tip. Lots of small open air restaurants. Families having fun

440244537.name: What a view
440244537.author: a TripAdvisor user
440244537.reviewBody: Amazing to sail into this Bay. Lovely white beaches with good views around you. Mesmerizing sunsets. A must see in this town.

411017162.name: Beautiful Bay
411017162.author: a TripAdvisor user
411017162.reviewBody: We have rented a condo overlooking the bay.  It is beautiful and gorgeous sunsets.  Beautiful breeze. We will be coming back many times.

355594486.name: stunning
355594486.author: a TripAdvisor user
355594486.reviewBody: it is fabulous area of Manzanillo  , the  beach is great for walking, the views of down town, the harbor and the ships as they come and go - tranquil

351577618.name: Miles & miles of beautiful sand.
351577618.author: a TripAdvisor user
351577618.reviewBody: If you have not been to this part of the world, do yourself a favour and make the trip, this is a gem! Along this beach you can find waves big enough to play in or quiet areas for swimming. The water is clean and warm and there is even a wreck to explore by snorkel at one end of the beach. \n\nLots of great beach front restaurants to choose from and, of course, the warm and friendly Mexican hosts too!

350927859.name: great area
350927859.author: a TripAdvisor user
350927859.reviewBody: Love this part of Mexico.   Safe snd friendly people.  Plan to return next year.  Great bus service even though it is a bumpy ride.

348440595.name: DID NOT get what we paid for . NOT SENIOR FRIENDLY
348440595.author: a TripAdvisor user
348440595.reviewBody: All INCLUSIVE??? Buffet only 3 days a week and food was hard to recognize .Rest of  week you make reservations and eat late or go to Delfines with terrible service and very average food with choice of 6 entrees . Two hours one night and someone came by and ask us how we liked our meal & we said that we are STILL WAITING for it . Last time we were there two people in our party were done eating , one was about half done when I FINALLY got my meal after waiting over an hour . NEVER did get my appetizer that I ask for THREE times.   INTERNET was POOR . Only available in some areas.  Our room was spotty and was totally out twice. The desk sent some one to the room to fix the box behind dresser???  The place itself was kind a run down room was nice . new owners were coming in two weeks and there were people every were , painting ,trimming trees and shrubs , patching concrete , redoing fountain that wasn\'t working and removing old torn chairs . We were promised a ground floor room because of health reasons and unable to do steps . There are NO GROUND FLOOR ROOMS . First room they showed us (301) was 16 steps down and back up to lobby level and 34 steps to buffet , pool , and beach level . The next room (201) was 26 steps up to lobby and 14 down without handrails . They ended up putting us up on level 5 which was about as far as we could get from the friends that we met there . They promised us a golf cart within 5 min. at most 10 after we call . For the most part that was ok , only waited twice for 20 min. once for 30 min.

346523772.name: great views
346523772.author: a TripAdvisor user
346523772.reviewBody: best way to see this area is by boat.\nbook a fishing trip and go out so you can look back\nspectacular vistas of the coast line and beaches

345971331.name: Awesome
345971331.author: a TripAdvisor user
345971331.reviewBody: Really enjoyed waking up to this view every morning for two weeks.  Watching the local people fish and the kids swimming.

344841702.name: Stayed here for 8 days!
344841702.author: a TripAdvisor user
344841702.reviewBody: Stayed here for 8 days, stunning views in every direction.  Went Deep see fishing, swam and sunbathed.  Incredible place to wake up every morning!

344036531.name: Beautiful Area To See
344036531.author: a TripAdvisor user
344036531.reviewBody: All the bays and views from the shore in Manzanillo are beautiful. You can see the small boats, sail boats and the bigger ships waiting to get into port. Any trip to Manzanillo, people should take the local bus to Centro so they can see the whole area, and the port and of course the waterfront square at Centro.

343672107.name: Whales!!!
343672107.author: a TripAdvisor user
343672107.reviewBody: One afternoon we watched a pod of whales frolicking in the bay.... Blowing air and making partial breeches.....Was amazing!

341933668.name: Absolutely beautiful at any time day or night
341933668.author: a TripAdvisor user
341933668.reviewBody: Manzanillo Bay is beautiful whether you are swimming in the ocean or simply looking at the sunset from your balcony. It reminds me of Guanabara Bay in Rio without, of course, Corcovado, or Rio\'s constant traffic.

341165565.name: Something for Everyone Looking for Oceanside Tourism
341165565.author: a TripAdvisor user
341165565.reviewBody:
We have visited Manzanillo Bay several times via sailboat, and typcially anchor off the La Boquita area in the north lobe of the bay or in the basin near the Las Hadas hotel along the rocky peninsula bisecting the large bay.   We enjoy walking along the firm beach from La Boquita to Santiago, visiting the fruit and veggie markets in Santiago and in downtown Manzanillo, sampling restaurants in   
Salagua and La Boquita areas, snorkelling and kayaking where and when possible and spending time at the swimming pool at Las Hadas.   There are inexpensive buses and taxis running frequently to take one from one end of the bays to the other.   We have never experienced crime directed our way in over 10 visits to the area, although we rarely are out on our own at night.
Not your typical package resort like Nuevo Vallarta or Cancun - this is more like Real Mexico - a working port with some nice beach resorts and areas in the adjacent bays.

339288126.name: beautiful
339288126.author: a TripAdvisor user
339288126.reviewBody: we stayed there just for 2 days. If you go for vacation be careful with the location you choose. Keep in mind there is a large port right in the city. Pick the hotel/condo area, north side of a bay. It is much more suitable for vacationers with great beaches, well-maintained roads, restaurants, etc. City center (very south) does not have a beach, the beach in middle of the city is narrow and dirty.

333754340.name: same as miramar beach
333754340.author: a TripAdvisor user
333754340.reviewBody: If you look up miramar  beach that I wrote a review on it is the same area. You can hire a ponga to take you out sightseeing  or fishing,  it is a well protected bay, good most of the year.very few high rise buildings, long flat beach great for  a walk  with your dog or a run away from what ails you.

319459952.name: Very pretty bay
319459952.author: a TripAdvisor user
319459952.reviewBody: We enjoyed sailing in and out of Manzanillo Bay. The water was very calm and a nice shade of blue. The shore line was interesting and not industrial looking like some other ports. Nice, quite and clean.

287753087.name: Playa La Boquita
287753087.author: a TripAdvisor user
287753087.reviewBody: On the Northern side of Manzanillo Bay lies La Boquita. It is much more amenable for small children, since the water is shallow with minimal waves. There are numerous restaurants at the water\'s edge. Even more gentle is the lagoon. It is possible to rent a large umbrella, complete with a table, chairs and deck chairs right on the waterfront for about $10U.S.\nWe selected the area run by "El Rey" Ramada and ordered lunch, which was delivered to us. That was accompanied by coconut water on ice. Perfect day.\nAivarsT

286235749.name: flea market
286235749.author: a TripAdvisor user
286235749.reviewBody: We took the city bus here.  There is a few streets of flea markets, some with better shopping than others.  Very neat to see the local area with the stairs running up and houses literally stacked on the next roof as it heads up the mountain

261156559.name: Expansive bay full of barges!!!
261156559.author: a TripAdvisor user
261156559.reviewBody: Manzanillo is Mexico\'s largest \'port\' city & also has a Naval base. Therefore there are numerous barges that pass through the bay, or sit for a few days, making Manzanillo bay very unique compared to other coastal cities in Mexico. It is beautiful but does give off that idustrial affect at the same time.

259680032.name: Beauty
259680032.author: a TripAdvisor user
259680032.reviewBody: Spent many nights/days at anchor at Las Hadas, sheltered, beautiful, acess to buses, and town. The resort at Las Hadas is legendary (Think first movie "10")

258877745.name: Miles of Beach
258877745.author: a TripAdvisor user
258877745.reviewBody: Great sandy beaches, the waves can be a bit too much to swim at times, but water is clean.  Careful of the under tow and rip tides.

258317640.name: Pave Paradise & Put In A Shipping Port
258317640.author: a TripAdvisor user
258317640.reviewBody: We arrived in Manzanillo by bus from Puerto Vallarta through the line of trucks hauling shipping containers and natural gas from the massive port facilities.  In the past decade the small town has grown into one of the largest ports on the west coast and the infrastructure has not kept pace.  The city is chaotic and dirty, totally lacking charm or a cultural center.  We stayed at the lovely Las Hadas Resort across the bay, but could see the pollution haze looming over the sad city. It reminded me of a Mexican version of Newark, New Jersey.

256728023.name: Manzanillo Mas Bonita
256728023.author: a TripAdvisor user
256728023.reviewBody: There are not a lot of recent reviews about Manzanillo.  If you haven\'t been recently, you should.  There has been a lot of changes.\nFirst, the power plant that was the eye-sore of the town has been fully converted to natural gas.  No more haze over the city.  El Centro is undergoing many changes, including underground tunnels for the trains that will make traffic much better.\nThe City is doing a lot to draw more tourism.

249877647.name: Manzanillo - If you\'re looking for hot...
249877647.author: a TripAdvisor user
249877647.reviewBody: Manzanillo was an interesting place to visit, we have traveled a lot of Mexico\'s west coast from Puerto Escondido to Mazatlan  and none are like Manzanillo. This is a great resort destination but don\'t expect a lot of tourist things to do in town. Unlike PV or other locations there is very little for the tourist outside of the resort. It is the biggest shipping port in Mexico and see\'s 10 to 15 ships a day visiting its 8 km of docks. There is so little for the tourist that cruise ships haven\'t stopped here for two years.  The city is very industrial and unfortunately quite dirty so expect to spend most of your time at your resort. The weather was exceptional at the time of our visit.

249780869.name: loved the view from our room
249780869.author: a TripAdvisor user
249780869.reviewBody: We loved looking at the expansive view of the deep-water port and bay whenever we dined at the Barcelo or enjoyed the balcony view from our room.

245834726.name: Beautiful Beach
245834726.author: a TripAdvisor user
245834726.reviewBody: Outside of the harbour, Manzanilla has this massive beach that is almost devoid of people. Its lined with small hotels and restaurants but we walked for several kilometres from the Barcel\u00f3. The few people we saw were Mexicans fishing. The waves were huge and the openness made you almost forget that you are in a city.\n\nAnd if you like watching the big freighters loaded with cargo containers, then you will love this bay!

238627598.name: Pretty from a distance but not up close
238627598.author: a TripAdvisor user
238627598.reviewBody: Manzanillo is very industrial.  Unfortuanately it shows in the beaches.  The sand is discolored and the water cloudy with pollution.  The views are beautiful though.  Gorgeous green mountains and pacific sunsets.  From your terraza Manzanillo is gourgeous.  Just dont expect to lounge on the beach much less spend time in the water.  Yuck

238129193.name: Pepe\'s Tours - Fabulous ! ! !
238129193.author: a TripAdvisor user
238129193.reviewBody: Did not dislike anything - we were treated like family.  We were taken  to the hills surrounding Manzanillo/Santiago bay and then downtown and through the second largest commerical port in all of Latin America; had a beer at a sidewalk cafe and then off to the North, where we sat down in a little restaurant on the beach and had oysters on-the-half-shell -

236836076.name: Aquatic sports adventures diving
236836076.author: a TripAdvisor user
236836076.reviewBody: Aquatic sports adventures is a great dive shop in Manzanillo mx. Terry one of the owners was a great dive guide. It was a rainy day but we still saw lots of spotted eels, fish and a turtle. They have a really dive shop off the better path but they have everything you could need to use or buy. The issue was that he had to take me back to an awful Barcelo hotel which I would never recommend or go to again. Diving with Aquatic was fantastic!

204161085.name: AMAZING!
204161085.author: a TripAdvisor user
204161085.reviewBody: I spent 2 weeks here with my boyfriend and I have nothing but amazing things to say... the service, hospitality and cleanliness were all first-rate, and it was very safe. Within 3 days, we were on a first name basis with most of the staff and had already met the owners. I have traveled throughout much of Europe and North America and this was one of the best vacation experiences I\'ve ever had. From the moment we arrived and the manager, Belem showed us around and Cesar helped us with our surf board rentals, I knew we were in great hands. The staff is small and as such, very well-trained and very reliable. We needed help with a rental car and they took care of it for us. When we had questions, we were always able to get answers right away. We stayed in a beach front bungalow (which do not have A/C, but we did not want it) and we really enjoyed it. There are rooms with A/C though. The food at the hotel was great and the hotel facilities are very well-maintained. One thing worth noting is that wi-fi is still limited (only available in the restaurant/bar area) but many places down there do not even have wi-fi at all. Another note is that the surfing at this particular spot is more advanced than Sayulita (it is a left break off the point, and there are rocks) just as an FYI but I would recommend this resort to anyone going down to this area as Sayulita is only a 25-30 minute drive away. I think you would be hard-pressed to find a nicer setting in Troncones, and I doubt a more hospitable staff exists!!

202946553.name: Safety
202946553.author: a TripAdvisor user
202946553.reviewBody: Trip advisor only allows positive feedback on safety in Manzanillo. We were robbed in Manzanillo, wrote about it, and trip advisor deleted from their site as inappropriate. Reading the reviews about safety in Manzanillo, we got a very skewed perspective as Trip advisor only published the positive reviews. I will no longer use trip advisor in my travels, I cannot trust their service.

202478970.name: It is OK
202478970.author: a TripAdvisor user
202478970.reviewBody: It is pretty but not clean place.Not much to do we only spend 30 minutes here taking pictures.It is OK to go and see it if you are close but nothing big...

190462095.name: Shopping
190462095.author: a TripAdvisor user
190462095.reviewBody: There is not much to do and poor quality product does not warrant a trip there.this place is shopped by locals and is not really intended for tourist seeking good products

163319053.name: Most beautiful place in Mexico
163319053.author: a TripAdvisor user
163319053.reviewBody: . Avoid the actual city of manzanillo.  It is the biggest port in Mexico and in fact on the entire Pacific coast after Los Angeles. So it is not a particularly pleasant city. However manzanillo bay  is in fact a spectacular double bay. The bay that leads into the city is less desirable. However The next bay which the locals call Santiago bay is beautiful. Especially if you go to the northern end which is more secluded. If you stay anyplace up on the hills toward the northeast end the views are quite  amazing. The mountains rise directly from, the beach is 5 miles, the water is warm and you are surrounded by palm trees, coconuts, citrus trees, Bougainvillea.\nMy family has traveled throughout the whole country of Mexico. We think this is the most beautiful setting in the country In fact one of the most beautiful settings anywhere in the world.

156086929.name: A place  to avoid
156086929.author: a TripAdvisor user
156086929.reviewBody: we spend 3 long month in Manzanillo and could not wait to leave . Manzanillo is a dusty unfriendly city with much anti American sentiments. The beach ? is wonderful to look at, except there are so many run down hotels built very close to the water front,that fall apart right in front of your eyes ..there is no way you can swim in the Bay it is terrible dangerous and not clean. There is a huge power plant spitting coal smoke into the air ,the traffic is terrible, the conditions on the road outrages not to mention the swarms of mosquito\'s from the near by swamps that make any outdoor activity impossible. Dengue fever is very dangerous and we both got a touch of it .Never again ..there are many many beautiful places in Mexico but Manzanillo is not one of them

155431191.name: Deep Sea Fishing
155431191.author: a TripAdvisor user
155431191.reviewBody:
While in Manzanillo, Mexico we went deep sea fishing on the "Macarela" based out of the port of Manzanillo. Captain Dayo and second mate, Juan made our experience a very enjoyable and memorable one. The boat is an older one but very well cared for and clean. We chartered the boat for $300 USD for a five hour trip for the four of us. 

We had been out for about two hours before I got my 35 pound Dorado (Mahi Mahi) and waited another hour before our next one. After another hour the two men got their Dorados within minutes of each other and we lost one when the line tangled and broke. All four of us caught Dorados ranging in size from 25 pounds to 35 pounds! And we were provided with endless ice cold Coronitas!

When we returned to dock, our first mate filleted two of the fish right on the dock while we watched the young children hand fishing. We took the fillets from one of our fish back to the Los Delfines restaurant at Los Hadas Golf & Marine Resort where the chef prepared the most fantastic meal for us. 

If you are going deep sea fishing we would highly recommend this experienced crew. The number to contact the "Macarela" is 01(314)33 259 61 and the cell phone number is: 044(314)87 246 35. 

For first time deep sea fishers this was a fantastic experience.

152975742.name: Beautiful, Clean and relaxing!
152975742.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975742.reviewBody: We lived at the El Camino Real Manzanillo on the beach.  Very quiet, clean and relaxing. Feb 6-20/2013.  very good restaurant along that beach (Toscana, Bodegas, etc....)  Excellent place for Camarones and Oysters.

147026910.name: Sunset Cruise
147026910.author: a TripAdvisor user
147026910.reviewBody: Did a short cruise of both Santiago Bay and Manzanillo Bay just before sunset. Saw the resorts from the ocean, along with houses on the cliffs. Saw the Sleeping Elephant Rock. Great cruise with really great people! A lot of fun!

146257650.name: The best swimming beach is La Boquita
146257650.author: a TripAdvisor user
146257650.reviewBody: On the north side of the bay, La Boquita is the beach favoured by locals. Hard sand beach, gentle slope, small waves. A string of beachfront restaurants serve great seafood right on the sand.

145808634.name: Great walking beach.
145808634.author: a TripAdvisor user
145808634.reviewBody: Friendly locals. Clean beach for long walks. Plenty of public entrances / exits if you want to take a break from the sand and checkout the town. Bring a bottle of water though, the sun can get hot. Fell asleep to the sound of the waves.

129794919.name: Authenthic
129794919.author: a TripAdvisor user
129794919.reviewBody: Small village with great food and authentic shopping!

126289431.name: Beautiful, calm and relaxing
126289431.author: a TripAdvisor user
126289431.reviewBody: I love the Pacific Ocean. The water was warm and clear and the sand off white and grey

126076516.name: Beautiful!
126076516.author: a TripAdvisor user
126076516.reviewBody: This Is The Main Attraction For Spring Breakers From United States, Canda, U.K., Spain, Etc.

126006563.name: Don\'t be disappointed at the first look.....
126006563.author: a TripAdvisor user
126006563.reviewBody: We went on a Mexican Riviera cruise with Carnival, and our last port to stop was Manzanilla.  Unfortunately, I wish it would have been the first port to stop in, as having seen all the beauty of Ensanada, Cabo San Lucas, and Puerto Vallarta, we were disappointed in what we saw at Manzanilla.  Two smokestacks from a factory which left a blanket over the city is what your first view was.  A local tour guide told us, that Manzanilla is in the building stage as  there were many, many cranes everywhere, and construction. I think if we had been told this is how these beautiful resorts start out(and seen it first) , then we would have had our mind set on this. I wish we could have seen it when it is finished.  I must say, Manzanilla wouldn\'t be on my \'Go back to!\'  list. (I was also told, that because Mazatland had a high crime rate, it was taken off and Manzanilla put on, as the substituting port--?true or not?)

124305752.name: Not as good as Santiago
124305752.author: a TripAdvisor user
124305752.reviewBody: There was a haze over the bay from the nearby energy plant. It was always hard to see from a distance and the haze gave it a dirty feel.

124077783.name: the bay is nice
124077783.author: a TripAdvisor user
124077783.reviewBody:
I read some of the other reviews and am not sure if we are all talking about the same area.  I assume the Manz bay is the scalloped bay that stretches from the jetty in Brisas all the way to Las Hadas.
This is a nice area.  The beaches are not crowded at all.  You will see a few people on weekends.  
The beach drops off but area is still nice for swimming, maybe not as safe for little kids as miramar.
The sunsets are to die for.

123885747.name: Go see the giant marlin
123885747.author: a TripAdvisor user
123885747.reviewBody: Shopping was good , We walked around the area for awhile didnt see any restaurants we wanted to try so we went back to the resort.  The locals dont like to barter so that was a bit of a dissappointment.

123130801.name: Great sunsets
123130801.author: a TripAdvisor user
123130801.reviewBody: Sunsets are great, water is warm and good area for swimming.

121676016.name: Great for a day.
121676016.author: a TripAdvisor user
121676016.reviewBody: We took in the sights of the marina and walked around downtown for a good part of day.  It is worth taking pictures of the huge sailfish and other statues...but really didn\'t have a reason to go back to the area until we took a boat out for fishing.

120862821.name: Bay cruise around Manzanillo bay
120862821.author: a TripAdvisor user
120862821.reviewBody: Great 3-hour cruise around the bay, saw a manta jumping, caught mackerel and yellowtail, saw needlefish jumping, and finished with a school of dolphins jumping around our boat near the port at sunset. It was a really great afternoon!

115605351.name: Beautiful Beaches.... Cant wait to go again!
115605351.author: a TripAdvisor user
115605351.reviewBody:
Manzanillo has some great beaches and views... Depending on when you go, it could be crowded, but the days just before holy week were perfect... The day before we left Manzanillo, it was crowded! 

We had an awesome time... There was literally only a dozen people on our side of the beach.. I recommend renting a place there that has its own access to the beach, that way you dont have to worry about having too many invading your space... BUT I do recommend you double check all of your rental paperwork and confirm, confirm, confirm. We had an embarrassing moment due to not having done that... 

Enjoy the weather, its just great!... Plan on staying a few days too...So you can go to other beaches nearby..

100816137.name: Stay at the Manoir Victoria in the old city-Quebec City
100816137.author: a TripAdvisor user
100816137.reviewBody: -for an affordable, pleasant trip to Quebec City AND be within the walls of the old city, stay at the Manoir Victoria. We went for March break. The staff is polite and professional---all the staff--and the location is very good for getting around. The rooms were so clean and tastefully decorated and the feather beds were great.  To get where we wanted to go from the hotel--charming restaurants, stores, Crushed Ice sporting event, the carriage rides, Museum of Civilizaton, walk down by the river in the nieghbourhood,  etc, we walked, took the electric bus for 1$, and used a tour bus to get to the Ice Hotel and a historical tour (tour bus comes right to your door). There was plenty to do, and the meals and service were wonderful, and the cost for resturants was low. If you can, take advantage of the pool, restaurants, sauna  and the SPA services. The spa staff were obviously trained very well and treated us like Queens within Manoir Victoria .Last words: good for kids and teens, or for a romantic stay without them!

1028712.name: romantic surf bungalow
1028712.author: a TripAdvisor user
1028712.reviewBody: When you arrive down the little dirt road, one wonders just where have I arrived? Well, the individual bungalows with the pounding surf echoing thru the wood slat windows gives an ambiance of romance while counting the stars above the pool in the quiet of the night gives you a feeling of contentment after one of many treasures found on the menu. Where else can you find wasabe mayo in your mexican fish taco? All I can reccommend is..... "Just do it!" You will be happy after a surf or fishing excursion to top the whole experience off!

665780731.name: shops ans sights
665780731.author: a TripAdvisor user
665780731.reviewBody:
Lots of shops in the "old" town area, none of the vendors were pushy. I noticed that not all of the shops were open early, maybe they aren't used to the early cruise ship people. As the day went on, more and more shops opened. 
Across the street from the shops is a park with several statues. Also there is a fountain that dances to music......it was on in the morning and shut off when we walked by there in the afternoon, so I would said that it is something that is hit or miss. 
Also if you are hungry, there is no lack of places to choose from.
One last thing, not all of the sidewalks or streets are smooth, so be careful walking.

658874011.name: Not bad but not great
658874011.author: a TripAdvisor user
658874011.reviewBody: Lots of souvenirs T-shirt and street venders all the same stuff. The venders were not pushy and were very nice.much calmer than Puerto Vallarta.

648791161.name: A comfortable to place to enjoy your typical Mexican "Flea Markets"
648791161.author: a TripAdvisor user
648791161.reviewBody: Manzanillo El Centro is fairly small so it is great for people who don\'t want to do a lot of walking and still get the flavor of the town. I was pleased to see well marked signage to public toilets. The area was clean and felt very safe with a combination of police, extra tourist police and police direction at major crosswalks. No aggressive streets vendors, just your typical shop owner "inviting " you in. It seems like it has only recently been added as a cruise ship port of call so it seems to have more of an authentic feel than other ports.

640748591.name: Nice Little Outdoor Park and Area to Enjoy the Sights, Sounds, and Sun
640748591.author: a TripAdvisor user
640748591.reviewBody: A great way to spend a half day especially if you enjoy a good walk, from the Cruise ship. The main park and square is at the giant sailfish, plenty of places to wander and down side streets for shopping, the tourist shops tend t be on the main Blvd, while the local sops tend to be on the side streets. Variety of food choices all along the main Blvs and side streets and alleys in front of the harbor ranging in price including multiple shops for souvenirs and clothing.

640747913.name: Beautiful all around
640747913.author: a TripAdvisor user
640747913.reviewBody: Lots of picture worthy places here, by the big fish, lots of vendors and spots to buy locally made souvenirs, it\u2019s a pleasant place to spend the evening specially in December it\u2019s nicely lit and lots of family friendly activities.

640201841.name: El centro
640201841.author: a TripAdvisor user
640201841.reviewBody: It\'s a great way to spend a half day especially if you enjoy a good walk. Take a bus and get off along where the charter fishing boats are. At the giant sailfish wander down the street for the tourist shops.Be sure to walk far enough to take in the several iguanas up in the trees and also be sure to see the centro mercado. If you\'re early head to the top floor for pozole or tacos.

637891442.name: Fun walk with great views
637891442.author: a TripAdvisor user
637891442.reviewBody: With a overcast and a view of the harbor, this is a fun stop if you are visiting this city. Located in downtown, the harbor is parked with battlships and tugboats. The mountains surrounding the harbor have local houses/apartemts built going up the hills. There were a variety of food choices going along/within the alleys in front of the harbor ranging in price including multiple shops for souvenirs and clothing.

632455442.name: not much
632455442.author: a TripAdvisor user
632455442.reviewBody: There are souvenir shops, restaurants, bars, convenience shops all off the cruise ship dock where money could be spent.  A small walking area in front of the port, all looking at the smoke stack of the power generation plant.  Compared to other \'resort\' towns, this is nothing much.

598929624.name: Good ol mexican downtown
598929624.author: a TripAdvisor user
598929624.reviewBody: This is the perfect good old mexican downtown, a lot of history and traditional places to visit in Manzanillo.

588703968.name: not much there
588703968.author: a TripAdvisor user
588703968.reviewBody: \nThere isn\'t much to see or do.  If you want to stop here as a cruiseport, you will likely be disappointed.  hey need t get busy and create something worth seeing.  This is the place where 10 was filmed with Bo Derek-remember?

584927584.name: Nice City/Bonita ciudad.
584927584.author: a TripAdvisor user
584927584.reviewBody:
Before leaving our hotel, we went to the center and looked around. We were able to visit some shops near the park. What little we saw was positive. We were able to eat ice cream 🍦 in one of the businesses in the area, very tasty 😋, I recommend it.
Nice place to visit.

Antes de irnos de nuestro hotel, fuimos al centro y le dimos una vuelta. Pudimos visitar algunas tiendas cercanas al parque. Lo poco que vimos fue positivo. Pudimos comer helado en una de los negocios del area, muy ricos, lo recomiendo.
Bonito lugar que visitar.

580495803.name: Enjoyable port!
580495803.author: a TripAdvisor user
580495803.reviewBody: We walked off the cruise ship and up to the boardwalk, stopped in a small bay-front park, then just a bit more walking to the giant blue sailfish sculpture. There\'s also a fountain with dancing waters and a statue of a stevedore. And there\'s the pretty bay. Turn inland and you\'re instantly in the old center of town, which is busy and feels quite authentic since its full of locals. We were only pressured once by a very pushy woman with a child who was begging (she actually grabbed my husband\'s arm, but moved away when he said stop!)  Other than that, it was very pleasant to walk the streets, weaving in and out of some of the shops where clothes, shoes, leather goods, etc. are sold. Lots of restaurants, an ice cream shop, and a little bit of interesting colonial architecture.  Plenty of taxis when you want to venture father afield.

573472962.name: A chance to see how the locals live and shop
573472962.author: a TripAdvisor user
573472962.reviewBody: Manzanillo lived up to our expectations. We wanted to spend time in a working Mexican city and did this ever deliver! We were able to walk around and shop in the downtown core and doing do by foot was the way to do it. We walked all through the various cross streets and shopped at a lovely Farmers Market, a great show store and bought some leather goods. We loved being able to shop without being pestered and know what the listed prices were just like a local. There was a huge and fantastic shoe store where we bought some great sandals for out little grand daughters. We could never find footwear like this in Canada. I highly recommend people just visiting this area and walking around freely. It is super safe and people are friendly and do not hassle you. We loved it and will return.

569689554.name: Check it out
569689554.author: a TripAdvisor user
569689554.reviewBody: Good for a walk around is a working city, walk up the stairs on the point for a good view of the area

567705719.name: A small centro worth a short visit
567705719.author: a TripAdvisor user
567705719.reviewBody: We always take a bus into the centro once during every visit to Manzanillo. It is worth a short visit, but has nothing much to offer more than a busy and small downtown. There are some interesting statues along the waterfront. Also you can find a good place to eat while you are in town. This really is not a touristy town.

566634144.name: ok during daytime, wouldn\'t visit at night
566634144.author: a TripAdvisor user
566634144.reviewBody: ok to walk around during daylight hours with several cafes, restaurants and bars plus a great public area near the harbour to walk around but these seems to close early (with the exception of the excellent hotel restaurant) and I left at dusk as it didn\'t seem to be a place to hang around in

564932935.name: Not much there
564932935.author: a TripAdvisor user
564932935.reviewBody: The seawall walk was nice but we were pretty much done looking around in 1/2 an hour. It was a very long bus ride to get there, and an expensive cab ride back. Not really worth the trip

563437713.name: Walking around the nearby vacinity
563437713.author: a TripAdvisor user
563437713.reviewBody: We prefer to visit the local area the 1st time a get a feel for the area we are in. It was quite a nice leisurely stroll through many little shops along that area near the Pier.

559915420.name: Nice boardwalk
559915420.author: a TripAdvisor user
559915420.reviewBody: Nice Boardwalk not very touristy like Playa da carmen, walked lots around the downtown stores enjoyed all of it.

559066840.name: Wonderful sculptures.
559066840.author: a TripAdvisor user
559066840.reviewBody: Great well kept park. Lots of good picture taking opportunities. Lots of nice little side streets to enjoy.

558725768.name: Nice
558725768.author: a TripAdvisor user
558725768.reviewBody: El Centro is a lovely area to wander around and spend a few hours.  A nice park at the water front with a massive fish statue are interesting sights.

557937186.name: Must see
557937186.author: a TripAdvisor user
557937186.reviewBody: If you were in Manzanillo, you absolutely positively need to get down here to see the swordfish statue. It\u2019s a classic. It\u2019s something you have to have a photograph. Very fun little area and lots of activities and things to do. Many street vendors.

556409261.name: Manzanillo sign was good for photos
556409261.author: a TripAdvisor user
556409261.reviewBody: Not much to do in this area, but to take photos of the sign and sailfish and habour.  Also a few shops to purchase items.

554679020.name: Authentic
554679020.author: a TripAdvisor user
554679020.reviewBody: Our visit was great. We were not expecting it to be so authentic but it was a real treat. If you are looking for touristy stores this will not be your cup of tea but if you want to feel what it would be like without the tourist shops this place is great. There are the small tourist shops around the big fish but if you go a block or two away it become more authentic.

554258751.name: Ok - not a high priority
554258751.author: a TripAdvisor user
554258751.reviewBody: Wanted to at least see the main area of the town,  Parking is a real pain but if you are willing to walk a ways you\'ll be fine.  the biggest drawback in our mind was, after the new years eve celebrations, the malecon was filthy.  tons of refuse on the sidewalks and in the water.  good place to snap a couple pictures to prove we were there, but nothing to really catch our interest in returning.

553587312.name: Day Trip
553587312.author: a TripAdvisor user
553587312.reviewBody: Took local bus from Club Santiago to El Centro.... Lovely waterfront and shopping... Restaurants plenty to choose from... wear comfy shoes...roads are steep hill in some areas ...Must visit the Iguana sanctuary...quite the habitation...

553291307.name: Nothing to do there
553291307.author: a TripAdvisor user
553291307.reviewBody: Got there, saw it in 30 min, could do it in less. Mexican city center of a poor city. When Manzanillo was growing, it forgot to update the city center. To avoid - way more interesting places to be around

553279617.name: Interesting
553279617.author: a TripAdvisor user
553279617.reviewBody: Thought we would walk around.  It is a very interesting area.  Felt safe & encountered no issues.  Made some small purchases from the street vendors - they refused to barter - which was a bit of a surprise.

550445166.name: If you are in la punta, I\u2019d question the effortTo drive down there
550445166.author: a TripAdvisor user
550445166.reviewBody: Overall not a pretty City, and smoggy.   Whole area smoggy.  Would doubt if I\u2019d return.  Puerto Vallarta is much prettier and a lot less smog and industry.  Reasonable prices though.   \n\n

549021808.name: Interesting & variety
549021808.author: a TripAdvisor user
549021808.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking along the malecon and stopping in many of the shops.  Very scenic and beautiful.  We will plan to go back.

547579178.name: Not quite the centro experience most tourists would expect
547579178.author: a TripAdvisor user
547579178.reviewBody:
We took a cab ride over to see what this side of Manzanillo looked like. We were surprised at how big the port area is = you have to drive a good 5-7 minutes around the area to connect from the boulevard to the centro. Very industrial. 
The centro itself was a little underwhelming. The statue was nice to see, but it's like there's the cruise ship docking area, a taxi staging area, and then the historic town center just butts up against this.
It's not like there's a nice plaza or church or civic building to center the centro that looks welcoming to visitors. 
Our driver drove us around and it's really just a collection of small shops and eateries and very urban in that there's little open space to congregate. He mentioned usually people from cruise ships want to run a quick errand and head back to the ships, which we thought was kind of sad. He didn't seem to think that cruise ship days were a boon for the economy, really. Which on one hand is a shame, because the other parts of Manzanillo were really pretty. On the other hand, this keeps the real Manzanillo a secret and keeps the large tourist crowds out of these areas.
We really only drove around for 10 minutes or so to get a feel, stopping outside the main church and going by the iguana park as well. And back we went to the main boulevard.
So I'd guess I'd say to visitors coming in by cruise ship: if you want a more resort, beachy experience, look for restaurants on the boulevard and enjoy the drive and the food once there. Or, head to the beaches on the other bay. If you're looking to shop in small stores for brick a brack, stick with el centro.

534390182.name: Warm people and nice downtown
534390182.author: a TripAdvisor user
534390182.reviewBody: We walked around the main plaza and "El Malecon", where we found a great sculpture, symbol of Manzanillo, which is a very big sword fish.\nThe Place was clean, there are several market sites and restaurants where to have a drink and something to eat.

487449980.name: Nice walk
487449980.author: a TripAdvisor user
487449980.reviewBody: Nice sculptures.  Great view.  Gives you a good idea of what manzanillo is about.  Nice walk.  Lots of restaurants.  Lots of gelato!

484775171.name: Port city
484775171.author: a TripAdvisor user
484775171.reviewBody: Main plaza area with views of the commercial ship operations as Manzanillo is Mexico\'s largest port.  Nice market area to walk through about 4 blocks away.  Negotiate with the taxi drivers back to your hotel as they will try to over-charge.  Check with your hotel to see what the going rates are to the city center.  We spent a couple of hours walking around and it was a safe feeling environment.  If a tour ship is in port, you may want to avoid visiting this area as the crowds are large.

479550736.name: lovely downtown
479550736.author: a TripAdvisor user
479550736.reviewBody: We walked around the Malecon area and downtown.  We found some great places to have a bite to eat and some interesting sites.  We were surprised at the size of the container port here.  Very busy rail and container port.

476482838.name: El Centro
476482838.author: a TripAdvisor user
476482838.reviewBody: Took a taxi to El Centro $130 pesos from our hotel.  We wanted to check out the big blue fish.  There were two homeless people sleeping underneath the statue.  I suppose you get homeless in every town.  I know we have our fair share in Surrey.\nThe town itself had a few shops down the main strip but we found they were mainly aimed at the locals.  Not really for tourists.

475928332.name: A shopping Afternoon
475928332.author: a TripAdvisor user
475928332.reviewBody: Definitely a working port, good deals in the little shops, great ice cream, check out the little cooking shacks for great food. We enjoyed our afternoon. Absolutely the place to start for your sport fishing experience.

473823017.name: Skip and just stay in the ship!
473823017.author: a TripAdvisor user
473823017.reviewBody: Manzanilo was one of the 4 places our cruise ship visited.  I don\'t know why they  included this port as there is really nothing to see.  We didn\'t sign up for any excursions so we were left wandering on our own.  Nothing worthy to do or see.  Once you get off the ship, you\'re by the Malecon.  You cross the street, and you have little shops and food stalls.  That was it.  We decided to get into a cab to bring us to Playa Miramar. It was a bit of a drive to get there from the cruise ship terminal.  Big mistake.  Waste of time and money.  The beach was a disappointment.  We didn\'t bother to get off the cab and just asked the driver to take us back to the cruise ship. The drive to and from the beach was not nice either.   I would not suggest this as a place to visit.

473773760.name: Real Mexico
473773760.author: a TripAdvisor user
473773760.reviewBody: From the cruise ship, take a walk past the tourist shops. There are many little streets & stalls where the local Mexicans live and shop. This is a busy port town, not a tourist town but it is a good opportunity to see life as it is for Mexicans. This isn\'t always possible from cruise ships. It is a good walk around the two hills in the middle of the town to do a circuit past the many shops selling local wares, not tourist souvenirs. There are many haberdashery stores selling local fabrics if that is of interest. Just follow the train line back to the port and the cruise ship.

473286174.name: Local Town
473286174.author: a TripAdvisor user
473286174.reviewBody: Certainly not a tourist destination:my impression was that this was a true working town with the locals going about their day. If this is what you are interested in seeing then this is a great destination. If you are looking for souvenirs and quaint streets then this isn\'t the spot for you. You can get some good photo opps by the sail fish and Manzanillo sign. If you get a good taxi driver, they will tell you a little bit more about the place as you drive to or from your accommodation.(For instance, they have been building the overpass for 5 years!)

472420120.name: Not what we had hoped for
472420120.author: a TripAdvisor user
472420120.reviewBody: Took a taxi from our resort hoping for a descent shopping trip, the bay itself is nice and the large sailfish statue is impressive but found the shopping to be lacking, same old stuff , shop after shop, no artisan art or crafts to be found.

471665599.name: nice little town
471665599.author: a TripAdvisor user
471665599.reviewBody: We took a taxi from the hotel Barcelo, since there was a bunch of us like 13 people, we had 2 taxis coming, the van taxi was a money maker and speak good english and he thought he can squeeze as much money from us as he can, big no no,  we left him and took local taxi back to the hotel, less expensive and much fun. We went exploring city of Manzanillo, nice little town friendly locals.  I love the souvenir shops.

470193036.name: Not as Touristy as I Thought
470193036.author: a TripAdvisor user
470193036.reviewBody: My family and I took a taxi from the Barcelo resort to El Centro thinking it would be filled with tourist shops and restaurants. Perhaps we missed something but to our surprise, it was more of a place for locals. In the streets where we strolled, we were perhaps the only foreigners. There were some souvenir shops but not as much as anticipated. It\'s still a nice walk through the harbour district and there you can get a flavour of what the locals like to do when hanging out there on a weekend or evening. If you are souvenir shopping or looking for touristy type restaurants, you won\'t find much at El Centro.

469672909.name: Fun afternoon shopping
469672909.author: a TripAdvisor user
469672909.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours wandering through the shops, then sat and had a cerveza and people-watched for a bit.  Had to take a pic of the giant sailfish, of course, and then hopped on a bus back to our condo.  The ride itself is an experience - you get to see some of the real town!

467971262.name: Great outing
467971262.author: a TripAdvisor user
467971262.reviewBody: We took a cab downtown to check this area out.  It didn\'t cost much to get there and we enjoyed walking through the shops without harassment.  What a difference from 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen.  We found everything we needed there and then some.

467824997.name: Lots to look at.  Good shopping options.
467824997.author: a TripAdvisor user
467824997.reviewBody: Some great photo opportunities at Centro.  Store keepers are friendly and not pushy.  We like to just park (there is a multi level car park) and walk around.  Lots of taco, ice cream places but not many spots for a bite and a beer. \n

466605753.name: Nice view of container ships and tankers
466605753.author: a TripAdvisor user
466605753.reviewBody: Not worth the time to visit.  MZO is the largest port in Mexico.  El Centro has a large plaza with less than scenic views of the bay and mostly ship and terminal traffic.  The market area about 4 block away is quaint with crowded stalls and lots of locals who make this a daily shopping experience.  We stayed 2 weeks about 5 miles away and visited El Centro once.   Checked that block.  Nothing remarkable or worth it for a destination.

466300504.name: Exploreing
466300504.author: a TripAdvisor user
466300504.reviewBody: We walked around the  shopping area and had some refreshments at one of the little restaurants to get away from the resort and see what Old Manzanillo was like. From a tourists perspective you can get a better feel of the area by heading out into their environment and also contribute somewhat into their economy.

466183922.name: That\'s One BIG Fish!
466183922.author: a TripAdvisor user
466183922.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Manzanillo without seeing the big blue sailfish in the town center. It\'s HUGE!!  And across the way are shops and ice cream places.  It\'s a nice morning activity.

465954340.name: Downtown trip
465954340.author: a TripAdvisor user
465954340.reviewBody: Went shopping downtown, square was nice it is interesting a lot of true mexican life. Very clean however the tourist stalls all sell same thing. They need to branch out - nice afternoon

464591535.name: typical Mexican town except for........
464591535.author: a TripAdvisor user
464591535.reviewBody: Yes a nice place to go shopping, but the pigeons to me were just horrible but I\'m a farmer and consider them flying rats. On the up side there is a place that is just crawling with  lizards its a must see ask your taxi driver to take you there.

464434409.name: Nothing there
464434409.author: a TripAdvisor user
464434409.reviewBody: Nothing to do restaurants Ideat at. Easy to get lost. Mostly shops for locals. Parts, grocery, fast food, daily needs

463906787.name: Family vacation
463906787.author: a TripAdvisor user
463906787.reviewBody: So many shops and places to eat. Could not believe how many shoe stores there are. Went on Flag Day. Schools from all over Manzanillo were represented dress in their school uniforms.

463797240.name: really beautful town
463797240.author: a TripAdvisor user
463797240.reviewBody: My friend and I really enjoyed this town. Lots to do. Good food and beautiful weather in February. Homemade coconut ice cream from a street vender. Yummy.

462047913.name: Stick to the smaller towns!
462047913.author: a TripAdvisor user
462047913.reviewBody: The centre of Manzanillo  is moderately interesting but nasty to get to. We had a car for the week and were able to visit several small towns up and down the coast in the same time it took to fight traffic and inch our way by the docks and through construction to El Certro which is basically just souvenier  shops and the odd restaurant. There are lots better things to see out of the city!!

461577187.name: Manzanillo central
461577187.author: a TripAdvisor user
461577187.reviewBody: worth a visit to see the giant statue.  Lots of shops around the square.  Try the coconut ice cream at the shop across the street!!

461462047.name: Authentically Mexico
461462047.author: a TripAdvisor user
461462047.reviewBody: Enjoyed a great day in Centro. Did much shopping. Loved the Colonial Hotel. It is very old and great original features. Must do if in Manzanillo.

461303413.name: huge port
461303413.author: a TripAdvisor user
461303413.reviewBody: We always like to visit the historic center of the cities we visit. We took the local bus (#1) for 7 pecos. We were able to see the large port on the way. The huge blue sailfish sculpture is at the center of town and a good meeting point. Very few stores cater to tourists and we found it enjoyable to shop in the stores for locals.

461104787.name: Las Hadas to El Centro
461104787.author: a TripAdvisor user
461104787.reviewBody: El Centro was worth the trip off the resort. The statues were amazing, the navy ships in the harbour were quite the sight - the kids loved them. There are so many shops to explore & restaurants to choose from give yourself plenty of time, You cannot cover it in a couple of hours - leave plenty of time.\nAlso we experience our first ever pay as you go bathrooms. You pay per person to use the washroom at the pier. It was weird.\nWatch out for potholes on the sidewalks here - accident waiting to happen

460987091.name: Old town Manzanillo
460987091.author: a TripAdvisor user
460987091.reviewBody: We took the #1 bus to El Centro. 7 peso\'s/person/trip. On arrival we visited the maritime monument and photographed the giant blue Marlin statue. We wandered through the various streets behind the fancier front row shops. Lots of shopping abounds for everyone\'s tastes. \nWe later found a little pizza shop (D\'Gusta) and enjoyed a very tasty large Hawaiian pizza for 79 pesos and inexpensive sodas and water with excellent service, before catching the bus back to the Las Brisas area. Nice little outing for very little cost.

459436802.name: Fun place
459436802.author: a TripAdvisor user
459436802.reviewBody: We had a great time in El Centro @ Manzanillo. A great market, the harbour and the Iguana Refuge are all great places to visit.

458673368.name: No pushy sales personel
458673368.author: a TripAdvisor user
458673368.reviewBody: There is alot of little shops here, have just about anything you need or don\'t but have to own anyway. Relaxing atmosphere, no sales people in your face trying to convince you to shop in their store. No timeshare sales people wasting your expensive valuable time. Good for you residents of Manzanillo, I hope you never change. Everyone was friendly, not everyone spoke english but it didn\'t seem to matter you still could manage to get what you need. It was easy to catch a yellow cab, and I say yellow because this is local people making a living in these cabs. They have set rates, they are usually posted at the door of your hotel. The english speaking drivers are informative and are so helpful answering questions you may have. Its like having your own tour guide, which some will do if you want them for the day. Its a short walk from here to the Iguana sanctuary.

457637406.name: Old Mexico
457637406.author: a TripAdvisor user
457637406.reviewBody: Old Mexican seaport.  This is no border town, the people don\'t speak much English, many not at all.   El Centro is bustling with families and shoppers making their trek to the fresh market with all sorts of fresh local veggies and fresh meats.  It is fascinating just watching the vendors custom butcher up a chicken to order, of fillet a small fish.

457491894.name: Not that great but okay
457491894.author: a TripAdvisor user
457491894.reviewBody: This place was lively and had some zing to it however didn\'t find anything much or anything extra special about it...

457410018.name: Malecon
457410018.author: a TripAdvisor user
457410018.reviewBody: Real Mexico is found here, except the vendors don\'t bother you here !  All the better.  Visit in the AM, gets hot down here.

456744158.name: Shopping in town
