456744158.author: a TripAdvisor user
456744158.reviewBody: Manzanillo is a port city moving cargo in and out of Mexico. The town is small, well worn, there are vendors selling goods on the side streets, prices typical of Mexico, nice picture by the bay. Nothing special to take a trip, get a taxi, go in walk about and head back out to your accommodation in an hour.

456034968.name: Good for spending evening
456034968.author: a TripAdvisor user
456034968.reviewBody: This is good place for spending evening, You will get to see some shows here. It is near port so, you will see huge ships as well.

455311591.name: Interesting Sculpture
455311591.author: a TripAdvisor user
455311591.reviewBody: This thing is huge! That said, it looks just like it does in the photos but if you are in the area, check it out.

454530144.name: Worth a stroll
454530144.author: a TripAdvisor user
454530144.reviewBody: . The downtown waterfront malecon, with its towering blue sailfish statue, was worth an hour\u2019s stroll.

453899272.name: Beautiful little city
453899272.author: a TripAdvisor user
453899272.reviewBody: Friendly people . Cute shops .  Nice ocean views .  This bustling sea port had a lot to see . Watch a Naval procession at the base , feed the pigeons at the central gazebo , or look at the huge sailfish , which is famous in that region . Stop at The Colonial for a great breakfast !!!!! Walk up the street to the Iguana Archunda .

453465963.name: Lovely plaza
453465963.author: a TripAdvisor user
453465963.reviewBody: In spite of several negative reviews, we checked out El Centro and found it worth the visit. Several nice sculptures and open spaces.  Shops are ok, and vendors are not aggressive which is nice when you are just browsing.

453362514.name: Interesting area
453362514.author: a TripAdvisor user
453362514.reviewBody: Limited shopping...you have to go to the streets further back from the main street for better shopping.

450840924.name: Nice Stroll and Short Walk from Piers
450840924.author: a TripAdvisor user
450840924.reviewBody: This was our last port of call.  It was a nice walk to the town centre.  The Marlin is a beautiful symbol of this peaceful port of call.  I recommend taking a cab ride to see the outlying areas once you walk around this central area.  The vendors that were on display near the port did not want to barter so I encourage people to go right into town if you want to barter and make some local purchases.

449597229.name: Interesting
449597229.author: a TripAdvisor user
449597229.reviewBody: Took the city tour offered by the hotel so was on their schedule. Not enough time to look around to enjoy the center long enough

449355164.name: Good but not great
449355164.author: a TripAdvisor user
449355164.reviewBody: Took bus to downtown, area is too small & busy, not too much interesting things to buy or to do, and very hard to find a Taxi to return to resort, we flagged down so many cabs but they are either have guests already or not taking more.  We stopped at a Tourist info booth and asked for help to call for a Taxi, but they refused to.  Not worth to go.

445602997.name: Just good!
445602997.author: a TripAdvisor user
445602997.reviewBody: It is a nice place on which you can take some pictures for your memories, we got a tour inside a ship from the Mexican navy it was a good extra that we did not expect.

431360284.name: Nice view of the sea
431360284.author: a TripAdvisor user
431360284.reviewBody: There is not a lot to see, the view is nice. A must in the tour of your visit to Manzanillo. Few restaurants and some stores for your Manzanillo Souvenirs.

428876571.name: Tipical mexican town
428876571.author: a TripAdvisor user
428876571.reviewBody: Not your usual touristy downtown. Locals come here to hang out at night and have paletas. Small downtown with local shops and restaurants.

424425578.name: Malecon!
424425578.author: a TripAdvisor user
424425578.reviewBody: You have to come by and walk the malecon. The people are super sweet. Shopping, food, the culture. Peaceful and pleasant

423710655.name: The changes are coming
423710655.author: a TripAdvisor user
423710655.reviewBody:
Centro Manzanillo is close to becoming a destination within the city. The railway construction is a bit of a hinderance if you are coming from the Hotel district. 

The Cinco de Mayo market is a great place to shop for fresh veggies, fish, chicken and meat products. There are enough vendors there to insure non locals are not charged the gringo tax. Most vendors have posted prices, but if not wait for a local to purchase and you can be sure to get a fair price.

The Iguana's are located away from the Sailfish statue on Av Francisco L Madero (it is a 15-20 minute walk on Av México, turn left at Calle 3 and they are on the trees one block down).

Across from the square next to City Hall, stop and enjoy a latte and Cubana Torta at Chantilly. If you sit at an outdoor table you can watch the activities around the square. 

In the evening of Mexican holidays there are always festivities around the square. The Dancing water fountains should be operational soon.

A number of property owners have discovered paint and there is a new freshness in the area.

This winter, 22 cruise ships are scheduled to visit Manzanillo. If you were thinking of purchasing trinkets or souvenirs, enjoy the sights and sounds but prices go up when the tourists arrive from the cruise ships, so you may wish to postpone your shopping.

If you wish to charter a sport fishing tour, the pier by the traffic circle Prol Niños Héroes
is a place to visit late afternoon to arrange fishing for another day. The boats usually leave the pier between 7 and 8 am. Expect to pay $75 - $80 US per hour (4 hour minimum).

420822393.name: Downtown
420822393.author: a TripAdvisor user
420822393.reviewBody: Great shopping, restaurants, and just plain people watching. The market is a must, you can get everything there. I like going in the early morning.

404185140.name: A bit sad
404185140.author: a TripAdvisor user
404185140.reviewBody: It is sad to see so many homeless but it is very pretty if you ignore the graffiti and the trash. Overall no to dirty and with a beautiful view.

399598752.name: Fun sight seeing and shopping
399598752.author: a TripAdvisor user
399598752.reviewBody: A great and fun place to take in old Manzanillo and see the historical sites and monuments to U. s. and Mexico\'s past history.

385402125.name: Interesting place.
385402125.author: a TripAdvisor user
385402125.reviewBody: Downtown Manzanillo is unique. There you can find a lot of things, tool shops, workshops, restaurants, icecreams, boulangeries, mexican topical markets, food markets and street vendors. \nThere are plenty of nice and friendly people. Don\'t forget to visit the old ships on the pier.

379161944.name: once is more than enough
379161944.author: a TripAdvisor user
379161944.reviewBody: I took the bus too what I was told was old town (the older part of Manzanillo).  Yes I saw the fish and looked at the harbor and the $1,000,000 homes on the hill.  Let\'s be clear, this town is a port town, a town of commerce and money.  Tourism ranks way down the list of priorities.

373914502.name: Mercado el centro
373914502.author: a TripAdvisor user
373914502.reviewBody: Years ago this was the best of Manzanillo, but more than 10 years of Pemex road construction has caused an economic disaster for the area. It will still be years before Pemex finishes and all of the real tourist attractions have moved out to Miguel de la Madrid.

365277033.name: Sailfish
365277033.author: a TripAdvisor user
365277033.reviewBody: The area has nothing to draw visitors except for Sailfish and any special event or festival.  Festival activities were only scheduled at night even on a Saturday, so unable to attend.

365257975.name: Not for a hot day
365257975.author: a TripAdvisor user
365257975.reviewBody: Aimless wandering in the heat. Lots of touristy places shops and restaurants. Little depth to our visit. Sad place.

359571064.name: Spring break 2016
359571064.author: a TripAdvisor user
359571064.reviewBody: Not overly impressive.  Colonial Hotel was nice and the market interesting but not great shopping for the tourist, nor much else to see.  Ship yards on ride in very massive.

359558698.name: interesting large town in a port area
359558698.author: a TripAdvisor user
359558698.reviewBody: There are cobbled streets, narrow roads and colorful houses set on the hillside. There is a nice area to walk along the ocean. The shops are many and the prices are very reasonable. People on the streets are very friendly

359137179.name: Pleasant morning exploring El Centro
359137179.author: a TripAdvisor user
359137179.reviewBody: We decided to head downtown from Las Hades Resort and see another part of town. We did find it quite dirty, but when you are off the resort that\'s expected.  There are lots of shops to explore, and things to see. As an animal lover, I did have a hard time seeing all the stray dogs wandering around, some obviously just having had babies. But, I was told that there are a group of vets that are trying to catch and spay/neuter them to curb the growing stray dog population.  The main area with the statue is very nice, and was kept clean.  Go earlier in the day when it\'s cooler out.

355714207.name: Great Day Trip
355714207.author: a TripAdvisor user
355714207.reviewBody: A lot of energy in El Centro, great sites and people watching too.  We walked the streets, ate a late lunch and sat in the plaza area afterwards.  Very safe and friendly!

353966900.name: Shops and buying
353966900.author: a TripAdvisor user
353966900.reviewBody: Very fun and cheap, consider changing your currency to pesos at an airport airport to get more value for your money. Don\'t buy right away, there are many shops with repeated items and the prices get cheaper as you go. There are ice cream parlors at most corners and there\'s a shop where they sell knock off purses, belts, caps, and wallets like Louis Vuitton, Michael Kors, Coach, Versace, Armani Exchange, Lacoste, Ralph Lauren, Burberry, etc. I bought some wallets and caps, and the replicas were spot on, 100% pure leather, and cheap. It\'s very fun, but it\'s very poor. You can finish with in 2-3 hours and go around 1-2 in the afternoon since most shops open late. Hope this review helped!!

353696981.name: Nice Area
353696981.author: a TripAdvisor user
353696981.reviewBody: Nice place to get away for the day, there are plenty of small shops and restaurants.  Everyone is very friendly and the area is very clean.  Easy cab ride from our resort (Barcel\u00f3).

350781979.name: Wish we would have a little more spare time
350781979.author: a TripAdvisor user
350781979.reviewBody: I am glad we say it, the gigantic sailfish monument right in Centro, nice area for tourists and locals, people are very nice, shops abound with nice souvenir of all kinds, prices are reasonable, great place to visit, it is also a port where cruise ships come for a day.

349456149.name: Took the bus into El Centro
349456149.author: a TripAdvisor user
349456149.reviewBody: A very pleasant place to stroll around. The sidewalks are covered and there are oodles of shops catering to tourists and locals alike.\n\nWe got ice creams in the Dairy Queen, partly because we were hot and partly because it had a bathroom we could use.

348995382.name: Anticlimatic
348995382.author: a TripAdvisor user
348995382.reviewBody: After a week on the beach at the north end of town we were looking forward to our bus trip to "Centro".  The local bus was great, goes all around the container port and there is lots to see but not do.  The bus stops at the "Jardin Principal" which the the centre of downtown.  This is where the big sail fish is.  Also this is where the cruise terminal is.  That is about all there is.  There are a number of historic buildings and portales that have been re-purposed as shops, but not many.  The church is a block away on a hill side and looks somewhat unused.   I guess coming from Puerto Vallarta, this downtown was a bit underwhelming.  Still it was very relaxing to sit and watch the local life.

348700645.name: a relaxing area of the malecon
348700645.author: a TripAdvisor user
348700645.reviewBody: A nice quiet spot to watch and learn about Mexican life.  Not a lot of excitement but lots of vendors selling food

348499974.name: No agressive vendors
348499974.author: a TripAdvisor user
348499974.reviewBody: Did a bus tour visiting a number of spots. None of the vendors were aggressive and they are willing to barter. Its not a bad way to spend 4 hours and moderately priced.

346712691.name: bus tour
346712691.author: a TripAdvisor user
346712691.reviewBody: Excellent tour.  Gave us a good look at what was around Manzanillo.  Tour guide was very good and explained things very well.

346288999.name: Iguanas were cool
346288999.author: a TripAdvisor user
346288999.reviewBody:
It was a typical shopping area in Mexico.  I'm glad I went and the people were not as high pressure as at other places in Mexico that I've been.

There are hundreds, no thousands, of c-cans along the ocean where the shipping takes place, lots of cargo ships to see.  Interesting.

We walked up town and along the canal there is mangrove.  Iguanas bask in the sun on the trees in the hundreds.  It's quite a sight.

345212682.name: Nice way to spend an afternoon
345212682.author: a TripAdvisor user
345212682.reviewBody: This felt like a safe, real, and walkable small centre. Definitely worth taking the time to mosey around for a half day or so.  Most likely that will be enough. Mexicana Ave is the main shopping drag\nIf you\'re staying in one of the hotels, the R1 bus goes back and forth along that strip and you can\'t miss the big dolphin stature where you need to get out. (It\'s also where the bus turns around so there\'s no confusion about where to get back on). Bus costs 7 pesos so can\'t beat that. The bus passes by the shipping terminal so that\'s pretty interesting to see the scale of that operation from the road.

344026360.name: Great Photo ops so a must visit while in Manzanillo to see the Pez Vella (Flying fish=Sail Fish).
344026360.author: a TripAdvisor user
344026360.reviewBody: Manzanillo claims to have access to the best ocean fishing for Sail Fish. Many tourists come to Manzanillo and stay in the "Zona Hotelera" (Hotel Zone) and never see the old town centre (El Centro). If you don\'t have a car, take the bus towards Las Brisas and transfer at the Glorieta (Traffic circle) with the sail boat ans ask for "El Centro". Tell the driver that you to go to the Jardin or Z\u00f3colo al Centro. You can\'t miss the huge blue Sail Fish. Every Mexican "jardin" has a gazebo, shade trees and benches. This one also has a fountain decorated with caballitos (Horse fish). A malecon (sidewalk by the ocean) borders the ocean making it pleasant to walk and view the many statues to admire and the marina is pretty to see from the sidewalk as well. The malecon was damaged by the Hurricane Patricia but it is still usable.

342456561.name: Great shopping!
342456561.author: a TripAdvisor user
342456561.reviewBody: Spent a couple of days shopping in the downtown area. The area had many shops and street vendors that provide a great shopping experience. The area had a real Mexican feel to it as the streets were narrow and the architecture was amazing. It was a very enjoyable time.

341169264.name: Real Mexican Downtown
341169264.author: a TripAdvisor user
341169264.reviewBody: The Manzanillo downtown is more like that of Mazatlan than that of Puerto Vallarta: reflecting the industrial, port-city nature of Manzanillo.   Tourism is important but not the main reason for the city to exist.   We like the central market, which is a few blocks away from the waterfront.   We do not recommend eating in the Club Social - tourists we know have been ill after eating there!

341013169.name: Great to stroll around
341013169.author: a TripAdvisor user
341013169.reviewBody: By all means, visit El Centro. The streets are lined with shops that don\'t have workers calling out to you every second to buy. You can leisurely stroll around, stoop for a cold cervasa and really enjoy the local flavours.

339282383.name: not much to see
339282383.author: a TripAdvisor user
339282383.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours exploring the city center. There is not much to see. The City hall with a central park facing a pier with lots of fisherman boats and huge sculpture of a fish (marlin?). \nDont waste your time.

338951420.name: Down town!
338951420.author: a TripAdvisor user
338951420.reviewBody: we didn\'t discover this until the day before we were to leave. We were told that the Saturday market was the best. Wrong! the down town has shops and stands. Restaurants and the ships that come in. Go there. the Saturday market is a thing you can miss or do as a last resort if you are bored.

336273586.name: Things are changing
336273586.author: a TripAdvisor user
336273586.reviewBody: The El Centro district is undergoing a major transformation.  The main reason for the changes is to reroute the trains leading into the port so that they don\'t obstruct traffic.  So, new viaducts and tunnels are being constructed to re-route both vehicle and train traffic.  The benefit of all this is that the waterfront, where the trains used to pass, is being converted into a new malecon, which will greatly enhance and expand El Centro area for tourism.  It is a bit of a mess now with all of the construction, but next year it will be beautiful.

335370752.name: Awesome town
335370752.author: a TripAdvisor user
335370752.reviewBody: Great downtown with lots of history. Safe and friendly and lots of great stores. Marina area with sailfish statue and manicured gardens is pretty.

326008757.name: Waste fo time
326008757.author: a TripAdvisor user
326008757.reviewBody: Can go by taxi or bus.  Saw navy ships and container ports nearby.  Fishing boats were interesting but I didn\'t like the way they cleaned the dish caught.  Nothing to do there (i.e. shopping nor restaurants).  Hard to spend any money there.

325299880.name: El Centro Manzanillo, October 18, 2015
325299880.author: a TripAdvisor user
325299880.reviewBody: Arriving by cruise ship, right in the center of town (El Centro) there in front of you is the iconic blue sailfish sculpture which dominates the zocalo (town square).  There are some beautiful white arches, various small bronze sculptures, a gazebo, and fountains.

322751644.name: Love to visit El Centro and the harbor.
322751644.author: a TripAdvisor user
322751644.reviewBody: Reaching El Centro can be problematic with all the construction leading in, but it is a great place to visit. Love seeing the cruise ships in the harbour, shopping the small shops, the central market and visiting the Iguana Reserve.

319456627.name: Lots of shops, friendly locals
319456627.author: a TripAdvisor user
319456627.reviewBody: There are many shops with a variety of goods being sold everything from appliance stores selling washing machines to art and crafts made by locals to several shoe stores. The area was clean and also had several eating places including restaurants and fast food pizza and ice cream stores. The people were very friendly and it was pleasant to walk around, notice the different architecture, some narrow streets and everywhere felt very safe in the El Centro area.

312752843.name: Don\'t waste your time
312752843.author: a TripAdvisor user
312752843.reviewBody: Downtown Manzanillo or "El Centro" is in the heart of the sea port, there are a few restaurants and many shops, but it is noisy and dirty. When you combine the business traffic of the sea port with the tourist traffic, it makes for a unpleasant afternoon.\n\nThere is a market on Saturday afternoons in the center of Santiago, if you are looking to do some shopping, there are also some good restaurants near by, unless you like watching the ships pull into the harbor, stay away for El Centro.

312214443.name: Downtown Manzanillo
312214443.author: a TripAdvisor user
312214443.reviewBody: scenic with cruise ships and the shipping yards, has narrow streets with shopping and friendly people

308571388.name: Take your time and walk around.
308571388.author: a TripAdvisor user
308571388.reviewBody: Good area to walk around for shopping and having a meal. This is the area where the locals shop so venture around to shops away from the tourist shops.

300707245.name: Nothing to see here
300707245.author: a TripAdvisor user
300707245.reviewBody: Nothing worthwhile at all in the downtown area, little stores that sell low quality souvenirs and tshirts, no parking, lots of traffic. Really not worth the trouble.

287409980.name: A  PORT TOWN
287409980.author: a TripAdvisor user
287409980.reviewBody: Nice,clean Mexican port town a huge statue of a Sailfish, city government.\nA very nice pier for cruise ships that arrive frequently during the tourist season.

284257020.name: Great walk
284257020.author: a TripAdvisor user
284257020.reviewBody: A wonderful place to spend an afternoon wandering around.  Little shops, cafes to sit and watch the world pass you by.

274787853.name: Shopping!
274787853.author: a TripAdvisor user
274787853.reviewBody: Loved the shopping,and must stop Botanas Bar  called Bar Social.. live music,great drinks,and they bring you lots of Yummy food! This place has been there since 1952 very unique, excellent authentic place! Our favourite in El Centro!

263873422.name: fun to explore
263873422.author: a TripAdvisor user
263873422.reviewBody: went there to experience the local life; ate at several local taco stands, geletto and ate at the market.  friendly locals and safe

262891916.name: Surprisng
262891916.author: a TripAdvisor user
262891916.reviewBody: Found the city of Manzanillo very clean and very honest people. We were standing on the street corner and a young fellow asked us if we were OK.  Kind of surprised us but thought that was pretty cool!

259715884.name: Shop til you drop!!
259715884.author: a TripAdvisor user
259715884.reviewBody: This is the actual city of Manzanillo. Head straight down the first street from the Sailfish & let the Mexican handicrafts, Manzanillo t-shirts & souvenir shopping begin! Its shop after shop for at least 5 blocks, prices are so cheap that there is no need to haggle. Restaurants, & Hotel Colonial are located right in the middle of it all. Most shops close around 9 or 10 pm. Look up bc there are thousands of birds above you, perched on every wire, rod iron balcony etc. This is authentic Mexico! The ride to downtown Manzanillo, taxi is 10x faster bc bus stops about 50 x on its way from the tourist area, either way, you past Manzanillos biggest port & its quite impressive!! Definitely make a trip to El Centro!!

257568206.name: Just a blue fish, not much else
257568206.author: a TripAdvisor user
257568206.reviewBody: not much to see here, just the big blue fish statue, not even many shops or markets to check out. We stopped here as part of a half day trip but expected this to be the highlight, was disappointing.

254930144.name: Manzanillo is a beautiful hidden Gem for Tourists
254930144.author: a TripAdvisor user
254930144.reviewBody: This is an amazing city with amazing people.   I think the dislike is more on the travellers reviews.  Remember you are in an older part of Mexico you are not getting New York city 5* resort, but you will get a great vacation in a wonderful city

247847728.name: Real Culture
247847728.author: a TripAdvisor user
247847728.reviewBody: We visit the market several times to purchase fresh fruits and fresh juice. El Centro (jardin area) has many tourist shops as well as the experience of the bay area.

245834373.name: Worth a trip
245834373.author: a TripAdvisor user
245834373.reviewBody: You can\'t miss the City Centre. It has the large blue sailfish sculpture with a park with some oddly decorative trees. The town plaza has a variety of tourist shops and restaurants besides the usual government buildings. We only stopped for a drink so can\'t comment on the food. The church is up the hill and worth a stop (its modern) and the main road has a variety of shops and banks if you need money. \nOne gem was Educal, a state sponsored bookstore. They were very attentive and the selection was very decent. And many of the books had discounts.

242587687.name: Old town Mexico
242587687.author: a TripAdvisor user
242587687.reviewBody: Very typical of Central American shops.  Streets are really quite clean.  Some modernization and street improvements have been made over the years however you still get the smaller town feel.  Vendors are great and not pushy.  The mercado is multi level with partking on top.  Lots of fresh produce and meats.  Great buys.

241903594.name: Manzanillo Centro, woth the visit
241903594.author: a TripAdvisor user
241903594.reviewBody:
There aren't a lot of tourist hotels if any in the downtown core of Manzanillo. 

If you do visit you will find a busy main avenida with many stores with prices much lower than you will find in Plaza Manzanillo or other big stores along the main boulevard in  the Salagua / Las  Hadas areas where most of the tourists stay. 

Travel time from the main shopping area along Boulevard Miguel de La Madrid to centro is about twenty minutes by car or 40 minutes mas o menos on a city bus. The Number 1 bus will take you there and bring you back easily.

The downtown malecon and harbor area are great for walking or sitting on one of the many benches available.

237915595.name: You might be disappointed
237915595.author: a TripAdvisor user
237915595.reviewBody: I spend the winters here.  I get lots of visitors.  They all want to go to centro historico.  About 5 years ago, I started saying no.  I send them on their own.  There is very little for tourists.  I DO like going to the mercado.  It is a bit hard to find, but is a typical Mexican mercado.  Other than the market, nada!

214093303.name: Cool to see El Centro Manzanillo
214093303.author: a TripAdvisor user
214093303.reviewBody: The sculpture is massive, and it\'s in a very pretty setting by the harbour.  There is some good souvenier shopping just across the street.  Then we kept walking on the streets farther back and got into a very traditional Mexican neighborhood.  We came to the Central Market and that was really cool to watch the vendors preparing fish to sell right out on the sidewalk, and inside the market with all the fresh vegetables.  There is not much English spoken in these parts, but it\'s still fun to experience the everyday lives of the Mexican people.

213394486.name: Swordfish
213394486.author: a TripAdvisor user
213394486.reviewBody: Stopped here for about half an hour as part of a bus tour of Manzanillo. I was great to see a part of the city that represents an integral part of the region tourist draw - swordfishing. We didn\'t go into any of the buildings, simply walked around the statue and enjoyed the place.

199335965.name: Typical \'el centro\'
199335965.author: a TripAdvisor user
199335965.reviewBody: There are a couple of nice restaurants on the board walk, other than that, not much to see or do.  Didn\'t like the meat/fish market; it was large and unappealing with all the \'faces\' staring at you.  Animal and fish faces, I mean.

192951176.name: El Centro
192951176.author: a TripAdvisor user
192951176.reviewBody: Yes like so many other contributors, I was a little disappointed!\nThe shops are quite touristy - and also hike the prices when the cruise ships arrive!\nThe market was very interesting - particularly watching the fish sellers filleting  their wares, beware of those knives!

150455043.name: Nice to visit and stretch your legs
150455043.author: a TripAdvisor user
150455043.reviewBody: Great place.. lots to do.. lots of local people watching.  Everyone is friendly and helpfull.  Great little shops, lots of local color.  Only bad part is the parking.  Take a taxi or the bus

148737294.name: Shopping
148737294.author: a TripAdvisor user
148737294.reviewBody: Not as much English speaking people here, so we had a bit more trouble with the language barrier, but still everyone very friendly.  It was a rainy day, so we took our time walking about.  Very nice.  Took the bus there and back, super easy to navigate!

131445061.name: A must do
131445061.author: a TripAdvisor user
131445061.reviewBody: We shopped several hours in el centro. Too many shops to choose from and overall good prices. The only drawback was limited parking spots (we drove rental car) and the big Pena Nieto vote buying semi carnival/fair that was taking place at the main plaza on June 2 & 3.

129822471.name: Downtown Manzanillo - great place to visit
129822471.author: a TripAdvisor user
129822471.reviewBody: The downtown Manzanillo (about 20 min. drive from Las Hadas) is a great and safe place to check out.  If you have younger kids the main plaza always has some kind of activity for them and their parents to participate.

126751071.name: Overrated
126751071.author: a TripAdvisor user
126751071.reviewBody: strictly shopping in very small stores for the most part and only a couple of resaurants that we found. Don\'t waste your time

126076548.name: Fun!
126076548.author: a TripAdvisor user
126076548.reviewBody: El Centro De Manzanillo Has Many Places To Go Eat, Shop, Dance, Etc. Fun Place To Hang Out Before 10 p.m.

125471422.name: Better than average downtown in mexico
125471422.author: a TripAdvisor user
125471422.reviewBody: Every time we go to Manzanillo, we go downtown Centro a couple of times. They have fixed up their waterfront and have a huge blue Marlin, quite a few statues, etc there. They have banos which is good. There is a good cruise ship down there. There is the Centro Historical and the Newer Centro. There are numerous stores of all kinds, numerous restaurants and bars. The buses run from anywhere in Manzanilla and Santiago to downtown every few minutes and costs 6 pesos each. The navy base is downtown also. the people are friendly and in a lot of stores you can get the price of goods down. No visit to Manzanillo should include a trip to Centro

123606316.name: Take the time to enjoy Mexico and visit the market
123606316.author: a TripAdvisor user
123606316.reviewBody:
Do yourself a favor and visit the market around 8:30 in the moring.  The market is about 4 or 5 blocks away from the main square.
You can buy enough shrimp and dorado to feed 6 for less than 200 pesos. We picked up a 1/2 kilo of shrimp (about 2 large fist fulls) some scallops and nice chunk of dorado butterfled just right-------cut up a couple bulbs of garlic, fry all in butter.
Don't forget the fresh tortillas and hot sauce avaliable right across the street.  Make your own salsa and add some fried up onions, zucinnis and cervaza with lime and you have a piece of heaven.
Skip sorianos and commericial and shop local with the locals.  You'll find no fresher produce or fish/meat/chicken.

123500228.name: Romantic Walks
123500228.author: a TripAdvisor user
123500228.reviewBody: The Manzanillo city center "Centro" it\'s nice to visit during the later part of the day when it\'s not so hot, there are restaurants, a lot of souvenir shops, it\'s nice to stroll around and take in the scenery.

122694032.name: downtown
122694032.author: a TripAdvisor user
122694032.reviewBody: dirty!!!  nothing really there for travellers to do other than market and see harbour.

121744901.name: Took the bus
121744901.author: a TripAdvisor user
121744901.reviewBody: For 6 pesos or .60 cents you can ride the bus into town, just flag one down and enjoy about a 45 minute ride. Had no idea that Manzanillo was a high port zone for ships ( cargo) very interesting.

120665640.name: Real Mexico
120665640.author: a TripAdvisor user
120665640.reviewBody: You are greeted downtown by the statue of a large sailfish.  Within a few blocks of this you will see stores that offer the typical "tourist" stuff.  A few blocks more and you get in to the areas where the locals shop.  Some unique treasures to be found in a lot of those stores.  Also some pretty neat cliff-side homes to see.

102489182.name: "Downtown" Manzanillo: a Pleasant Mexican Ambience
102489182.author: a TripAdvisor user
102489182.reviewBody:
Mexico's busiest port, home to the Mexican Navy's Pacific naval fleet, and yet downtown Manzanillo (El Centro) has the pleasant atmosphere of a small seaside town and provides a relaxing and interesting way to spend a day that is authentically Mexican.  Tourists from the hotel area can take a 6-peso bus ride on an El Centro-marked  bus from the "Commercial" big box neighbourhood (Walmart, Home Depot and the supers)  and get off at the last stop, a short distance from the enormous sailfish sculpture on the seafront.

. A walk along the esplanade (Malecon de Cabotaje) affords views of naval ships, fishing boats and small yachts. Bronze statues of sailors are moving testaments to the "men who go down to the sea in ships."  Across from the seaside park is Juarez Avenue running parallel to the sea.  On the corner of Juarez and Madera you should be able to obtain a clear city map , and upstairs in the City Hall (Presidencia Municipal) there are free, clean toilets ( Bring your own toilet paper and hand sanitizer!)  Further along on Juarez is a small city museum.  However, with pesos burning holes in your pocket, the shopping opportunities on Juarez might draw you west again.  It is advisable to window shop and get an idea of what is available and of prices before you turn left on to Avenida Mexico, the main drag, also with very tempting stores and inexpensive internet offices, and head toward the central market ( El mercado central) down Calle Cuauhtemoc from Avenida Mexico.

This recently built market sells everything from fresh seafood to mysterious herbs to plastic toys and clothes for the most modest budget.  The market has two levels and upstairs are small cafes with real Mexican food at real Mexican, not tourist, prices.  The toilets ( sanitorios) are on the main floor and cost 3 pesos---including toilet paper.

By now you may be feeling like having a beer or a meal in a quieter place than the market, so retrace your steps along Avenida Mexico toward the port and on your left you will see the 1940's Hotel Colonial, which is well worth a visit for its traditional architecture alone. You might be able to find there a 3-course meal ( menu del dia) a bargain at 75 pesos.  The hotel's  Los Candiles restaurant, with its cool courtyard and view of the goings on in the main street is popular with local Mexican businessmen and families. The restaurant's  restrooms are a clean place to freshen up before continuing with your day in town.

The downtown souvenir stores and boutiques do not close at midday, so you can do some leisurely shopping or more exploring in the interesting hillside stairs of the sidestreets of the port.

If you work up a thirst, the vintage 1940's Bar Social near the corner of Juarez and Marzo is the Manzanillo watering hole you should visit. Or maybe the charm of downtown Manzanillo will bring you back for another day's exploring and dining.

456744840.name: The Walmart Beach
456744840.author: a TripAdvisor user
456744840.reviewBody: This beach is long,good for walking, waves much stronger use caution, see lots of cargo ships in port, shopping access easy from side road to Walmart on and off beach, lots of locals fish here and play on the  beach by a handful of smaller Mexican condo accommodations. Playa Miramar is much nicer beach but need taxi to get to the shopping and restaurants by this beach.

322794696.name: Gorgeous but very difficult to get too
322794696.author: a TripAdvisor user
322794696.reviewBody: This is roughly 12 miles up the mountain (so we were told by the staff working there) and the road is horrendous.  4x4 is the only option!  People driving by offered us a ride for about 10 of the 12 miles (in the back of their truck) where we walked the last 2 miles.  Sounds easy enough except the air is very thin and the inclines were roughly 10 degrees and at times were likely double that.  View was phenomenal once we finally got there.  We were at the station at the top that isn\'t supposed to be open to the public but they were extremely gracious.  One of the guys offered to give us a ride back down and so we got in the back of his truck and down we went.  I took less of a beating playing on the offensive line for semi-pro!   Left Guadalajara at 6AM, spent about 90 minutes at the top, worked our way back down, spent a hour for a late lunch, and got back just before 6PM.  Best word of advise, TAKE A GUIDE like we did.

280442837.name: Worth seeing, but NOT close to Manzanillo
280442837.author: a TripAdvisor user
280442837.reviewBody: This is a wonderful National Park, but it\'s NOT near Manzanillo, and it\'s not even in the same state (Colima). This volcano is in the southern part of Jalisco, and is easier and closer to visit if you\'ll be in Ciudad Guzm\u00e1n, the city of Colima, or even in Guadalajara. You can drive to the park, but it\'s a steep, rough road, and not advisable when it\'s been raining. When you get to the park, you\'ll have to pay 30 pesos per person over the age of 6 (about $2 US per person). Inside, there\'s a place to park, some bathrooms, and some covered picnic areas. From there, you can hike further to the top where the antennas are. If you\'re not used to elevation, be aware that the picnic area is over 3400m (11,200ft), so it\'s easy to get elevation sickness. It\'s cold when it\'s cloudy, so bring layers. If you have the time to drive up and back down (about an hour each way), it\'s worth it!

273067807.name: When the volcano is erupting,
273067807.author: a TripAdvisor user
273067807.reviewBody: Very cool place for Mexico,  a small taste of snow and cold! but very cool when the Volcano next door is erupting!

267446631.name: such a great tour, full day but worth it!
267446631.author: a TripAdvisor user
267446631.reviewBody: Colima! such a wonderful place, tour, people, and foood was great where our guide David took us. Loved every minute of the day.

262892300.name: Very Interesting
262892300.author: a TripAdvisor user
262892300.reviewBody: Found the roads quite well maintained.  We had a very good tour guide who gave us a good history lesson.  Had a taste of authentic Mexican food which was very good and very good beer!  These people are very proud of their country as they should be.

220977272.name: Adventure light !
220977272.author: a TripAdvisor user
220977272.reviewBody:
We stays at the Nevada de Colima campground for three nights to walk to the top. The walk is very easy and seems more like a dirt track than a real hiking track. It's not very difficult to walk up there so it is even for small kids accessible and enjoyable. Maybe some persons will have difficulties due to the height but it's not steep at all. At the top there are the antennas for the cellular phone but you have an incredible look to the volcano which is close by. You should look at the weather foresight before you go there because It can be cloudy and than you do not see anything. 
In the campground you have to bring everything, it's just a place without any infrastructure. If you choose smart the place for your tent, you will have 5 min walking distance from the campground to the toilets, but in the night this can be quite a challenge. Be sure to bring some lamps for the night.

198345669.name: A great sight to see.
198345669.author: a TripAdvisor user
198345669.reviewBody: This should definitely be on your \'to see\' list. Beautiful and interesting sight to see. There are \'twin\' volcanos... one dormant, the other active. There are some small restaurants in the area and some have excellent views of the volcano.

193121836.name: Incredible Hiking Destination but careful with the drops
193121836.author: a TripAdvisor user
193121836.reviewBody: This is a great place for an eco adventure, but as all adventures you must be careful and prepare. \nTHere are places where you can fall to the bottom and be really sorry you werent paying attention.

192030235.name: Colima and Comala Day Trip
192030235.author: a TripAdvisor user
192030235.reviewBody:
If you are really going hoping to see the volcano, you'll be disappointed.  They seem to use the volcano as a selling feature for the tour, but you'll only get to see it in the distance from the window on the bus -- IF you are seated on the proper side of the bus!  Also, the trip from Manzanillo to Colima is about an hour each way and the bathroom on our bus was out of order!  That is completely unacceptable!  Also, eat breakfast before you go!  You don't get any food or beverages until around 2:30 in the afternoon!  Luckily for me I know this ahead of time thanks to fellow Trip Advisor members!  I couldn't understand our tour guide's explanations of the things we were looking at, but he did try his best and was friendly.

It's a little boring, but it is a nice way to do something safe away from the resort.  There is time for shopping at both Colima and Comala so that is nice.  The best part of this tour is the lunch!  We ate at a traditional Mexican restaurant in Comala and the food was DELICIOUS!  They brought us FOUR different platters at different times to sample.

In Comala there are steep streets to walk up so if you have bad knees or poor mobility than this is NOT the tour for you.  If you like museums and gardening sites and can get around well than this is the day trip for you!

156448919.name: Tour of Colima and Comala
156448919.author: a TripAdvisor user
156448919.reviewBody: Saw the ruins in Colima.  Very interesting and look forward to seeing how much more they uncover in future years.  Did a Hacienda tour in Comala, beautiful ceramics and pottery and wonderful paintings.  Lunch in Comala in the town square.  Very pretty with all it\'s white buildings.  Drove the Magic Zone...impressed the kids with our ability to go back up a hill while the car was in neutral.  Great to see all the plantations of all the many fruit that Colima produces.  Also got to see the salt flats and how bricks are made.  Great trip.

152975180.name: Visit by car and walk
152975180.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975180.reviewBody: Drive thru some agricultural area, bananas & manguous plantation, city of Colima, took a lunch near the centro.  Not enough time to visit the active volcano...

148736988.name: City tour of Colima
148736988.author: a TripAdvisor user
148736988.reviewBody: It was a lot of time in the van, but scenery was beautiful.  Food was fantasit.  Tour guide very good!

147026807.name: Colima City Tour
147026807.author: a TripAdvisor user
147026807.reviewBody: Saw the old Haciendas that were changed into usable buildings - some government offices, Was neat to see the huge old buildings from the days of the Spaniards. Did some shopping. Toured to Colama also

133886319.name: Loved Colima
133886319.author: a TripAdvisor user
133886319.reviewBody: We liked everything - we rented a car for a few days and did a lot of sightseeing/visiting many attractions on daily trips.  Driving is very safe and a great way to explore the area.

130826354.name: Solo summit
130826354.author: a TripAdvisor user
130826354.reviewBody: I dont have a car but you can drive all the way up to the park entrance from Ciudad Guzman. From the park entrance you hike 3 hours to the summit. The whole hike you see the north summit which is lower. I took the bus from Guzman to El Fresnito which has shops. From the crossroad before entering the village I walked the 16 km to the park entrance. It took me about 5 hours. Another trail called los tubos de agua goes from the end of fresnito steep up through the forest which is nice lush but it is steeper and you might reach the park in 3-4 hours. A bit beyond the entrance there are cabins, a bit hidden left of the road with some buildings. A bed in a dorm is 187 pesos. I was the only guest. There is no resto                 nor shop so bring your own food. The road from the cabins goes to the antennas but take the shortcuts indicated with pink fluo paper up to the rim from where you\'ll see volcan de fuego for the first time. From the rim you will go up behind the arete to the summit, an easy scramble. The north summit is more of a rock climb. I would recommend descending the same way.

129754428.name: Spectacular views all the way up!
129754428.author: a TripAdvisor user
129754428.reviewBody:
I too visited the Nevado de Colima with Jupiter Rivera of Admire Mexico Tours. I probably could have gone on my own as I was living a couple of hours away at the time but I wasn't that sure that the brakes on my then 15 year-old Jeep Sahara would suffice for the return trip. We spent the night in Comala to get an early start and drove out to the Nevado de Colima National Park early in the morning. Once off of the highway we immediately began to climb and the drive up through the forest of pine and robles was beautiful. Here and there as we climbed the forest opened up to great vistas. Something I found very interesting on the trip up were the different layers of soil visible in the banks along the road. We could actually see by the different colours and textures of the layers how they had been laid, one on top of another, when the mountain was formed. 

Arriving at the parking lot at the top of the road that is accessible to the public we noted that it was starting to cloud over. No matter, we were the only people there which was nice and we set off for the observation centre and then the summit of the Nevado on foot. As we walked up the dirt road through the pine forest I could feel the lack of oxygen in my lungs - we were at almost 4000 meters at that point and reached 4000 meters at the observation centre. Jupiter had us all take it easy though and we all made it to the top in good form, no problems with exhaustion or sickness due to the altitude. 

Unfortunately when we reached the observation point where the University of Colima have their station to monitor the Volcán de Fuego - the active volcano - the cloud and mist had us completely socked in and we couldn't see much more than about 10 feet in front of us. It was chilly up there, and rather eerie, with a fairly strong breeze blowing the cloud and mist around so things kept appearing and then disappearing. So with no view of the  Volcán de Fuego we made our way back down through the swirling mist and cloud to the vehicle in the parking lot. Even though we didn't get to see the Volcán de Fuego the trip was well worth it for me. A great outing in a pristine environment.

126517718.name: Very scenic, panoramic view
126517718.author: a TripAdvisor user
126517718.reviewBody: We went with the assistance of tour guide Jupiter Rivera of Admire Tours (highly recommended). This is a difficult hike due to it\'s elevation of 4365 meters (14,320 feet), the trails starts at 3200 meters. Pace yourself and take many breaks.

123499807.name: GREAT FOR HICKING
123499807.author: a TripAdvisor user
123499807.reviewBody: This used to be an active volcano but now during the months of December it\'s really cold and it even gets some snow on the mountain it is great place for hicking and watching nature. It is about a four hour drive from Manzanillo.

15093676.name: Two Volcanos in the state of Colima
15093676.author: a TripAdvisor user
15093676.reviewBody: The snow capped volcano is dormant.  It is pretty, but not worth the 2 hour trip from Manzanillo.

643427558.name: Great beach for visiting the ramadas, people watching and enjoying the water
643427558.author: a TripAdvisor user
643427558.reviewBody:
La Boquita is where many Mexican families go to enjoy family time, play in the water and eat and drink. The waves are much smaller at this beach and the water is great to swim in. There is a sunken ship not too far out that you can swim, snorkel or kayak to. The beach has many ramadas where you can eat and drink. 

Beach umbrellas are available for rental, or you can bring your own.

If you take a vehicle, you don't have to pay for parking in the lots as there is no charge for parking along the beach at the far end.

572982795.name: Nice beach, easy snorkel to the sunken ship
572982795.author: a TripAdvisor user
572982795.reviewBody:
We were here during Holy Week, so by noon the beach was really crowded. However, snorkeling the sunken ship was fun, quite a lot of fish there. Swimming out to it was quite low visibility, but still worth the effort. It's maybe a 10 minute swim from the beach. 

There are numerous restaurants here and we had lunch at Tanilos, a recommendation of the cab driver that took us to the beach, it was excellent. Good ceviche, ice cold beers.

The sand at the beach is great, the vendors can be loud and obnoxious, but somewhat entertaining too. If you don't like crowds, avoid Holy Week!

569128079.name: Authentic Mexican Beach, Safe for Swimming and Good Food
569128079.author: a TripAdvisor user
569128079.reviewBody: This is an authentic Mexican beach experience. You can rent a palapa with chairs for about 180 pesos (11 USD). It is just minutes outside of Manzanillo. Don\'t get scammed into paying for parking when you drive in. The parking on the beach itself is free, although the palapas are not. Stay away from the rocky areas of the beach (on the righ hand side, and for many meters towards the center of the beach). The rocks are painful on the feet and some have urchins. But there is an area in the middle with no rocks and the water is warm and pleasant to swim. Lots of great food and beach vendors selling fruit and oysters, enjoy it!

552279402.name: Good snorkelling, an authentic Mexican beach experience.
552279402.author: a TripAdvisor user
552279402.reviewBody: The beach gets very crowded on holidays, but is beautiful, with warm shallow water. There are rocks and good snorkelling at the Western end and at the shipwreck out in the harbour. There are lots of sea urchins in the rocks at the Western end and it is shallow in places so be careful, but also lots of beautiful fish, eels, and a little coral.  There\'s a boat that will take you out to the shipwreck, but its only a few hundred metres offshore and is a 10-minute swim.\nRent an umbrella (MXN$180 for the day) and order food from the local umbrella person - remember to ask for your bathroom pass when you rent the umbrella :-) There\'s also lots of beach vendors with good food (we had oysters and clams!) and some higher end restaurants further down the beach towards Santiago.

665782764.name: Nice walking area
665782764.author: a TripAdvisor user
665782764.reviewBody: This is a nice walking area along the bay. There are several park like areas with benches. There are a numbers of statues which make for great photo ops. This area overlooked the marina with is picturesque and that is not counting all of the flowers.\nThere are also shops and places to get something to eat along the walkway.

664325517.name: A lovely place to chill
664325517.author: a TripAdvisor user
664325517.reviewBody: The Malecon is highlighted by the huge statue of a sailfish, or is it a marlin?  It\'s a bit fanciful, so it\'s not clear which it is.  The walkway is well-maintained and there are benches to just relax and look at the harbor.  Grass and trees complete the scene.

646404472.name: Ice Rink on Malecon was huge Surprise for Canadians
646404472.author: a TripAdvisor user
646404472.reviewBody:
We visited the ice rink complex that the State Government has contracted to place in Manzanillo Centro over the holiday season. We were delighted to see some of the reported 135,000+ visitors during the 3 week period. Spanish folks were intrigued, kids excited and the atmosphere was electric, day and night.
Businesses benefitted greatly with the influx of public to this area and restaurants and clothes and souvenir shops were extremely busy each of our visits.
Congratulations to State Government and Governor Peralta for this wonderful public attraction!!
We enjoyed a great time mingling and visiting shops and a great meal!!

632355560.name: Port Walkway
632355560.author: a TripAdvisor user
632355560.reviewBody: Short, and noticeable kept clean, this is the first steps you take when arriving by cruise ship.  The statues are a nice touch for photo opps, but not a feature or destination worthy.

580499381.name: Pretty but....
580499381.author: a TripAdvisor user
580499381.reviewBody: The Malecon (boardwalk) is pretty and clean and uncrowded with great views of the lovely bay and the colossal blue sailfish, but it doesn\'t have nearly as much to do as Puerto Vallarta, unless you turn inland and walk across the street and around the old El Centro area of town where there are shops and restaurants. It\'s so untouristy that I had to search a bit for postcards.  We enjoyed the area, but don\'t expect a long boardwalk with a lot of seaside cafes like you find in PV.

573467459.name: Quaint surroundings
573467459.author: a TripAdvisor user
573467459.reviewBody: Small shops and restaurants, inviting and nice local people; the park is clean & weather perfect for walking with fresh produce to snack on

567706292.name: Interesting statues along the short walkway
567706292.author: a TripAdvisor user
567706292.reviewBody: The huge marlin statue represents the city of Manzanillo and is a great photo op. There are lots of statues by Mexican artists along the walkway and it is worth seeing.

561828596.name: First trip to Manzanillo was a great experience.
561828596.author: a TripAdvisor user
561828596.reviewBody: We hired a driver to show us the Manzanillo area and were glad we did it. He showed us many places that regular tours don\'t take tourists. Seeing the area this way really shows how the residents live. The Malecon area was very quiet while we walked through it. Walking along the market area was very hot and crowded but was still enjoyable. It is hard to imagine just how big the sailfish is until you try to take a picture of someone standing beside it! The thing is huge!

556409375.name: Photo opportunities
556409375.author: a TripAdvisor user
556409375.reviewBody: Not much to do or see here...just photo taking.  There are some shops to explore and check out the habour area.

479551135.name: nice statue
479551135.author: a TripAdvisor user
479551135.reviewBody: The park area at the Malecon is lovely.  Some good shopping and restaurants. We found clean bathrooms on the second floor of the Municipal building.  very important on a walking tour. \n

469509374.name: Worth a quick stroll
469509374.author: a TripAdvisor user
469509374.reviewBody: Nice water views and worth a quick stroll around. But, aside from some small eateries and souvenir shops, there\'s really not that much to see. The area is neat and clean and the sword fish sculpture is a nice photo opt. \n\nWe strolled up a side street and found a local market with a wonderful selection of local tequilas which was very reasonably priced compared to other port stops. So, for us it was worth the stroll into town.

468658883.name: Interesting to See
468658883.author: a TripAdvisor user
468658883.reviewBody: Very historical, old town. Nice to cruise through, enjoy the malecon & drive by the huge port. Many shops & market stores along with several restaurants to stop for lunch. But after seeing it once, no need to return.

467101037.name: Sadly the place needs to renovate
467101037.author: a TripAdvisor user
467101037.reviewBody: Being the old side of Manzanillo it could grow significantly if it had a touch up, here you can find several events (do check before heading out there), the only book store in town (as far as I know), some souvenir shops (with the cliche mexican stuff) and if you like fabrics you can find some stores with a variety of different materials and some craft products as well. I have no experience eating there (to be sincere it didn\'t really look appealing) but I do admit that the scenery is lovely, you get a good glimpse of the port and the ships and great photo opportunities

459888656.name: Sightseeing downtown
459888656.author: a TripAdvisor user
459888656.reviewBody: Great views of the harbor and navy base.  There is a large park, some trees and statuary to see.  Ofter the city hosts live performances.  There\'ll be carnival entertainment this coming week.  There was Valentine\'s today.

454530921.name: Great for photo ops
454530921.author: a TripAdvisor user
454530921.reviewBody: The iconic towering blue sailfish statue can\'t be missed. There\'s also a colorful Manzanillo sign that\'s perfect for pictures with the bay in the back ground.

453430871.name: Nice walk. Fresh at night!
453430871.author: a TripAdvisor user
453430871.reviewBody: Is not crowded as other \'Malecones\' in M\u00e9xico. But if you had a hot day at the beach, this is a good option for a refreshing evening walk, just to hear the sea at night.

450028644.name: Nice and clean city
450028644.author: a TripAdvisor user
450028644.reviewBody: We took a cab and for 2 hours we visit the downtown, Manzanillo Malecon and the best interested points of Manzanillo. Very big port and quite city.

445937534.name: Pretty nice, safe and good shopping
445937534.author: a TripAdvisor user
445937534.reviewBody: Walked around and bought a few little things. Good selection. They have a nice huge fabric store, which you don\'t see much any more. Restaurants looked interesting but did not get a chance to try. Manzanillo is a work in progress, I hope they get there.

441441524.name: Cement centre
441441524.author: a TripAdvisor user
441441524.reviewBody: The centre has changed dramatically over the last 28 years.  When we lived here it was beautiful and friendly and welcoming.  It has become very much a port and is not very appealing or welcoming anymore so sad to say.

433481690.name: very seventies boardwalk full of life
433481690.author: a TripAdvisor user
433481690.reviewBody: A very seventies boardwalk full of life nice for an evening stroll. Views over the harbour zone, a very big port actually

420823085.name: Downtown
420823085.author: a TripAdvisor user
420823085.reviewBody: Great area to watch people, take in some shopping, restaurants, great places to walk to see fishing boats, large ships and the navy .

399599920.name: Fun place to sightsee and catch a bite.
399599920.author: a TripAdvisor user
399599920.reviewBody: Old world charm many monuments and beautiful strolling along the waterfront. Great place to charter a bill fishing tour.

365277316.name: Port without activity
365277316.author: a TripAdvisor user
365277316.reviewBody: The Sailfish brought us to area, but no activities were scheduled on  a Saturday afternoon. No shopping a few historic photos, but no outstanding architecture.  No hotels or restaurants in area.

353947119.name: Downtown Manzanillo
353947119.author: a TripAdvisor user
353947119.reviewBody: Spent an afternoon downtown, had a great day of shopping.  Lots of stores and places to eat, had some delicious pizza.

353202297.name: Nice Day trip
353202297.author: a TripAdvisor user
353202297.reviewBody: Checking out the town, was a nice cab ride to downtown.  The area was clean and the people were very friendly.  Was nice to get away from the resort and check things out.  The port area was amazing never thought it would be a large and busy.

346713448.name: Downtown Manzanillo
346713448.author: a TripAdvisor user
346713448.reviewBody: As we were on a city tour we did not have much time to actually walk around the down town area.  There were plenty of shops to look through.  We did enjoy what we saw.  picked up a couple of gifts.

341168363.name: Short Seaside Walk in Working Port City
341168363.author: a TripAdvisor user
341168363.reviewBody: The Malecon area in Manzanillo is not a "touristy" as others that one finds in Puerto Vallarta, Mazatlan, etc.   This is a working port and it shows.   But the huge sailfish statue and nearby plaza do offer some appeal for a stroll.

339261156.name: Nice place to shop
339261156.author: a TripAdvisor user
339261156.reviewBody: Friendly locals. Good prices. Touristy but not crowded. Easy off and on from cruise ship. Weather in December is perfect.

336848295.name: feed the birds
336848295.author: a TripAdvisor user
336848295.reviewBody: It was cool to do and see.  The best part was feeding the birds.  It was hilarious.  Throw some crushed up crackers on the ground and you will have a thousand birds at your feet.

319452072.name: Picturesque and clean
319452072.author: a TripAdvisor user
319452072.reviewBody: This is a lovely area to walk around, see the statues and ships in harbour. It was very clean and we felt safe. Great place to get some exercise, enjoy a relaxing time and learn about this part of Manzanillo. People were very friendly. It had the biggest Mexican flag and the huge blue fish statue.

318608570.name: Fun Shops
318608570.author: a TripAdvisor user
318608570.reviewBody: We did some shopping and walked around the area. There is lots of little stores and different little restaurants.\nIt felt very safe.

299290769.name: Seeing the Pez Vela statue is a must do
299290769.author: a TripAdvisor user
299290769.reviewBody: The blue "Sail Fish" statue is huge and represents the fact that Manzanillo is one of the best area for deep sea fishing. Along the malecon (seaside sidewalk) there are many beautiful and interesting statues.

259714282.name: Sailfish Capital!!
259714282.author: a TripAdvisor user
259714282.reviewBody: The malecon is a nice spot to take a walk outside of the tourist area. Seeing the enormous statue of the sailfish is a MUST while in Manzanillo bc it is sailfish capital of the world. Plus, a completely different view of the bay than what you see in the tourist district & you pass Mexico\'s biggest port along the way which is something to see & very impressive!

259680356.name: OK there are sooo many maldecons
259680356.author: a TripAdvisor user
259680356.reviewBody: Zihuatenjo has a great, quiet, maldecon with beautiful bronzes of the women whe created the culture.  \nManzanillo\'s maldecon reflects it\'s history from a pirate stop to the bustling port it\'s today.\nPV has a busy maldecon, touristas and Mexicanos vacationing, go while a footbal final is on, what a rush.

256998810.name: So much to sees and so little time
256998810.author: a TripAdvisor user
256998810.reviewBody: The Malecon loops around to the lagoon side of the bar.  The restaurants and bars are all good; it would be hard to pick a favorite. There is music somewhere every night.  The streets are clean a well-lit, even if the parking is farther away.  A little Spanish helps, but there is always someone who peaks English.

245499195.name: scenic walk
245499195.author: a TripAdvisor user
245499195.reviewBody: small but enjoyable. Lots of little shops to buy souvenir. lovely wam water. A few navy boats to look at. This is a good place to people watch have lunch and relax. You can watch the way of life from the locals as they go about their business and are all very friendly and happy to talk with you. A nice romantic stroll in the evening , watching a sunset, beautiful

214410267.name: Small but good for a stroll and souvenir shopping
214410267.author: a TripAdvisor user
214410267.reviewBody: It\'s a small malecon but with a couple of cool looking ships. It\'s right downtown and there are several souvenir shops in the area.

147217010.name: A great place to sit back and soak up the life
147217010.author: a TripAdvisor user
147217010.reviewBody: This is in the heart of downtown, there are bands playing all day and most of the evening, the navy base is right next door so you may see some unque ships close up, There is a beautiful walkway along the water where you can see locals fishing for dinner. there are alot of street vendors but all of them are polite and not pushy at all. get yourself a drink, grab a bench in the shade, and spend some time here just relaxing and absorbing mexican culture

146967315.name: Full of mexican charm
146967315.author: a TripAdvisor user
146967315.reviewBody: Quaint and charming, next to fishing boats and coast guard it offers beautiful sites, great food and relaxation.

137407035.name: Easy place to people watch
137407035.author: a TripAdvisor user
137407035.reviewBody: Not much else to do. Nothing like Pier 39 in S.F. A few shops that sell tourist trinkets, a few dining establishments, the city hall. Not even much action in the harbor (i.e. boats) to look at. Save to walk down. Might be fun on an evening when events are planned (i.e. street faire).

129943801.name: BEAUTIFUL BEACHWALK
129943801.author: a TripAdvisor user
129943801.reviewBody: See local monuments along the way. There "mangos on a stick" available. Great swimming on the bay, with Umbrellas, or surfing on the ocean side HUGE WAVES!

129776036.name: Attractive waterfront walk for cruisers
129776036.author: a TripAdvisor user
129776036.reviewBody: During our Mexican Riviera cruise on Carnival Spirit we stopped in Manzanillo.  Since we didn\'t have any excursions booked our plan was to walk along the Malecon and go into town for lunch and souvenir shopping.  There hadn\'t been many reviews of the malecon so we were pleasantly surprised by the nice quiet walk along the very clean waterfront.\n\nYour first impression is taken from the massive marlin sculpture next to the cruise ship terminal and located just outside the main portion of downtown.  Our second positive impression came when we were not hammered by local vendors or kids or adults trying to sell us souvenirs.  This made our walk and later souvenir shopping a very pleasant experience.  There are plenty of local cafes near the malecon with good fish tacos and local beer.  The walk from the main square to the marina is not far and gave us plenty to do during our cruise ship stop.

127556100.name: check out the local marina
127556100.author: a TripAdvisor user
127556100.reviewBody: I do a lot of fishing so I like to walk along the malecon.  Try to time a walk to be at the local marina, the terra cotta 2 story building right by the train tracks.  the local charters come in around noon and you can take a look at the days catch and charter a boat.\nlots of locals fishing.  \ncan be a little sunny during the heat of the day.

127096597.name: Hot day for a stroll along the Malecon but still was interesting.
127096597.author: a TripAdvisor user
127096597.reviewBody: There wasn\'t much shade along the water front unless you moved to the store fronts.

125471551.name: Downtown Manzanillo Malecon
125471551.author: a TripAdvisor user
125471551.reviewBody: Manzanillo have fixed up their downtown on the ocean and have a very long malecon along the ocean front and it is in very good shape. You can walk along it and see the navy base, the general ocean front, the cruise dock and the area where all the small fishermen have their boats. An interesting walk

123974675.name: NEW MALECON IN PV IS GREAT
123974675.author: a TripAdvisor user
123974675.reviewBody: They did great job rebuilding the malecon. They have bikes built for two and free strollers to rent. The traffic has been closed off and the new walk way along the beach is well used. The pole flyers are back. At nite the mimes are great to watch and theres lots of food after 7 pm

586758018.name: Fun experience!
586758018.author: a TripAdvisor user
586758018.reviewBody: Took my teenage daughter to zip line for her first time.  This was a great experience for both of us.  They were nice enough to make an exception for our small group, which made our trip to Manzanillo that much better!  Provided transportation, which is always a relief.  Wally is a fun guy to talk with and we had a good time.  The pizza/salad at the end was super enjoyable.  Educated us on their fruit trees and medicinal values.  Nice addition to our days at the beach!

558387459.name: Great Zip Lining
558387459.author: a TripAdvisor user
558387459.reviewBody: Wally, and his crew were great! The location they have is nice and clean. The first line was the longest at about 500 meters, and you are up about 200m.  The climb to the top was a bit of a workout first thing in the morning but totally worth it. Finishing with a home made pizza in a locals house was a great way to finish a wonderful day.

552276507.name: A good zip line! Needs more nature information.
552276507.author: a TripAdvisor user
552276507.reviewBody: Wally and the crew were excellent, the zip lines (a double-cabled system = extra safe?) were fun and provided some good views, my only criticism is that there was no real educational component to the zip-lining experience. Other locations I\'ve been to around the world do a much better job by having information about the trees and wildlife, seasonal changes, things to look for etc - this is just a zip line, although the base camp is nominally some sort of "nature camp" which has some animals and interesting houses...  However, everyone was very friendly and made it a great day out.\nThe other highlight was that Wally took us into town and provided the most amazing local pizza: made before us in a wood-fired oven, and with very authentic Mexican toppings. Definitely include the lunch experience in your trip!

466312437.name: If you haven\'t zipped before, now is the time.
466312437.author: a TripAdvisor user
466312437.reviewBody: You won\'t be disappointed.  Wally and his crew make this a great event.  What\'s not to like?  The scenery is beautiful, the weather is great (why you\'re here), the crew and equipment top notch, and even the pizza is good (go figure!).  But go with Wally through Natura Camp facebook page--don\'t get confused by other tours.  You\'ll be charged more and get the same thing.

461492844.name: What a great experience!
461492844.author: a TripAdvisor user
461492844.reviewBody: So many great elements to this tour. The tour guide, Wally, and his helpers were great! The lovely location they have is great. I did the ziplines for the first time and they were very patient and fun. And then the pizza in the middle of the "woods" was a great capper to a wonderful day.

459478379.name: Awesome zip line tour!
459478379.author: a TripAdvisor user
459478379.reviewBody: We found the facilities safe and the equipment well kept. The guides were so much fun and made us feel comfortable even on the long zip lines. Food was great and we had so much fun. I can recommend this to anyone so long as you are reasonably nimble (the climb up was steep but fairly well kept).

451020874.name: A must to if you want a thril
451020874.author: a TripAdvisor user
451020874.reviewBody: First zip line is 1/2 km and hit and high. There are 5 lines is a reasonable price for such  amazing lines. You  do have quite the climb to the first line but what a thrill. I have done it twice and will go again in a second. Francisoco the guide is English speaking and is from the USA for those who are worried about that. if you go for the pizza after it is to die for. I would recommend booking tours direct to save a little money.

401465837.name: Amazing zip line
401465837.author: a TripAdvisor user
401465837.reviewBody: We just returned from a wonderful stay in Manzanillo.  We booked our Natura Camp tour at our hotel through Miguel with Discovery Mundo. Miguel was very helpful for our tours.  Don\'t even try to do it on line. It won\'t work.  I had tried.  Anyway, Wally was the tour guide & was fantastic.  The ride to the camp is a bit different as it is really open air & you travel through the industrial area with is quit dusty but  we were a family of 10 & had a great time anyway.  After arriving we were suited up for the zipline.  We ranged in age from my husband of 80 & me 79 down to age 8.  I will say the hike to the top was not easy but we took our time & all made it.  Make sure you have bug repellent on as the mosquitos are plenty. Once at the top the view was spectacular & the zipline was the best we have ever been on & we have been on quite a few. All of us, right down to the 8 year old had a wonderful time.  Wally & the gentlemen who helped were very nice & made sure we were well taken care of.  On our way back to the hotel, we stopped at an open pit for local pizza which was very good.  All in all I recommend this tour if you are looking for an adventure.  From what Wally said, we were the oldest couple to complete this zip line. As long as your in good health you can do it.  My young grandchildren had no problem either.

360089081.name: Waterfalls,cool..........
360089081.author: a TripAdvisor user
360089081.reviewBody: A very interesting drive through the mountains to view what is a surprise to see (excpt you knew it was there).  The waterfalls and connecting pools are beautiful but especially because they are where they are. Take your camera.Take a picnic lunch etc.

350840967.name: Awesome zipline experience!
350840967.author: a TripAdvisor user
350840967.reviewBody: Wally and his helpers facilitated a great zipline experience!  The hike was easy and the zipline was so cool.  I was nervous when they showed us the first zipline (the longest one), but after 10 seconds of being on it, I really enjoyed it.  It was totally safe and the scenery at the base camp was good too.  Pizza was enjoyable as well.\n\nNote:  Learn from my mistake and do not prepay at anyone\'s website.  They like a reservation but wait to pay until you\'re actually there.

348047954.name: Awesome Experience
348047954.author: a TripAdvisor user
348047954.reviewBody: This is one of the best experiences we had in Manzanillo. The hill wasn\'t that bad to climb as they have added tires filled with dirt for steps most of the way up to the first zip line. We would definitely do it again. The kids had a great time. \n\nPizza was one of the best we have ever had.

341290602.name: BEST TIME!!
341290602.author: a TripAdvisor user
341290602.reviewBody:
We are a young couple with a 7 year old son. Booked the zip line excursion with Natura Camp through our resort and could not have been more pleased! They picked us up at our hotel in the most amusing van (no walls..just metal bars with seats bolted on them) and it was so FUN! The ride through the city to pick up the other guests was a great adventure alone!! My son obviously loved it too :) we drove through a little town and up a mountain to a neat little area, which also had deer we could pet! We met the most friendliest staff and once we geared up, we started our hike/climb to the zip lines. The hike was quite nice because we rested half way at an area that overlooked the jungle. Great photo op ;) once we reached the top, highest line, we had a quick lesson on how to go down the line and off we went. Now let me JUST TELL YOU THIS I AM TERRIFIED of heights! :S so decided to get on the line second before I lost my nerve. A quick reminder on how to pose and I was off(legs shaking..lungs expanding) but once off the platform and in the open air the experience/view is ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS! I fell in lust with the thrill! They gave my son the option to do this 1st line attached to my husband. They both loved it! After that my son was 1st in line and doing the remaining 4 lines like a little pro :D! 
After the fun, we sat down to pizza and soda from a local pizza shop. We unfortunately could not eat the pizza due to our allergies to pork but the group all had big satisfied grins so I'm assuming it was delicious! 
The team were great and encouraging. They let us look around the land and take pictures of the landscape. 

I would recommend them to anyone looking for a good time in the Manzanillo area. The only minor issue we had was the price was a bit high. 

Thank you Natura Tours!!

326752074.name: Great Hike to camp
326752074.author: a TripAdvisor user
326752074.reviewBody: Very interesting place - smoke huts, Aztec temple, great view and a zip line. Deer and peacocks. They have recently built a little accomodation for overnighters who don\'t want to camp. The village at the bottom of the hill has a wonderful pizza place - baked in wood kilns - try the bake plantain & black bean. Lovely.

275165330.name: Highlight of our trip
275165330.author: a TripAdvisor user
275165330.reviewBody: The guide from our rented house in Manzanillo took us to the bottom of a dirt road hill about 15 minutes from town.  The area is poor and rundown, but the folks waved and smiled at us and we felt very comfortable.   We then got in an open-air truck with Wally and his assistant, along with our driver.   They drove us up the dirt road which offered some great views.  The drop-off is iffy but the driver went slow.  The zip gear was new and safe and the instruction was clear.   The walk up the hill was a bit strenuous but not terrible.  The heat made it uncomfortable though.  \n\nZipping was great fun!  The first run is the tallest and longest.   Afterward, we strolled the grounds.  Ask about its history.  Very interesting.  Back at the bottom of the hill, we enjoyed clay oven pizza at a little restaurant. It wasn\'t the best ever but it was very tasty.   Overall it was a great experience.

263876124.name: Overall great experience
263876124.author: a TripAdvisor user
263876124.reviewBody:
First, if you want to book, go directly through Natura Camp- I bought my tickets through another agency and they made some profit from it.  

Anyhow, this was a great experience. Wally is a GREAT tour guide- his assistants were also great (I still don't know how they ride the zip line without a helmet). 

Driving through the small town of Pancho Villa showed me, that people can live a happy life, with minimal things- it seemed like we were celebrities because the locals are out on the streets greeting the tourists.

Now, for the actual zip line, know that the hike is intense- I will leave it at that.  Once you get to the top, the view is breathtaking... until you see the length of the first line (I was thinking, am I that crazy doing the zip line).

Unfortunately, I was not the best at it, I spun and came in backwards, not able to stop in time, so i slammed into the guys.  I only completed 3 out of the 5 lines, because my should was hurting. 

The BEST part of this tour, is the pizza that you get in town, at the end... 

Overall, it was a great experience from beginning to end, in regards to the service-- who cares that I didn't finish all 5 lines, it was still great!

263591055.name: Wonderful!
263591055.author: a TripAdvisor user
263591055.reviewBody:
The climb up to the first line darn near killed us...well, not really, just gave proof that weight loss is required! Wally and his assistants were awesome and the pizza at the end was some of the best pizza I've ever had. 

The actual zip lining was great, although I agree the final one is rather a waste. I'd love to come back and take my kids!

Thanks for a great experience, Wally!

261147143.name: Where are you?
261147143.author: a TripAdvisor user
261147143.reviewBody: After spending 2 frustrating hours looking for this place, we gave up!  Later we learned they are only open by appointment, require a minimum of 4 participants, and there are absolutely no directions or signs to guide you to this business.  What a disappointment.

260576096.name: Zip lining
260576096.author: a TripAdvisor user
260576096.reviewBody: my husband and I Zip lined- it was the best part of the whole vacation.\n\n Must say WALLY the tour rep was fantastic.  was wonderful.

248320533.name: loved the zipline and the drive to the mountain!
