248320533.author: a TripAdvisor user
248320533.reviewBody: great trip, we thought it would be good to skip the lunch and get back to our hotel, but like the idea of helping out the village

247845869.name: Zip Line
247845869.author: a TripAdvisor user
247845869.reviewBody: Picked up in town to travel to the rural mountain where the zip line was. A bit of a climb from the area up to the first line (there are five), but was worth it. The final pizza lunch was the best pizza we have had.

241104197.name: Great experience.
241104197.author: a TripAdvisor user
241104197.reviewBody: I would definitely recommend. A bit of a climb getting to the first zip line, but once you are there, it is worth it! Just do not forget to look around - the views are spectacular!

201129913.name: FunTime But what a Climb
201129913.author: a TripAdvisor user
201129913.reviewBody:
Jonathan was our main guide. What a great young man. Very pleasant, entertaining, informative. The ride up to the camp is fun in an open air truck. The climb to the top was hard on myself as I have a bad hip but the 69 year old gentleman took it in stride. 

There are 5 line but really only 4. Your first line is the longest. They get shorter each time with the fourth being short and the last #5 only being about 30 feet. Watching Jonathan go upside down on # 3 Was a blast.

After the zip lines it was time for lunch at a small outdoor Pizza Place. This is in the real Mexico not the resort area. The food was served in small batches. First Salad, Then the pizza Served one at a time it was hard for everyone to eat at the same time with a group of 14. When you did get your piece of pizza it was really good and worth the wait. I did not try all the types they had. There was a meat, vegie, banana and black beans, black beans and truffle and Hawaiian.

Other than #5 on the zip line was a great time. I would do it again if my hip holds up.

196172293.name: Fun Zip lines and good pizza
196172293.author: a TripAdvisor user
196172293.reviewBody: We went zip-lining with our 10 year old twins and had a blast.  They have 5 lines and the first three are great, the fourth mediocre and the 5th they should just take down.  Our group was large 31 people which I thought was too many since it takes a lot of time to get everyone going.  Afterwards, we stopped in a tiny town and had pizza of all things, and it was really, really tasty.  A good end to a good day

191909954.name: Fun fun fun zip line
191909954.author: a TripAdvisor user
191909954.reviewBody: The views are breath taking as is the ride on the zip line. We had a large group and several folks questioning their sanity for agreeing to take on this activity.  By the end we all agreed it was a highlight of our week in Manzanillo.  The staff was professional and accommodating.  \nThis would have been a 5 star rating except for a staff member named Victor. He seemed to be the supervisor.  He drove the bus back after our ride on the zip line.  This idiot ruined our trip by running over two puppies.   When asked why he replied, "I honked the horn."  It was horrible and a man like that will get his. I just hope sooner than later.

182172900.name: Great zip line
182172900.author: a TripAdvisor user
182172900.reviewBody: Zip line was so much fun.  The drive from la punta felt sketchy on the way there... but in retrospect was fine, im too westernized ive decided. Wally was the leader and spoke perfect English (he lived in Washington state for many years) his assistant was "abuelo". It was very safe and lots of fun.  To make it even more local, we stopped in the little village on the way home for local pizza-- great stuff

155761148.name: Great Zip LIne
155761148.author: a TripAdvisor user
155761148.reviewBody: A fellow on the beach in Manzanillo was selling this adventure and he jumped in our car and showed us the way (I can\'t imagine we could have found it without him).  Driving up the one lane washed up dirt road to the camp was half the adventure.  The 1st of 5 zips is half a kilometer across a valley - woohoo. My 13 year old daughter quaked a bit before zipping off.  The equipment looked in perfect shape and the guides did their job. It\'s a bit of hike up the hill to get started but other than that was easy peasy.  They don\'t take credit cards and we didn\'t have enough cash but the English speaking leader (a Mexican from Yakima, Washington) said not a problem, we could go to an ATM when we got back to town and give the balance to the fellow from the beach.  They don\'t have any food for sale though they did give us bottled water. There isn\'t much for kids to do in Manzanillo, so this is about as good as it gets.

153142235.name: Fun fun fun fun fun fun!!!!
153142235.author: a TripAdvisor user
153142235.reviewBody: We went on the zipline adventure.  The driver in the cammo van arrived on time and was very fun as we talked about the area.  The camp looked like a great eco-tourist location but the reason we were there was the zipline.  We hiked up a small hill and hit the zip.  Everything was quite secure and the zipline is a double line that can hold 6000 lbs.  The harness looked pretty new and very secure.  Everything was safe and the workers gladly helped as I had a couple questions.  After the bravery of the zip we went for local pizza which was just tremendously tasty.  All in all a great day as we zipped 300 feet above the jungle floor.

643143771.name: Cool Ruins
643143771.author: a TripAdvisor user
643143771.reviewBody: We stopped here to see the sites. You can get out of the car and walk around this old site. Amazing site and the volcano is in thr background the entire time!

564153806.name: Low profile archeological site in Colima
564153806.author: a TripAdvisor user
564153806.reviewBody: Worth seeking out if you are into Mayan ruins. Badly signposted and not at all obvious - just use Google maps and GPS. A nominal entrance fee gets you parking and the run of the place which is, if not Teotihucan, still impressive in its scale. Completely deserted when I visited and on a clear day a nice view of the volcano.

564053803.name: Very interesting
564053803.author: a TripAdvisor user
564053803.reviewBody: We really liked this area. Found it interesting and awe inspiring. They have only excavated a small area so for but what there is so cool. I saw other reviews talking about being hounded by vendors at the venue but there were none there at all.

559086934.name: Surprised to find these ruins/pyramids in Colima.
559086934.author: a TripAdvisor user
559086934.reviewBody: We have been to Colima many times over the years and had never visited La Campana. What a nice surprise! A easy walk around the grounds. Last year we went to Teotihuacan outside of Mexico city and my wife due to sore knees was unable to climb the big pyramids so she was very happy to be able to climb the small ones at La Campana.

497890913.name: Smaller Ruins but still decent
497890913.author: a TripAdvisor user
497890913.reviewBody: A smaller set of Mayan ruins, with a small pyramid and a grave area amongst the other stone walls. Worth a visit if you are in the area, this sort of history is becoming more rare all the time.

375856726.name: An average site in a fun colonial city
375856726.author: a TripAdvisor user
375856726.reviewBody: La Campana taken on its own is a decent archaeological site. However compared to the richness of Mexican sites located in this part of Mexico it is second fiddle at best. Guachimontones outside Guadalajara and Tzintuntzan in Michoacan are much better sites albeit of different civilisations.

338000776.name: The pyramids
338000776.author: a TripAdvisor user
338000776.reviewBody: This was a long bus ride to explore the La Campana pyramids.\u00a0 These are not patricianly tall like the classic ones, but still very interesting. The tour also included a visit to an old church and a traditional Mexican lunch complete with mariachi music. And of course shopping. The bus ride was so long that we got back to the ship just at cast off time so there as no chance to explore the beach and surrounding area.

323157175.name: Slightly hidden away, important site
323157175.author: a TripAdvisor user
323157175.reviewBody: This is an impressive site. \nApparently,  the excavations are proceeding slowly but even now there is plenty to see and wonder at.\n

308589664.name: Ruins in Colima? Yes!
308589664.author: a TripAdvisor user
308589664.reviewBody: Was quite surprised to find such well preserved ruins in Colima. Easy access and made for a great day trip.

299204638.name: Ruins of what used to be a large village as it spans the size of over 3x6 football fields in size
299204638.author: a TripAdvisor user
299204638.reviewBody: This is actually just outside of Colima, capital city of the state of Colima, in the suburb called "Villa de Alvarez". I did not encounter anything called "Campana" in the Manzanillo area. My husband and I went to see this Archeological site in mid-April/2015. We found it strangely deserted as we saw only one other person visiting at the same time we were there. We have a Mexico\'s Seniors Card so the fee by a guard at the front gate was free to us but I don\'t think it is expensive for others. Parking is available inside the gate so just drive in. It took us nearly one hour to walk the grounds all in the open sun so make sure you have a hat and sunscreen. There are not many large trees for shade. Only the foundations of the houses are left showing that this was a very big village. The view of the two Colima volcanos (Fire and Snow) are currently blocked by vegetation but these would have been visible from this village during its glory years. There is a tomb on the site that was under repair at the time we visited. This site is certainly as impressive as some of the archeological sites that made the Mayan Coast near Cancun so famous. This site is easy to find and worth a visit.

252645948.name: They are all round stone, ignore that if you been to better ones.
252645948.author: a TripAdvisor user
252645948.reviewBody:
I have been to Cancun, and Chichen itza, compare with them, the La Campana is boring. There are a few pyramids on both size of road, and all made with same size round stone. 

If you been to other mexican Maya Ruins, you can pass this.

but here is a good place to look out volcano on north when sunny day without haze.

247848323.name: Archeological
247848323.author: a TripAdvisor user
247848323.reviewBody: This visit was part of our Colima State tour (DaniTours). The site is over 2000 years old. Inspiring!

218217416.name: No entrance
218217416.author: a TripAdvisor user
218217416.reviewBody: We drove up the hill to visit the site. All gates but one were closed. We wanted to enter the site but where stopped by an offical. It was closed, we were not even allowed to take one picture. In our case, a two hour drive for nothing. Make sure to contact the organisation in Colima before you make your trip. We drove around the site but it does not look authentic, especially with all the building that is going on.

193498161.name: Pre-hispanic Peace
193498161.author: a TripAdvisor user
193498161.reviewBody: We were nearing the end of a road trip, returning from Morelia, and were surprised that our guidebook had no recommendations for archaeological sites in Colima state.   We found La Campana in a web search and were surprised that it was within the city limits of present day Colima, the state capitol (not in Manzanillo).   The site has about a dozen re-constructed structures ranging from relatively small platforms to modest pyramids with multiple tiers.   We were pleased that most of the structures were described in panels in Spanish and English, as well as a native language.   What a peaceful feeling we had walking through the ruins.  The site can be done justice in about one hour.   Pottery from the site dates back to 1500 BC.   The site had been inhabited for up to 3000 years! Entrance fee 43 pesos per person.

137406835.name: Quiet place to soak in history
137406835.author: a TripAdvisor user
137406835.reviewBody: Take a cab. It\'s 15 minutes from any place in the city. We\'ve been to Mexico City for the ruins and this doesn\'t compare. However, if you are in the area please visit. Even my 11 year old enjoyed. Not a suggested trip if coming from Manzanillo or Guadalajara. Would be long drive for a day trip.

129755670.name: Interesting to visit but I prefer the nearby El Chanal ruins
129755670.author: a TripAdvisor user
129755670.reviewBody: I\'ve visited La Campana several times over the years. The site is very interesting because it is huge - and they have only uncovered a small portion of it - and because it is constructed of smaller sized rocks cemented together, not giant blocks of stone as are many of the prehispanic ruins in Mexico. It surprised me that they had some sort of cement way back then that not only held the rocks together but also lasted this long - some of the structures are quite high and quite large - and I was also surprised by the fact that, visible on many of the structures, is a built in drainage system. It is fun to wander through the pathways and climb the structures (staying on the stairs and pathways please) and enjoy the different views, the volcanoes are quite visible in the background  on clear days. La Campana is located very close to shopping centres and other businesses and accessible from a main traffic route so it is quite \'urban\' in setting. For this reason I prefer the slightly more remote and very similar El Chanal ruin that is a few kilometers away and currently in a more rural setting, though the city of Colima is encroaching. Both sites are worth a visit if you have an  interest in prehispanic architecture.

124207737.name: Very long day in a bus.
124207737.author: a TripAdvisor user
124207737.reviewBody: The tour was nice but stops were too short.  Lunch was awesome.

665783515.name: picturesque overlook
665783515.author: a TripAdvisor user
665783515.reviewBody: This overlook was part of a cruise ship excursion. Very picturesque......made one wish to see more of that beach and resort.\nWish we could have gone into the resort: from the outside it looked very nice with the all white buildings.

599917727.name: Pleasant place
599917727.author: a TripAdvisor user
599917727.reviewBody: I had the pleasure to stay in casashangrila, which is located in the Peninsula de Santiago, and I can say that certainly is maybe the best area of Manzanillo: close to beautiful beaches and wonderful scenarios and in the same time relatively close to the main boulevard.

593642862.name: Fantastic place
593642862.author: a TripAdvisor user
593642862.reviewBody: Peninsula de Santiago is maybe one of the best place in Manzanillo, where to spend some vacation days in full relax. It is anyway important to select the right place where to book a room or rent an apartment. Based on my personal experience, I would never book an apartment in Condominium el Faro, because the offered security is not enough: no electric fence, no video-surveillance, no watchdogs. In fact, many intrusions happened recently at Condominium el Faro with some theft and damages: today theft and tomorrow? what else...?\nSo, good tip: select in peninsula de Santiago  accommodations provided with electric fence and at least video-surveillance.

567706011.name: Lots of places to stay with views of the bay or ocean
567706011.author: a TripAdvisor user
567706011.reviewBody: We always stay on the peninsula because of the terrific hotels with views of the bay. There is a bus that goes around the peninsula about every half hour, so it is easy to get down to the main street.

556409557.name: Great beach for walking and playing
556409557.author: a TripAdvisor user
556409557.reviewBody: We didn\'t stop but the beach looked fantastic for playing, swimming and walking for miles.  Lots of parking and local buses went past this area often

470132766.name: sunset cruise
470132766.author: a TripAdvisor user
470132766.reviewBody: beautiful area for a ssunset cruise that was offered from our hotel.\nwas out on the water for over 3 hours.

465330029.name: Beautiful location - Local color
465330029.author: a TripAdvisor user
465330029.reviewBody: Beautiful beaches, Ramadas (beach restaurants) good swimming on a long, flat, sandy beach with lots of activities, including a Saturday Tienda (market) in the town of Santiago.  The Peninsula juts out along a lagoon, where if you take the rustic road out to (resorts) Vida del Mar and/or Las Palmas you will feel like you are in a jungle wilderness.

462326129.name: Hidden hangout.
462326129.author: a TripAdvisor user
462326129.reviewBody: Here\'s a place that we would never have discovered had it not been for a snorkeling trip we booked while on a Princess cruise to the Mexican Riviera. The snorkeling trip booked through Aquatic Adventures, which was one of the best ever, uses this beach to launch from on their dive trips. This secluded spot on the north side of the Manzanillo Bay is not visible from the highway, so if you didn\'t know about it, you could easily drive right passed the entrance. The water in the bay was hot when we returned from our trip and there is also a shipwreck not far from shore that is full of tropical and local fish just waiting for you to take their picture. The shoreline is full of places to eat and there are plenty of boats available to take you fishing or??? and personal water craft to rent for your pleasure. Great spot, calm waters and plenty of food and sunshine. \nKevin F  Antioch, Ca.

460197357.name: Breathtaking views of the bays
460197357.author: a TripAdvisor user
460197357.reviewBody: We hired a local man to show us around the Santiago area and then take us to old town Manzanillo.  He took us on all manner of streets up and down the peninsula to a secluded beach and some little known family-owned hotels and also past the fabulous large hotels/resorts and condos.  Along the way he explained some of the history of the region.

454531496.name: Hilly, somewhat overbuilt
454531496.author: a TripAdvisor user
454531496.reviewBody: We\'re not fans of gated communities and it seems many occupy this peninsula. Still, it\'s worth a winding drive to see the hillside enclaves on this peninsula that separates Santiago Bay and Manzanillo Bay..

428874267.name: Peaceful beach
428874267.author: a TripAdvisor user
428874267.reviewBody: Santiago is a nice, long bay, great for walks and swimming. The beach is rough on the east end but is swimmable closer to the hill on the west end. Can get very crowded on local holidays and weekends.

409732062.name: Playa Audiencia a wonderful beach
409732062.author: a TripAdvisor user
409732062.reviewBody: Hidden away beach.  There are local vendors, Beach chair & umbrella rentals $150 MX.  Coconut drinks are over-priced.  Warm waters that are easy to swim & soak in.  Great day at the beach overall.

377997702.name: Cruise stop
377997702.author: a TripAdvisor user
377997702.reviewBody: Do not recommend. Did not feel safe in the city of Manzanillo, Mexico. Walked around the city  and quickly return to cruise boat after seeing young men with guns and the Mexican Federallies  just a couple block away from the cruise ship dock.

358800779.name: Beautiful Bay
358800779.author: a TripAdvisor user
358800779.reviewBody: This area is beautiful at sunset and very popular in the daytime with swimmers, sunbathers and a few surfers. There is a flea market in this area that sell clothing and misc items.

326578741.name: Excellent vacation area
326578741.author: a TripAdvisor user
326578741.reviewBody: The Santiago peninsula is removed from Manzanillo centro and the port - which is a good thing. The Peninsula is home to many condos, hotels and private homes. La Punta is a high end gated community. Las Hadas is a condo/hotel, has a marina, and many good restaurants. A great condo complex is El Faro at the top of the hill. It has fabulous views of both bays and is known for its beautiful vistas and sunset views. There are no time share salespeople in Manzanillo and it is not anywhere as touristy as PV or Cancun.

287387152.name: A MISH MOSH OF MAGIC
287387152.author: a TripAdvisor user
287387152.reviewBody: As you turn into the road that circles the Santiago Peninsula you will find middle class condominium projects, hotels of all stars. a beach. Within the beach there are eating area, jet skis, boat rentals and sighting by boat around the area.There is the Hotel La Hadas which was the setting of the movie "10 "with Bo Derek and Dudley Moore and the home of female braided hair..Manzanillos claim to fame!.The end of the Peninsula  houses a mature development  called LaPunta loaded with million dollar homes. Take a trip around the peninsula . Its worth it\n\'

283730054.name: Paradise on the Pacific!
283730054.author: a TripAdvisor user
283730054.reviewBody: Have travelled extensively in MX and otherwise.  This is the best.  Don\'t tell anyone.  Climate, atmosphere, and yes it is safe!  No problem!  Many Canadians as we really do seek out the best.  There are to timeshare salesmen, in fact there are no salesmen on the streets or the beaches.

264287633.name: An excellent place to stay
264287633.author: a TripAdvisor user
264287633.reviewBody: The Santiago Peninsula is an excellent place to stay because it gets you out of the traffic and noise of Manzanillo, which is the biggest port city on the Pacific coast of Mexico. There are a lot of good restaurants on the main drag and more out on Playa Miramar beach which is fairly close.

261073369.name: If you are looking to rent or buy, look here first
261073369.author: a TripAdvisor user
261073369.reviewBody: The peninsula is close enough and far enough from amenities you will want.  A car is almost a necessity unless you are in great shape and have the stamina for walking in the sun.  There are three nice, calm beaches.  Only Audecia gets busy on Sunday\'s.  Counterintuitively, the higher you are on the peninsular, the better.  The breezes are wonderful.  I live here in the winters so perhaps I am biased, but the cono I live in, El Faro, is well run, in good financial shape, secure and a 10 minute walk or 5 minute drive to many beaches.

260230889.name: Steep climbs
260230889.author: a TripAdvisor user
260230889.reviewBody: Las Hadas, Tesoro & Barcelo are situated on the peninsula - steep climbs - nice views from the top! Quiet clean safe area.

259713340.name: Exclusive, posh, beauty!!
259713340.author: a TripAdvisor user
259713340.reviewBody: I have been lucky enough to be able to stay on this breathtaking peninsula many times, from Las Hadas & its gorgeous, calm, protected beach (that has a raft you can easily swim out too which is one of my favorite things to do, to the Karmina Palace (before the Barcelo took over & ruined it), to Puerto Las Hadas condos. The views from your oceanfront balconies are out of this world. Walking along the marina (with all its adorable seaside restaurants) & the malecon from Las Hadas to Karmina is so relaxing & beautiful, & a very easy walk for just about anyone. The feeling of being in your own, private, secure, guarded, utopia, makes you feel like a princess without a care in the world. Creme de le creme in Manzanillo!

258788432.name: Beach Area
258788432.author: a TripAdvisor user
258788432.reviewBody: Beautiful and the fleamarket on saturdays was great, lots of variety and very good prices. The beach is beautiful and the surf is magnificent..Very friendly people and lots of English. Not too pushy for sales..

257381994.name: Car Rental Manzanillo Airport
257381994.author: a TripAdvisor user
257381994.reviewBody:
We recently spent a month in Manzanillo, Jan 30, 2015 to end of Feb, We had a car rented and paid for with Thrifty at the Manzanillo Airport. We arrived mid day, cleared customs and headed to the rental car counters, stepped up to Thrifty's and presented paperwork showing a paid in full rental. We were told , "sorry, no car" .thinking he didn't understand I showed him the paperwork again, I wasn't trying to rent, I had a paid in full rental....Nope he hadn't misunderstood, same answer, no car....another fellow lined up behind me, I turned asked him if he had paid for a rental, he said no, he had reserved from Manzanillo and took a cab out when he was told they had one, ( 600 peso ride)...I stepped aside and said see what the clerk says, he did and was told the same, no car....he stepped sideways to the Alamo and rented their last one, I stepped sideways in the opposite direction and was greeted by an extremely surly Budget clerk who informed me , yes they had one but if I wasn't buying their 75.00 a day insurance pkge they would have to charge my visa 14,000.00 U.S. to cover the entire cost of the car.

I was then summoned back to the Thrifty counter to be told they would call me as soon as they had one, day or two at the most.... no choice but to grab a cab as we were staying in a rented house, their was no transportation provided....600 peso's later we arrived at our house.

Long story short, Thrifty never did come thru with a car, and 10 days later I was still fighting for a refund....finally I was referred to Vasa car rental, that afternoon, they delivered a car to the house, signed all the forms and left the car, 8 days later I picked up the agent on the way to the Airport, he signed of at the terminal, gave me a receipt and drove away, no extra charge....

My advice avoid thrifty and budget like the plague, if you need a car in the Manzanillo area google Vasa and use them, personally I will not use thrifty or Budget again, anywhere, and I am not likely to book anything thru Rental Cars. com either, they were just as unhelpful in resolving this issue....

256437334.name: Beautiful views
256437334.author: a TripAdvisor user
256437334.reviewBody: You can do no better than the views available from this location. If you are in the area find a hotel and enjoy..

255047675.name: Rocky View
255047675.author: a TripAdvisor user
255047675.reviewBody: We went out for a stroll along the beach where we ended up climbing up the rocks to go out near the the tip of the pensisula where we were able to see all sorts of sea life.

246809859.name: The Med Meets Mexico
246809859.author: a TripAdvisor user
246809859.reviewBody: This peninsula divides the large Manzanillo bay into north and south lobes.   The east end of the peninsula is occupied by a golf course.   The rocky west end of the peninsula is relatively high and rocky, covered by luxurious homes, condos and hotels.   One can catch a city bus into the peninsula at the intersection with the main road running around the bay, Miguel de la Madrid with Avenida Audencia.   Those with more energy might walk out along the bus route and enjoy many lovey views.

245835181.name: Spectacular
245835181.author: a TripAdvisor user
245835181.reviewBody:
This peninsula houses a variety of high end condos and funky buildings built along, what seems to be, almost impossibly challenging cliffs. The high end Las Hadas resort can be found here as well as the Barceló golf course. Now on the flip side, the views must be fabulous. We stayed at the Tesoro and you can't beat the views from this bay. 

Snorkeling is very good here and the day we went, we saw hundreds of fish.

An added bonus is the Number 8 bus services this area so its easy to catch a bus to either the Walmart-Starbucks area or even to go downtown.

242730211.name: Steep Hills and Few Resturants
242730211.author: a TripAdvisor user
242730211.reviewBody: There are a group of resturants at the Las Hadas marina, some resturants associated with the hotels, and various resturants along the road out to Audienca beach. The cobble stone streets and steep climbs to anywhere are a challenge, but #8 bus will take you around to anywhere tourists go.\nP.S. I live here.

161444396.name: A lovely community with many exciting places to eat, sunbath and for entertainment
161444396.author: a TripAdvisor user
161444396.reviewBody: We enjoy Santiago Peninsula with all they have to offer. We enjoy the Oasis restaurante, for food and entertainment. We discovered this year at the very end of the road of the main road, in fact a dirt road that lead us to 4 maybe 5 great mexican restaurantes. The BBQ snapper is unbelievable.

152975365.name: Boat tour & playa
152975365.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975365.reviewBody: Very funny 3 hrs boat trip, view of Elephant rock, snokeling, and danse entertained by the GEO.\nDinner fantastic on the beach.  Swimming.

150630889.name: Lots of beautiful beaches.
150630889.author: a TripAdvisor user
150630889.reviewBody: Go to lay back, watch the waves, have margaritas, swim and hang out. Tables, chairs and umbrellas are at a price, but you can hang out all day.

150455144.name: Nice place... great views
150455144.author: a TripAdvisor user
150455144.reviewBody: Very pleasant place..  nice little beaches, curvy nice roads.. good views from everywhere.. blah blah blah

150001380.name: Great beaches
150001380.author: a TripAdvisor user
150001380.reviewBody: It is a wonderful place to soak up the sun swim, and then have some guacamole washed down by a huge marguerita. Well need I say more?

147460332.name: Always love it!  The beach was great.
147460332.author: a TripAdvisor user
147460332.reviewBody: There\'s construction downtown right now, so it is worthwhile to go to Playa Miramar and backtrack to Santiago.

131444886.name: In my opinion the best part of Manzanillo
131444886.author: a TripAdvisor user
131444886.reviewBody: Lots of shopping stores, small & larger places to eat and lots of things, people to see. It tends to get busier on the Friday and Saturdays with lots of teens all the over the places.

129112129.name: At the Santiago Peninsula, Fresh Fish and Seafood
129112129.author: a TripAdvisor user
129112129.reviewBody: The best place to enjoy fresh fish and seafood in Manzanillo is at the Santiago Peninsula, at the Fishermen Cooperativa...  Served right on the beach under the Palapas, Fresh Fish from the Ocean to your Plate, tried the Pescado Sarandeado and a Ceviche or Vuelve a la Vida Seafood Cocktail.  \nReviewed by Analou Manent

120862574.name: Beautiful Las Hadas, great food at the Marina Las Hadas
120862574.author: a TripAdvisor user
120862574.reviewBody: Two different nights we went to walk along the Marina Las Hadas for and have meals, one at Poco Pazzo, one at Marina Grill. Both were great, with good service. Marina Grill turns out really great steaks.

120505605.name: A walk down the beach from Karmina
120505605.author: a TripAdvisor user
120505605.reviewBody: If you\'re staying at Karmina, be sure to take a stroll down the ocean path to the Las Hadas resort and marina.  Take a break and have a mango margarita at Frida\'s and then follow the stairs up to the street level.  You can walk all the way to Playa Audencia, but be careful, it\'s a very narrow street and buses do travel it!

651908797.name: Iguanas, they got iguanas and they also have some more iguanas
651908797.author: a TripAdvisor user
651908797.reviewBody: If you\'re in Manzanillo and have an hour or two this is easy and a lot of fun.  It is funky as many things in Mexico are but you\'ll never see more iguanas.  We had a car to get there but asking a taxi to take you there would be easy, it is close to the old town section. There is no entrance fee butt here is  a donation box.  We left a 100 pesos.  Donations are used to buy food and supplies.  Staff is friendly and helpful, speak some English.  There are also some raccoons, coati, cavalenas and a few birds.  \nThe size and colour of the older male iguanas is amazing. Was lots of fun and an easy side trip, we\'d recommend it.

644352377.name: Not worth the trip
644352377.author: a TripAdvisor user
644352377.reviewBody: Simply not worth the time and effort to get there. It\'s literally a backyard with lots of iguanas hiding in the trees. Only worth it if you get there at feeding time and that is never regular. Our lizard loving kids didn\'t find it very interesting.

638637726.name: Smll cages and dirty area.
638637726.author: a TripAdvisor user
638637726.reviewBody: I have heard lots of rave reviews of this place but I was disappointed and not happy with the enclosures (especially of the birds). They are small and dirty. To see all the iguanas together is something but I would rather take a boat ride in the lagoon and see them all naturally.

571730327.name: Not like the zoo
571730327.author: a TripAdvisor user
571730327.reviewBody: A great experience. I approached the entrance with trepidation, having seen dozens of iguanas in the trees from the street. The iguanas of all sizes are not enclosed but roaming freely, everywhere. They were well behaved and stayed behind the single rope that separates the public viewing area  from the eating area of the iguanas. The owners\u2019 son carried an iguana over, explaining a bit about it and even showing us its teeth.

562810254.name: Iguana Sancuary
562810254.author: a TripAdvisor user
562810254.reviewBody: A small animal rescue run by donations only. It is free to enter. They have not only Iguanas, but other animals as well like wild pigs. Check it out and leave a few pesos if you can.

558725569.name: Interesting
558725569.author: a TripAdvisor user
558725569.reviewBody: I agree with other reviewers who have said the conditions are less then idea for animals like raccoons in captivity.  None the less the iguanas were very interesting and are free to come and go.

556097363.name: Glad we went
556097363.author: a TripAdvisor user
556097363.reviewBody: A simple but interesting place to visit to see all sizes of Iguanas up close and in the trees. Other animals present as well. The owner is doing a great job in creating this refuge for iguanas and other animals. Difficult to get to but wish we had known that staying on a bus going to "Centro" takes you right by the reserve to save walking.

554269987.name: a tough call
554269987.author: a TripAdvisor user
554269987.reviewBody:
Boy, this is a tough one.  The overflowing army of iguanas, who apparently live in the trees because they are fed, was a site to behold - in fact it was one of my granddaughters trip highlights.   They seem prehistoric and and actually fascinating to watch  as they lumber into the pile of lettuce and vegetable scraps tossed out for lunch.

The other poor animals in this compound deserve nothing but pity.  The manic raccoons in a mud hole of an enclosure, frantically "washing their hands".   The dozens of parrots and song bird crammed into a wire cage.  The "wild boars" crammed into another mud pit.  The emaciated snake draped over the back of a chair -- a photo op!?  Could go on, but you get the picture.  

If they freed the tortured animals, I think this could be a fascinating experience.  But as it is I can't recommend supporting them.

554254334.name: Large Iguanas!!
554254334.author: a TripAdvisor user
554254334.reviewBody: Our friend took us to see the Iguanas. No cost to go inside but a donation is appreciated. I missed the hundreds at feeding time but there were still many around when I was there. For a peso you can feed an iguana a banana and pet him! They were very muscular and felt like rubbing sequins! Many were in the trees and on the roof. This is not a zoo... Just a rope keeps you from walking too far in. You will be unclose and personal with the iguanas!  I am not crazy about lizards but I loved this!! You must go!

553244602.name: Up close and personal
553244602.author: a TripAdvisor user
553244602.reviewBody: People expecting pristine zoos will be disappointed, but those who care to get up close and personal with HUNDREDS of iguanas will be pleased. No admission charge, just a donation box ... and 5 pesos if you want to hand-feed a lizard a banana.

538410161.name: Holy Iguanas
538410161.author: a TripAdvisor user
538410161.reviewBody: Wow! I wasnt sure what to expect. Even before we entered the park, you could see the Iguanas in the trees. Once we entered we saw some cute little raccoons napping and climbing freely where ever they wanted to go. No cage or fence! The Iguanas were wild!s\nI recommend going at feeding time. It was amazing watching these animals drop from trees onto a tin roof and slide down to the ground. There is only a rope for you to  stand behind ..every thing is OPEN! I was amazed at their size, and how they just  hung out in the area where the food was being placed and the trees. There is no fee...it is all by donation. Cool thing to see.

537942314.name: Mass Iguana Sighting
537942314.author: a TripAdvisor user
537942314.reviewBody: Not knowing the opening time we went at 10AM.  Walked down Francis I. Madero until we saw the arena then crossed the canal bridge to the entrance.  About a 10 minute walk from the Hotel Colonia.  \n\nGate was closed.  A neighbour called to the employee inside and he let us in via a side gate.  All the iguanas were up in the trees so no close up viewing.  The employee said to return at 11:15 and it might be feeding time.  Returned at 11:30 and many iguana were in the viewing area in a competitive feeding frenzy.  Likely the only place to see so many iguana in one place.  Glad we returned.  There was a guide there who spoke English and gave a good explanation of the iguana life and feeding.  Donation box on site.  Its a good visit at feeding time otherwise a bit boring.  We suggest trying to arrive around 11 AM to observe the feeding.  There is no posted opening hours at the entrance.

475965184.name: Near town
475965184.author: a TripAdvisor user
475965184.reviewBody: We took a taxi here from the Barcel\u00f3. It was fun to watch the iguanas eating and doing their head bob. We spent about an hour here. My favorite were the Badgers, they were fun to watch. The taxi who dropped us off, told us the directions to easily walk to the main part of town near the giant Sailfish. This was helpful to us and we shopped a few of the shops on the way, we also found a few treats like paletas and churros.

474232563.name: Iguanas! Lots of them!
474232563.author: a TripAdvisor user
474232563.reviewBody: This is a truly Mexican place. It looks like someone\'s backyard is slowly becoming a zoo-like iguanario. I always take my visitors to view this place because it IS where to see the giant iguanas close up. They work on donations so it is not expensive. They may be a bit hard to find as at first glance the creek looks like any other creek until you really look at what\'s in the trees behind it. You park along the road beside the creek, take photos of the iguanas in the trees then walk over a bridge and enter at the second gate on the left. In the 5 years that I have been taking guests here, the place has undertaken many improvements but it still has a long way to go to becoming a happy zoo for the animals that live there. It has several varieties of iguanas of all sizes, hens and roosters, love birds, a type of bird of prey, badger-like animals called tejones, mexican racoons with tails called coatis, small wild boars, etc. The grand-kids loved the place and were fascinated watching the animals.

472444880.name: Fun stop in Manzanillo
472444880.author: a TripAdvisor user
472444880.reviewBody: It was fun to see so many iguanas in a close up setting. I wish the other animals had better accommodations. It was sad to see them in such small, dismal cages.

471655465.name: Worth the visit
471655465.author: a TripAdvisor user
471655465.reviewBody: We hopped on the #1 bus and it took us through El Centro, right to the Iguanario.  Free admission - there are a couple of milk cans for donations, so please consider giving a few pesos to help keep this going. \n\nYes there are a few other animals in smaller sized spaces, but I\'m not going to weigh-in against animal activists.  We went to see iguanas, and did we ever!  We arrived shortly before noon at feeding time, so animals were out & moving.

470701991.name: So many iguanas all in one place.
470701991.author: a TripAdvisor user
470701991.reviewBody: This place is a must see when visiting Manzanillo.  Hundreds and hundreds of iguanas that congregate here.  It is a very prehistoric experience.

467825726.name: So many Iguanas in one location.
467825726.author: a TripAdvisor user
467825726.reviewBody: A little difficult to find at first.  When we did we really enjoyed it.  Great for kids and photo opportunities.  This location relies solely on donations to stay open. Please be generous.

466183759.name: Holy Iguanas!
466183759.author: a TripAdvisor user
466183759.reviewBody: If you are in Manzanillo, you gotta see the Iguanas!  Take your kids.  It\'s something you won\'t see again soon.  I\'ve never seen so many ginormous iguanas sitting in such close proximity in just a few trees.  It was a sight to see.

465335304.name: Eco-tourism at its most interestnt
465335304.author: a TripAdvisor user
465335304.reviewBody: Located through Manzanillo El Centro - the large old city and the largest seaport on the West Coast of Mexico - you will find iguanas both large and small "dripping" from the trees across the canal.  Find the entrance and you will find a few other indigenous animals in a rustic zoo, piles of donated produce to feed the iguanas and a coffee can for donations to help with maintenance and upkeep of the animals.  While it is free to go in and look, the best viewing is across the canal just looking at the trees full of every size and color of iguana, but please go through the gate and leave a donation.

465052086.name: Iguana maxim
465052086.author: a TripAdvisor user
465052086.reviewBody: So if you want to see lots and lots of these friendly lizards, this be the place to go. Its free and I guarantee you will never see a sight like this again. Just ask your cab driver to take you there.

459888199.name: Never seen so many iguanas
459888199.author: a TripAdvisor user
459888199.reviewBody: This place is run by one man who has rescued 100s of iguanas.  He has also started rescuing others, .ie.: Raccoons, Wild Boar, Coati, canaries, parrots, raptors, and two guinea pigs.  He supports this place on his own money and cash and food donations; no public/government assistance.  There are hundreds of iguanas, on the ground, in the trees, and everywhere else.  It\'s a small place, but very interesting to see. Free entry, but donations are accepted.

458591188.name: so many
458591188.author: a TripAdvisor user
458591188.reviewBody: The place is rustic and has a few other creatures to see. Its free to go except for the bathrooms which i think were 5 pesos. I cant tell you what they were like as I never had to use them. The sanctuary does accept donations which is well worth paying as it does keep it open to the public. It was pretty neat to see so many iguanas that come in so many blending colors and sizes. Not something we canadians see everyday so it was interesting to watch them. I would go back again if I were to have the pleasure of visiting Manzanillo again.

457643548.name: Want to see Iguanas???
457643548.author: a TripAdvisor user
457643548.reviewBody: This attraction has been described as a "zoo" and as an Iguana sanctuary.  At any rate, if you want to see an Iguana, you will get your fill,  This place is has got Iguana\'s of all sizes roaming freely but mostly confined to a caged area.\nthere are a few other animals and according to people who have been there before, they are improving the property and adding attractions.

453671896.name: I\'ve never wanted to see iguanas fight so badly before
453671896.author: a TripAdvisor user
453671896.reviewBody: Pretty cool place. Some raccoons, javelina\'s, birds and tons of iguanas. The owners just fed the iguanas lettuce so they were eating and climbing down the trees. We walked outside the area and the iguanas were sun bathing and started quarreling with each other high up in the trees and we just wanted them to fall in the water so bad!! But they didn\'t and they were safe and sound. We might make this an annual trip.

442657253.name: Iguanas iguanas everywhere
442657253.author: a TripAdvisor user
442657253.reviewBody: Very interesting visit to the iguanarium. I had already seen a couple of iguanas out and about, but it was really nice to see so many of them. They have pretty good camouflage but once you spotted one you noticed there were four more right next to it. They were all over the trees, just laying around. There were also some other animals there, raccoons, parrots and so on... If you get a chance to visit do it. Great for kids but interesting for all ages.

421154367.name: Mucho Iguanas
421154367.author: a TripAdvisor user
421154367.reviewBody: This place is crazy. The trees are full of iguanas there everywhere. You could spends hours trying to count them. Go back across the bridge and if your lucky you\'ll be able to feed them. They also have more animals available to see in cages. We go every year

396045789.name: Hundreds of Iguanas waiting for you to visit
396045789.author: a TripAdvisor user
396045789.reviewBody: I was taking a photo of an iguana sleeping in the tree, and it fell about eight feet to ground. It just shook itself and waddled back and climbed another. Wish I had shot a video! That is after I stopped laughing.\n\nThe Iguanas can be seen up in the trees from the street, but you can make a small donation and go inside and view them as they feed. There are also racoons and chickens inside.

366381173.name: Fun
366381173.author: a TripAdvisor user
366381173.reviewBody: Worth the visit.. very large and everywhere. .. we showed right and feeding time. After leaving we could now spot them everywhere now knowing what to look for.

359717737.name: iguanas everywhere
359717737.author: a TripAdvisor user
359717737.reviewBody: A fellow started out with a couple of iguanas for rehabilitation and now has over 300! They are usually seen up in the trees until it\'s feeding time and then they come down in a hurry. They are huge and colorful and make great photo ops! He also has some birds in cages, raccoons and other animals.

353985361.name: A special zoo for iguanas
353985361.author: a TripAdvisor user
353985361.reviewBody:
This is an amazing place.
The iguanas are huge and free.
Climbing trees and making noise.
Very nice!
And you choose how much to pay😄

350680474.name: CROSS BETWEEN A JUNKYARD, IGUANA SANCUARY AND A FARMYARD.  MUST SEE!!
350680474.author: a TripAdvisor user
350680474.reviewBody:
OK, it is not the San Diego zoo.

However the iguanas are dripping off the trees, and, some how, seem to know not to go out of the junkyard, err, sanctuary.
Seems like the local grocers donate spoiled green goods to the cause, the iguanas are not picky and are pretty OK with us humans hanging around.

There are a lot of them doing their iguana things, of all manner, living the good life in the old town of Manzanillo, easy walk from the big Marlin statue.
Really pretty amazing, kudos to the folks doing this, but possibly removing some junk would help the humans, however the iguanas didn't seem to mind the junk one bit.

Matter of fact they appeared to thrive on it all.

Worthwhile and interesting.
Recommended.

Throw a few pesos in the till.

349469828.name: Alas! It was closed
349469828.author: a TripAdvisor user
349469828.reviewBody: We took the local bus into town to visit this establishment. Once we actually found it, alas! It was closed. Unfortunately, there were no times posted on the gate. That said, our walk down Ave Mexico was enjoyable and I would return to Manzanillo just to go shoe shopping on that street. Also, there was a canal next to the iguana zoo where we saw crocodiles and trees overhanging the water were covered with dozens of iguanas, so our trip was not in vain.

346290989.name: Sooo Many
346290989.author: a TripAdvisor user
346290989.reviewBody: It\'s totally worth going to look at if you go downtown Manzanillo.  Its a nice walk and doesn\'t take very long to see.

342458064.name: I lots of iguanas.
342458064.author: a TripAdvisor user
342458064.reviewBody: I have never seen so many iguanas. We just pulled up next to the sanctuary and got out to take pictures of them. More than a dozen in just one tree and they were big. This is not something that you would spend even an hour at but it was really cool and great for photos.

341080933.name: very interesting place,
341080933.author: a TripAdvisor user
341080933.reviewBody: I recommend that everyone visit, There are hundreds of iguanas and my only regret is that I don\'t speak enough Spanish, I feel we would have learned so much more.

325519989.name: Iguanario Archudia Manzanillo, October 18, 2015
325519989.author: a TripAdvisor user
325519989.reviewBody: This place is amazing.  First of all it is free!  But please, make a donation.  It is well worth keeping this little gem accessible to the public.  Try to get there at noon like we did as they hand feed the iguanas bananas and cabbage.  The address is on a street called 21 de Marzo, but it is more easily accessed from a street called Francisco I. Madero, just past the Club de Leones (Lions Club).  Cross over the small lagoon (look for herons and white cranes here), and don\'t miss the iguana mural at the far end of the lagoon.  This will be the second bridge crossing the lagoon.  It is about 6 or 7 blocks from the Zocalo, the main plaza with the giant sailfish sculpture.

324749359.name: Must see !
324749359.author: a TripAdvisor user
324749359.reviewBody: Iguanas as big as cocker spanielas . Also Mex. racoons etc.Incredible. Leave a good donation - keep this going !

298470278.name: A good way to pass an hour in old Manzanillo
298470278.author: a TripAdvisor user
298470278.reviewBody: Let\'s be honest, there is not a lot in old Mazanillo.  All guests want to go there and after many years, this is the only thing I still enjoy every time.  Take your camera!

283392845.name: Interesting!
283392845.author: a TripAdvisor user
283392845.reviewBody: We stopped at the iguanario while in Manzanillo for a few days and were blown away by the amount of iguanas there! It\'s incredible. They are well taken care of and the staff is very friendly. We got to see them be fed and learned about the species a bit from Pedro. There are other animals there as well. The only thing that\'s a shame is some of the other animals don\'t have quite the space they probably need to really be fulfilled, but the iguanario is doing a great job considering they receive no federal funding or assistance. Definitely worth a quick visit if you\'re in the area.

265286148.name: So many Iguanas!
265286148.author: a TripAdvisor user
265286148.reviewBody: You must go here!  It was SO fun!  My son is 8 and he loved it!  Me too!  I was so impressed the owners take such great care of these Iguanas and give them such great care!

264109871.name: An Absolute MUST SEE while visiting Beautiful Manzanillo
264109871.author: a TripAdvisor user
264109871.reviewBody: We have visited the Iguanario several of times over the past four years and have always been amazed with the variety of Iguanas to see and yes, "interact" with. Of course, we have never touched an iguana here, but they are definitely close enough, but to be honest they look like little dinosaurs. The absolute best part of the entire experience is the price!! FREE!!, outside of an " absolute non-pressured" donation. I have read other reviews about being disappointed by a visit to this "attraction" and cannot believe it since my kids (all under 10) consider it an absolute highlight of our trip to Manzanillo. Let\'s remember, its FREE! As such it is far below market!! We always donate to help the operators with their expenses, not because we have to, but because we want to. If you think the best part of this place is from the street you are missing out! Take a trip inside and enjoy an incredible collection of animals, but most importantly the largest variety of Iguanas we have ever seen...anywhere!!

258994224.name: Very interesting
258994224.author: a TripAdvisor user
258994224.reviewBody: If you look Iguanas, you will love this family run santuary/zoo in Manzanillo. Free to the public, just give to donation. You will learn lots. Although it helps if you know some spanish.

198345957.name: Iguanas everywhere!
198345957.author: a TripAdvisor user
198345957.reviewBody: This is a small sanctuary for iguanas (and a few other animals) just on the edge of the downtown area of Manzanillo. You won\'t believe how many different sizes/types/colors there are. It is right along a city street about a block long so you can just walk up and see them right from the sidewalk.

196172606.name: Check it out from the road
196172606.author: a TripAdvisor user
196172606.reviewBody: The iguanas were cool, but the best part is seeing them in the trees and you can do that from the street.  we were really dissapointed.

195912158.name: Iguanas were very cool!
195912158.author: a TripAdvisor user
195912158.reviewBody: The iguanas were huge and plentiful here. I\'ve never seen so many or so big!  You can see them all basking in the sun in the trees. Very cool. When you go inside you can see the volunteers chopping food. There are also a few other animals like raccoons, turtles, tejon?, a pigs and some chickens. It\'s pretty rustic on the inside, but then agin  they don\'t charge for admission. Just request a donation. The people there were very friendly and you can tell they love they iguanas.

161183416.name: Worth the visit
161183416.author: a TripAdvisor user
161183416.reviewBody: Go spend some time here and hold an iguana!  Great place, please leave a donation.  This place is run totally on donations

151021415.name: Nice to visit but don\'t go inside
151021415.author: a TripAdvisor user
151021415.reviewBody: you can see the iguanas from the sidewalk.  Once inside it\'s a little depressing.  Couple racoons sharing a very small cage and several other animals tied up.

127096657.name: This was rather interesting
127096657.author: a TripAdvisor user
127096657.reviewBody: It was hard to find but well worth it, your best bet is to have a taxi take you.  It\'s not in the best part of town but I never felt threaten or concerned for my safety.

126940278.name: Spring Vacation in Manzanillo
126940278.author: a TripAdvisor user
126940278.reviewBody: This place was interesting and worth the trip of finding it, that is one thing that I would recommend that you find someone that knows where the place is.  I would the recommend this to everyone!

125347740.name: Don\'t go inside, unless you hate birds and animals
125347740.author: a TripAdvisor user
125347740.reviewBody: It\'s great to see the iguanas climbing onto the roof of the iguanario\'s tin shelter and clambering through the gutter below , but once you go through the gate it\'s quite depressing. About 15 pigeons and doves share a crowded cage with no room to stretch, while an exotic-looking bird cowers nervously and silent in the corner of his - both of these cages placed on the ground, which is additionally distressing for birds. A pig trussed up so tight he couldn\'t lie down if he wanted squeals against the far wall, while over by the bird cages a possum of some sort is leashed to a tree. Three raccoons in a small pen look like they could climb out if they wanted, but they\'re wearing collars, which is a bit strange.\n\nI would\'ve cut the pig\'s ropes if I had any idea what to do with him. Most of my group wandered out and sat by the tour bus waiting for our guide to come out because we wished we\'d never gone in.

125291980.name: Nice to see the iguanas, but you don\'t need to go inside
125291980.author: a TripAdvisor user
125291980.reviewBody: Dozens of iguanas visible from the road, in the trees and on the ground just over the wall by the sidewalk. We heard it was very smelly and dirty inside, so did not bother going in.

123946402.name: very good
123946402.author: a TripAdvisor user
123946402.reviewBody: very basic operation, well worth the trek to go see. Many varietes, most were in the trees, visible from the road. They accept donation.

120862438.name: Great Iguanas, and a cute tejon!
120862438.author: a TripAdvisor user
120862438.reviewBody: Hundreds of iguanas, large and small, orange and green, eating cabbage and hanging out in trees. A cute little tejon will climb up your arm. Chickens stand on iguanas. Very nice family!

118970903.name: Zoo in the old city
118970903.author: a TripAdvisor user
118970903.reviewBody: The Iguanario is in the heart of the old city of Manzanillo. You can walk 8 blocks south of the Zocalo on 21 de Marzo street. The canal will be on your left side and walk to the 3rd bridge then make a left to the entrance. The locals are very friendly and they will point you in the right direction. This sanctuary is run by one man who is raising iguanas, turtles and racoons. The animals are released into the wild once they mature. There is no entrance fee but there are steel milk containers that are donation boxes. The iguanas are not caged, hundreds of them roam around the property.

456035308.name: If you just want to chill with bear
456035308.author: a TripAdvisor user
456035308.reviewBody: The place is not so good if you are not tired or you are an energetic person. But if you just want to chill with a glass of beer, this is a good place

448142814.name: Small beach in centro Manzanillo.
448142814.author: a TripAdvisor user
448142814.reviewBody: This is a small beach at the end of the malecon in centro manzanillo.  I would not go out of my way to visit this place.  Lots of road construction in the area,

148644897.name: Too much trash in this beach.
148644897.author: a TripAdvisor user
148644897.reviewBody: No offense, but the locals are very uneducated when it comes to hygiene.  We even saw a used maxi pad floating on the water.  A big sign that says "no camping" is not enough unless the local government doesn\'t do something to turn this place into a real tourist attraction.  it\'s ok to come to San Pedrito.  Just don\'t come on Sundays when the locals have their day off.

651490970.name: Great walking now.
651490970.author: a TripAdvisor user
651490970.reviewBody: The beach has flattened out nicely since January. The morning fisherman haven\u2019t been catching anything lately, but surfcasting is popular with a chrome spoon. Whales and dolphins make occasional visits and the pelicans provide entertainment when they are dive bombing. People are surfing and swimming, but be wary of the places where you can riptides.

463713914.name: A resource for all and mixing place for many.
463713914.author: a TripAdvisor user
463713914.reviewBody: Wherever you stay in Manzanillo, this beach is a gem on the bus line.  Sweeping views of Santiago Bay, beautiful sand, sometimes surfing, boogie boards, public, and tons of fun.  Mid-way between points, tourist spots nearby, it is the playground for many...good for kids of all ages.

454531830.name: Scenic, decent waves
454531830.author: a TripAdvisor user
454531830.reviewBody: We especially like the artisans\' market located here, where we bought a lovely ceramic fish for only $2.

365513739.name: Manzanillo
365513739.author: a TripAdvisor user
365513739.reviewBody: It was a small seaside community down the coast from Manzanillo. The beach was nice but a lot of rubbish around and unfinished buildings. People were friendly and pleasant.

246808050.name: Lovely Walking Beach
246808050.author: a TripAdvisor user
246808050.reviewBody: The beaches extending across the bay forming the north lobe of the Manzanillo bay are lovely for walking.   The sand is firm under foot and can be beautiful, as the micas floating in the receding waves reflect the sun like flakes of gold!   At the west end of the beach is La Boqueta, with popular ramadas (thatched roof beach restaurants) selling seafood and fish.   Along the next stretch of beach, Miramar, there are lovely homes and condos and some hotels.   The section called Olas Altas (High Waves) is named such because on days with larger ocean swells the waves crash on the sand here - so it can be unattractive for families playing in the water in these conditions.   Overall this in perhaps our favorite walking beach area in Pacific Mexico.

193121758.name: Surfing and strong undercurrents - beware!
193121758.author: a TripAdvisor user
193121758.reviewBody: Well if you are an adept swimmer or you have a board to surf, this is the place for you, steep drop in the sand makes big waves that crash and create underwater cross currents that can pull you down and maybe drown you. So be carefull and keep that leash tight and board close.

137406917.name: A great local beach
137406917.author: a TripAdvisor user
137406917.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for waves you can boogie-board (even surf if you have a board), want to sip coconut water with rum splashed inside, and enjoy a long walk along the beach, this is the place. Although tons of locals on this beach and a few hawking their wares, we felt very safe and had a good many conversations.

389890708.name: Great getaway
389890708.author: a TripAdvisor user
389890708.reviewBody: Horseback riding a must on your next trip. Tip your tour guide and he will take you on a great tour.

262072188.name: Horses on a beach
262072188.author: a TripAdvisor user
262072188.reviewBody: This ride was about 2 hours, and private for just the 2 of us.  half was through the bush on trails, and then you were on the beach.  We stopped at a Barrio on the beach to let the horses rest in the shade, then we headed back.  this was a dream come true for me, and I loved every second.  Be prepared to ride in a Mexican saddle.  :) very different

187473145.name: Great fun!
187473145.author: a TripAdvisor user
187473145.reviewBody: The horses are pretty calm and no one had any problems.  I was the only "experienced"  rider in the group.  The scenery along the coast is fabulous and something none of us will ever forget!  The owners of horses were nice and certainly tried to make this a great experience.  For the price, you will have a great memory to keep!

561100760.name: Good Safe Diversion for an Hour or Two
561100760.author: a TripAdvisor user
561100760.reviewBody: Four of us stopped by the Casino Riviera to check it out and ended up spending an hour there playing slots (on the free 50 pesos they provided for new cardholders!). Surprisingly, a bit larger than it might appear on the outside, the casino has a fairly good cross-section of newer slot machines and some older stand-bys. Different payment system then we\u2019re used to - the casino puts money on a personalized slot card and it\u2019s inserted in the slot to play. Quite efficient system actually, no physical money to put in or chits to collect afterwards. Takes a while getting used to paying with centavos/pesos instead of the coinage we\u2019re familiar with though.\n\nWhile nothing on the scale of casinos in the US and Canada, it is fairly pleasant and bright inside with several sections, free coffee and water provided, and you pay for drinks. A manned metal detector is at the door and purses and packs are checked through before entry, which is good. We\u2019d visit again.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Miguel de la Madrid Hurtado 1058 Fracc. Playa Azul Col. Salagua

480670242.name: Remember, it is entertainment
480670242.author: a TripAdvisor user
480670242.reviewBody: They keep the casino up to date with new equipment and now a Bingo room. Secure off street parking or a taxi ride from your hotel.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Miguel de la Madrid Hurtado 1058 Fracc. Playa Azul Col. Salagua

292443923.name: been here several times
292443923.author: a TripAdvisor user
292443923.reviewBody: You can get a lunch or dinner in their dining area and the 100 Pesos meal is appied to your card to play with.\nThe food is Mexican fare and is fair to good.  the casino has a smoking area  and all wait staff is attentive.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Miguel de la Madrid Hurtado 1058 Fracc. Playa Azul Col. Salagua

651924266.name: ideal para ver el atardecer
651924266.author: a TripAdvisor user
651924266.reviewBody: una playa para visitar en el atardecer solamente ya que como playa no tiene mucho, pero unos atardeceres bellisimos, esta al sur de manzanillo

647595872.name: incredible secluded beach just south of the airport
647595872.author: a TripAdvisor user
647595872.reviewBody: This beach is hard to reach but quite a treasurer. We shared a 10KM ?long beach with 3 fishermen and 4 other people. In other words, nobody was there. \nNot good for swimming because of a dangerous under toe but I would guess that it is good for surfing????\n

593602214.name: Very natural
593602214.author: a TripAdvisor user
593602214.reviewBody: Locacte almost in a jungle,have own zipper for free. Every Saturday local market on the other side of street- recomended. To the right of hotel just on the corner is seniora she serve beautiful pine apple,coconut stuffed with lot of ingridients ( %$0 each) then yuo pass this fruits shop turn right and you have lagoon and crocodiles.

486237733.name: Nice getaway
486237733.author: a TripAdvisor user
486237733.reviewBody: Hubby and I returned to Playa de Oro for second year in a row. We find it to be a nice compact resort where you don\'t have to walk far for anything. Buffet, bars, pool and beach all within 5 minutes.  Return guests are treated extra special with a bottle of rum in our room, extra a la cartes and a private lobster and steak dinner show. Staff were friendly, "Orlando" in the main dining room was very attentive.  Evening shows were awesome.  We will return!

481905630.name: April/May 2017
481905630.author: a TripAdvisor user
481905630.reviewBody: Heard a lot of complains on here before I went to stay ...you have to visit by yourself; and like any vacation there\'s pros and cons...staff are amazing. I am not going to mentioning any names because I might miss somone.

362828095.name: Just Relaxing
362828095.author: a TripAdvisor user
362828095.reviewBody: The beach is a great place to relax, get wet and enjoy the ambiance.  The shrimp skewers and mango with chili powder is delicious!  Walk north along the beach and you will find shops and cafes.  We stopped at La Palapa for a beer.  We ordered guacamole and rellenos de fresco.  Incredible food and great service!

337366277.name: Perfect
337366277.author: a TripAdvisor user
337366277.reviewBody: The beach near the Vista Playa de Oro is perfection.  We\'ve gone to this beach many times over the last 10 years and never had a problem with the undertow or current.  We generally purchase boogie boards from the beach venders and spend hours playing in the surf.  Last visit we purchased fresh fish from some fisherman who were bringing in their catch on the beach, then took them to the restaurant at our hotel and they prepared them for us for dinner that night.  We love the lack of commercialism in the area.

273069414.name: Mexican tourist hotel and cheap europeans
273069414.author: a TripAdvisor user
273069414.reviewBody: food is for kids only and is very poor in the taste department, but if you have kids and not alot of money it is fantastic, the beach is scary, the under tow is treacherous! but it is clean and the staff do want to please

259680633.name: Alone with wave, and oh a flush toilet?
259680633.author: a TripAdvisor user
259680633.reviewBody: We walked from Maria\'s restaurant through small town of Culebra Colima to the playa along a golf course, Tuesdays is $45 pesos for 27 holes, to the Playo de Oro we were alone, a decaying stairway winds along the cliff up and down to a small beach with a beautiful arch in cliff where the waves crash through. It is a high energy beach and not for swimming.

202478585.name: Beautiful!
202478585.author: a TripAdvisor user
202478585.reviewBody: Very nice for long walks,little places to eat  and soak the sun!Not for swimming...the ways are huge,it is fun watching!

193121792.name: Manzanillo in its entirety is a Golden Beach
193121792.author: a TripAdvisor user
193121792.reviewBody: Manzanillo is the prime example of some of the planets evolution, so much Fools Gold in the sand means there were major changes in the ocean and Manzanillo is evidence of it. \n\nMost of the beach in Manzanillo has a Muddy feel with huge amounts of black sand and Fools Gold. Sort of annoying because it sticks and its hard to wash off.

163319130.name: Beautiful coach for sunning dangerous currents and waves
163319130.author: a TripAdvisor user
163319130.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous beach with white sand. If you look in either direction you will see no development whatsoever just mountains and palm trees. However I would not recommend swimming here the ways are very big in the current is dangerous. It is also quite isolated

152975918.name: Funny beach!
152975918.author: a TripAdvisor user
152975918.reviewBody: If is not a problem for you to be near of someone else.... Umbrellas ca be leased.  Sand and beach interesting.  Easy to swing in.

150455203.name: fun place..  lot\'s of local people
150455203.author: a TripAdvisor user
150455203.reviewBody: Excellent walking beach.. several nice little restaurants..  good place to just stroll around and watch the huge ships in the bay
